loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase baby calves to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Fideliz

texts.en:
Fideliz is 33 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling "nipa" in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like bamboo, nipa, etc. for her business.

Fideliz has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the "nipa" (palm frond mats used in construction) for five years and also earns an income from a general store.

Fideliz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional materials like bamboo, nipa (palm frond for mats) etc. for her business

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhum is a local rice cultivator who resides in Prey Chor district. Her husband makes an income by catching fresh fish in the pond and river. This family earns a profit about $4.5 per day to support their financial expenses. Mrs. Chhum has given birth to six children, two are married and four are single. Mrs. Chum works as a farmer, cultivating rice.  To improve their living standard, Mrs. Chhum would like to ask for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer so that she can have a successful crop this season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and and raw materials for doing farm.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 52-year-old widowed woman. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines with her three grown children. Six years ago, she started vending snack items for a living. 

Lucy earns an approximate monthly income of PHP 7,000 doing this job. In 2010, Lucy joined GDMPC for easy access to financial services. She had previously taken a loan from the organization. Now, Lucy is applying  for a loan of PHP 8,000 once more to buy food containers and snack items like bread, banana cake and more to sell. Lucy plans to own a more spacious food stall and earn more income in the future.

loans.use: To buy food containers and snack items like bread, banana cake and more to sell.

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is 49 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling "ban-ban" in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of "ban-ban" to sell.

Lorlyn has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling "ban-ban" for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending and gasoline retailing.

Lorlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of "ban-ban" (reeds) to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 38 years old, married and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Living with her are her four school-aged children. She started raising hogs last year for additional income. In her first year of business, she earned a monthly income of PHP 8,100. Earlier this year, Rowena filed her first loan transaction at GDMPC for PHP 10,000.00. The money is intended to purchase swine fattening products for quick and healthy growth. Rowena hopes for a good return on investment and hopes to raise more pigs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase pig fattening products

loans.name: Tacianita

texts.en:
Tacianita is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tacianita is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Tacianita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Tacianita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

Tacianita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Tacianita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Kak

texts.en: To be the head of family is a big responsibility of parents. Mrs. Kak never takes time to visit anywhere. She always cares about the living standards of her family nowadays. She has a grocery store in one market near her village. She earns about $3 per day. Her husband doesn’t laze at home. He takes time to sell junk goods around his village and other villages. He earns perhaps $3 per day also. Both of them would like a loan of $750 to purchase more junk goods.

loans.use: to purchase more junk goods to sell.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila, 59 years old and single, works very hard to provide for her family. For the past eight years she has been selling nipa (palms) in the Philippines, and is now requesting a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell. In the future Mila would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her nephew to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is forty years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school. Judy raises cattle in the Philippines and has done so for four years now.

Judy has taken out loans eight times from NWTF. She is now requesting a 19,500 PHP loan to purchase more cattle.

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 36 years old and married with two school-aged children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Even before she got married, it was Merilyn’s passion to raise pigs. She has done so for the past ten years. She earns an income of 5,780 PHP monthly.

In 2007 Merilyn became a member of GDMPC. She is now requesting another loan, this time of 10,000 from GDMPC. The money will be used to purchase additional piglets to raise. Merilyn hopes to sell her pigs at a very good price and continue raising profitable ones.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 38 years old, married and has six dependents. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines.

Five years ago Mercidita opened her sari-sari store, earning a monthly income of 10,080 PHP. Her family's daily expenses are covered by her income.

In 2010 she became a member of GDMPC. Mercidita is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more products to sell and to sustain her family’s livelihood. With the loan, Mercidita hopes to boost her income and improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.en: Froilan is 28 years old and lives in the peaceful village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has one child enrolled in school, and makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store which he opened three years ago. He earns PHP 16,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to buy additional groceries to sell to his customers. This is his first loan from GDMPC and he is committed to use it to successfully expand his store and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling nipa in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock for her nipa business.

Rosie has been in this business for eight years. Rosie earns additional income from food vending.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto is a 45-year-old fisherman living in Dauis, Bohol. He is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets and gas for his pump boat. This loan will help him continue running his business and catch more fish to sell.

Antonieto works hard to support his family of a wife and 4 children. His oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest is 5. 

In the future, Antonieto hopes to buy another pump boat and renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gas for his pump boat

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs.Sok is 33 years old and her husband is 58. She earns a living as a farmer and by raising ducks. Her husband earns a living by selling sugar made from palm in the busiest market in their area. Like his wife, he earns about $5 a day. Mrs.Sok is applying for a loan for $550 to buy more sugar for her husband to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar for her husband to sell in a local market.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 57 years old and a widow with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Candida runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Candida has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, eggs, milk, sugar, spices, etc. 

In the future, Candida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario is a 51-year-old fisherman living in Dauis, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 20 years. Darios is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks, gas for a boat and school materials for his kids. This loan will help Dario catch more fish to sell.

Dario works hard to support his family of a wife and 2 children.

In the future, Dario hopes to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and gas for a boat and school materials for his kids

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a married woman with four living dependents. She is a good community member of  Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Four years ago, she began cultivating her farm to earn a living. She grows a good variety of rice in her farm. She typically earns a total of PHP 5,000 a month.

Nanette is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC. This is her fourth loan taken out from the cooperative. This will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to protect plants from harmful pests. Nanette hopes for a bountiful harvest and to be able to cultivate additional farmland to earn more.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers  and pesticides.

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Mrs. Si and her husband support their family of five through their crop planting business.  They plant rice and some vegetables together. Together, they earn about $6 per day. They would like a loan to expand their farming business.

loans.use: to expand their crop planting business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 24 years old while the youngest is only 8. Isabel's husband works as a fisherman.

Isabel runs a tailoring business. She makes school uniforms and provides general alteration & tailoring services to the people in her commmunity. Isabel earns about 7000 PHP per month doing her business. She plans to use her loan to purchase needles, thread, cloth and other tailoring materials. Isabel hopes to earn better and be able to pay her children's school fees and buy school materials.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, cloth and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin is a 31-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Chin is married to Navuth, age 35. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have given birth to two children: all of the children are single. The rainy season is approaching and it is the best time to plant crops.  Therefore, Mrs. Chin would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and seeds for planting. Mrs. Chin and her husband were shown in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en:
Wendelyn is a 30-year-old married woman. At this young age, she already has five children to attend to. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Three years ago, she began doing this service-based activity. Total earnings of PHP 2,000 are generated per month. It is definitely a meager amount to cover day-to-day expenses. 

Wendelyn applied for a loan in GDMPC worth PHP 10,000. The money will be used to purchase motor accessories for a good quality service. Wendelyn hopes to improve the business and earn more.

loans.use: To purchase motor accessories for good  quality service.

loans.name: La Playita  De San  Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes de éste grupo decidieron poner el nombre de "La playita de san L.", por que cerca de su comunidad esta un río que casi no tiene agua, parece playa.
Este grupo cuenta con diez integrantes  que tienen que reunirse cada catorce días para realizar sus pagos . El representante del grupo se llama Altagracia, tiene cuarenta y dos años de edad, estudio hasta  quinto grado de primaria, y tiene dos hijos, una mujer Karina  de catorce años de edad estudia  segundo grado de la secundaria y Felipe de  veinte años de edad  estudia  el tecnológico en la ciudad de pinotepa  la licenciatura  de contaduría.
Ella se  dedica a la venta de pollos desde  hace  veinte años atrás , esta muy contenta  por todo lo que a  logrado desde  hace veinte años, gracias a su negocio a podido ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan seguir  estudiando y a su esposo  Antonio en los gastos de la casa.
Sus clientes le recomiendan que venda cena en las noches por que cocina muy bien en ocasiones va su hija a vender tacos cuando no tiene clases para ayudarle a su mamá  ya que ella le prepara todo en la noche y su hija los ofrece en el mercado donde ella trabaja.
Pidió el  préstamo para comprar mas pollos,  ya que le va muy bien  tiene muchos clientes , obtiene muy buenas  ganancias  hace tres meses empezó a vender pollo por mayoreo .
Esta muy contenta  por que todo lo que  se propone poco a poco  lo va logrando , le  da  las gracias a  fundación  realidad     por  ayudarla  a  cumplir sus sueños y  volar mas alto hasta  alcanzar todo lo que tiene planeado para sus hijos y esposo.
Las otras  nueve integrantes se llaman:

Catalina- se dedica a la venta  de barrotes.
Miguel- se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras.
Ciria – se dedica a la venta de a la venta de barrotes.
Guadalupe- se dedica  a la venta de a la venta de abarrotes.
Celerina- se dedica a la venta de   carnes frías.
Verónica- se dedica a la venta  de  ropa.
Sofía- se dedica a la venta de  de ropa bordadas.
Adela- se dedica a la venta de  pollos.
Leticia- se dedica a la venta de a la venta de pollos.

Le dan las gracias a fundación  por ayudarlas a volar y  cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
The members of this group decided on the name "La playita de San L.", meaning "The little beach of San L.". They chose the name because close to their community there is a river that has almost run dry and it looks like a beach.

This group is made up of ten members and they meet every two weeks to make their payments. The representative of this group is named Altagracia. She is forty-two years old and she has a grade five education. She has two children, a fourteen year-old girl named Karina who is in grade eight and Felipe who is twenty-two years old and he is in attends college in the city of Pinotepa. He is studying accounting.

She has been selling poultry for the past twenty years. She is very happy for all that she has been able to accomplish for the last twenty years. Thanks to her business she has been able to keep her children in school and she has been helping her husband Antonio with her household expenses. 

Her clients have been requesting that she serve dinner in the evenings for the delicious foods she prepares. Whenever her daughter doesn't have class she helps her to sell tacos that she prepares overnight. Her daughter sells them in the market where she works. 

She requests a loan to purchase more poultry. The business is going well and she has many clients. She obtains very good earnings. Three months ago she started to sell poultry in wholesale.

She is very happy because everything she sets out to do she is able to gradually accomplish. She is thankful to Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner) for their help in attaining her dreams and for helping her fly high enough to accomplish all of the plans she has for her children and for her husband.

The other nine members are the following: 

Catalina - she sells groceries.
Miguel - he sells fruits and vegetables.
Ciria - she sells groceries.
Guadalupe - she sells groceries.
Celerina - she sells cold cuts.
Veronica - she sells clothing.
Sofia - she sells embroidered clothing.
Adela - she sells poultry.
Leticia - she sells poultry.

They are thankful to Fundacion for helping them fly and for helping them attain their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Being the head of the family is a big responsibility for a parent. Nguon is a cake seller in a market near her village. She is always concerned about her family, never taking time off to go visiting others. She earns about $2 a day.

As for her husband, he doesn’t laze around home. He sells secondhand goods around his and other villages. He also earns perhaps $2 a day. Both of them would like a loan of $750 to purchase more secondhand goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand goods to sell.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 28 years old, married and has three young children. She is a residence of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

While cars are only one part of living, they must be cared for. Two years ago Gerlie started selling spare auto parts and tires and earns a monthly total of 3,000 PHP.

Earlier this year, Gerlie became a GDMPC member. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy spare auto parts and tires to replace old ones.

Gerlie hopes to sustain her family’s livelihood and plans for other business ventures to generate a better life for them.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts and tires to replace old ones.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
From the Philippines, Imelda is fifty years old and married with two children. She has earned a living by farming sugarcane for 25 years. She also earns additional income by raising pigs and running a sari-sari store.

Imelda is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her businesses and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 58 years old. She is married and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Magdalena runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 8 years. She also earns an income from raising livestock and vending food.  

Magdalena has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory for her customers and to use as working capital. She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan.  

Magdalena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en:
Marijen is 32 years old and has a fish selling business. This business has been running for 4 years. Marijen's husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch at the market. Marijen also buys more fish from other fishermen so she would have more to sell.

Marijen has 5 children and the oldest child is 6 years old. 

Marijen earns about 3000 PHP per month and works hard to support her family.

Marijen has requested this loan to buy fishing materials such as nets & hooks and more fish for sale. In the future, Marijen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as nets & hooks and more fish for sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea is a 50 year old farmer.  Mrs. Chea has been married for many years and has five children.  To supplement her farming income, she and her husband collect recyclable materials and sell them to a wholesaler.  The wholesaler exports the materials in bulk.  They primarily collect electrical wires and plastic. Mrs. Chea and her husband are looking for a loan to use as capital to buy additional goods that they can sell to their wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more used-goods to stock up for selling.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children.

Jacqueline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Jacqueline has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying & selling rice and charcoal.

Jacqueline aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita is 48 years old. She is married and takes good care of her two grown children. She permanently resides in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For four years of being in a service-based type of business activity, Bernandita earns a monthly income of PHP 2,500.00.

Bernandita has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase durable motor parts to keep the motor in good running condition, to sustain her livelihood. Bernandita hopes to expand her business and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase durable motor parts to keep the motor in good running condition.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married and has 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 43 years old and her 2 children are in school.

Judith has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Judith has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Judith has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Myrna has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Adelia has been in this business for 12 years. Adelia earns more income from her variety store.

Adelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea is a garment worker. Her husband is now is a Tuk Tuk taxi driver (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi). The couple just has one baby. 
Sochea is staying with her parents, brothers and sisters in a village along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is applying for a loan because she wants to build her own house and live separately.

Photo: Sochea is standing under her parents’ house with her husband.

loans.use: To build her own house to stay in

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 47 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 20,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 51 years old and has a fish selling business. This business has been running for 33 years. Rufina's husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch at the market. She also buys directly from fishermen so she would have more fish to sell.

Rufina has 7 children, the oldest is 31 years old and the youngest 18.

Rufina earns about 8000 PHP per month and works hard to support her family.

Rufina has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, fish containers and more fish for sale. In the future, she hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, fish containers and more fish for sale

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is married with six children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lily is 37 years old. 

Lily has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines. Lily requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of cement, gravel and sand for her business.

Lily has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cement, gravel and sand

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 25 years old. She is married, has two little kids, and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Annabelle has been growing crops of different classes for two years. By doing so, Annabelle makes a monthly income of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).

In 2009, Annabelle joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for preparing the land. She hopes to expand her agricultural business and make the best production possible.

loans.use: To pay for preparing land for farming

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: It is a big responsibility of parents to be the head of the family. Mrs. Pon never takes time to visit or talk free with someone else. She always takes care of the living standards of her family. Nowadays she is a farmer. When she takes time from this business, Mrs.Pon sells cakes around her village. She earns about $2 per day. Talking to her husband, he is an excellent person who always take care of her and all their children. Mrs. Pon wishes to loan perhaps $250 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and a pumping machine.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and a pumping machine.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (pictured above) and her husband, Chanthorn, live on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two married daughters. One lives in separated home and another one still lives in family home. 

Yat is a weaver. She is requesting another loan in the amount of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business because it is a traditional profession business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old and the mother of seven children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Cristina has been engaged in a service-based business and she has sold spare motor parts for the past four years. She generates about 2,000 PHP each month.

Cristina is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan with GDMPC to purchase spare parts and renew services. This is her first loan with GDMPC. In the future, Cristina hopes to expand her business and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ma. Merlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Merlinda is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Ma. Merlinda has run a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other grocery items like snacks and noodles. 

Ma. Merlinda  is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell including milk, groceries, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 60 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, she has run a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as sugar and soap, along with grocery items like snack food and noodles.

Perla is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: It is a big responsibility of the parent to be the head of the family. Mrs. Sin never takes time to visit or talk freely with someone else. She always takes care of how to earn more cash for her family. Nowadays she is a farmer. When she takes time from this business, Mrs Sin is a fish seller around her village. She earns about $2.5 per day. Talking to her husband, he is a supreme person who always takes care of her and all their children. He works as a construction worker in his community. Mrs. Sin wishes a loan of perhaps $250 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pumping machine.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and a pumping machine.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Mrs. Say is a 46 year old domestic farmer who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. Since 1997, Mrs. Say has primarily supported herself through her farming business and is making an income around $1.4 each day to use for daily expenses.  Her husband works in the construction field as a domestic construction worker, and earns a profit around US$1.5 a day to share with his wife. In order increase her income, Mrs. Say would like to ask for a loan to buy some ducklings and duck food for breeding.  Mrs. Say has four children, all of whom are single, two of whom are working in a shoe factory.

loans.use: to buy duck-foods and some duckling for breeding purpose.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en: Mrs. Chhan, age39, earns an income by selling many vegetables in one wooden store near her village in Chey Chor district.  Her husband is a rice farmer, and he generates his income by planting crops every year. They have given birth to three kids; one of the children is working as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh and is getting a formal salary each month. Mrs. Chhan would like to request a loan to pay for medical fees.

loans.use: to pay for medical/doctor fees

loans.name: Marmie

texts.en: Marmie is married with 1 school-aged child. Marmie is 27 years old and lives in Mayor’s Village, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Marmie has a parlor shop business. She has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000. Marmie has requested a loan for 30,000 for land redemption. Marmie has been a member of PMPC for over 2 years. In the future, Marmie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to redeem land

location.town: Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 34 years old and has two children. The eldest child is in class one and the second child is not of school-going age yet. Her husband works in the factory at a meager income. In order to fulfill the needs of her family, Samina does embroidery. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. She prepares beautiful dresses by crafting beautiful embroidered clothes. She also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well and has proved herself as a very responsible housewife. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in bulk quantity, which will allow her to offer better quality work to her customers and earn more profits. She is very experienced in her work and has been doing it for past seven years. She hopes that an investment will bring even more profits to her and help improve the living standard of her family. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Samina.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Toun

texts.en: A sweet couple regularly thinks about how to make more income. Presently both of them are farmers. They have given birth to only one child. Mrs.Tuon is 21 years old and her husband is 23 years old. Both of them would like to borrow about $500 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials to support her business. In the future, she will send her child to study for a high degree like the rich family in her community. She and her baby appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat has been working in farming for many years ago. She has a good skill for plant different kind of crops on her existing. In average, she could get an income $2.5 a day. Her husband always helps assist her in the farm field as well. Aside this, Mrs. Sat’s husband also used his old motorbike to run a motor service in the busy market for additional profits. The couple blessed with four children and two of them works as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh City of Cambodian. For the rest, they still study in local school yet. Rainy season is coming now, and it is the best sign for planting all kinds of crop. Therefore, Mrs. Sat has requested some fund from Kiva to buy bean seeds for planting. She really hopes that she could get a good result from her planting. Mrs. Sat was taken a photo with her husband. With her future plan, she wishes to purchase a plowing machine, to decorate her old house, and to support her children to finish the high level of education.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 44 years old and married. Her spouse, Jaime, is a farmer and, in addition, owns a welding and vulcanizing shop. The couple is blessed with four children. The eldest finished his studies and is already working. Two others are in college level and the youngest is an elementary student. Though three of her children are still attending school, Dolores is so grateful because she and her husband can sustain the needs of their family. Like her husband, Dolores is into two businesses. AsiD. from the general store, she also manages a hog raising business. Dolores has been managing her general store for 25 years now and earns PHP 3,000 a month. She uses her income in the store for livestock feed and as revolving capital to buy commodities for her store.

Due to expensive basic commodities and expenses of her children, Dolores would like to ask for a loan amounting of PHP 30,000 to buy some additional groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, ingredients, shampoo and other kinds of groceries. 

In the future, Dolores hopes to expand her general store to sustain the needs of her children and send them into a higher level of education. She then hopes that she could avail her loan request so that she could supply all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, ingredients, canned goods, shampoo and baked breads

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma owns and manages a general store in their bario (village). She is 56 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works on their farm planting rice and vegetables for their food consumption and to sell. She is doing her best to make further improvement in her store to help provide the needs of her family. 

She has been in the retail business for almost 10 years now earning an average net income of PHP 9,000 each month. She uses the income for their food needs, clothing and allowances of her children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy sugar, junk foods, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell in her store situated in the bario.

loans.use: to buy sugar, junk foods, frozen foods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Cultivating rice is part of 31-year-old Mrs. Long’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Bunthorn, assists her with the farm work. On the other hand, the family also works at brick kiln as workers to generate extra profit. They have two children who rely on their income. As this is a rainy season, the couple thinks that they will start to plant crops as annual. But they still have no enough funds to plant. Hence, Mrs. Long would like to ask for loan to pay for plowing costs, to hire domestic laborers to transplant seeding and also to buy fertilizers for her crop growing. Mrs. Long picture a photo with her husband under their house.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, to hire domestic laborers to transplant seeding and also to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Muhabbatshoh

texts.en:
For the past six years, Muhabbatshoh has worked in agriculture, raising cattle. He raises cattle, which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Muhabbatshoh showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. For Muhabbatshoh, it is very important to work at raising his animals. That is why he is currently seeking a loan to purchase additional cattle to earn more money. That will help his family to generate additional income. Muhabbatshoh appreciates your support for his project.      

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: To help the family gain prosperity, Mrs. Nan works as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh. She earns about $3 per day. Her  husband doesn’t stay at home; he goes to their farm everyday. Both of them have given birth to five kids. But now some of them are working and earning suitable salaries each month. Mrs. Nan wants a loan of $1,100 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials to earn more than other years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 30 years old, married and a mother to two infant-age children. Cristina's spouse works as a farmer producing rice for sale and food consumption. 

She has had a  business buying and selling fruits and vegetables for four years now to make a living. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to be used to purchase various fruits and vegetables to sell. Cristina buys her products in remote villages in their province and bring these to sell in the market.   

In the future, Cristina would like to improve the business she manages in order to earn a higher income to further support the growing needs of her family and eventually save for the future comfort of her family.

loans.use: to purchase various fruits and vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: It is the big responsibility of parents to be head of the family. .Mrs. Orn never takes time to visit anywhere. She always cares about the living standards of her family. Nowadays she is a grocery seller in one market near her village. She earns about $4 per day. Her husband doesn’t laze at home. He takes time to work selling junk goods around their village and other villages. He earns perhaps $3 per day also. Both of them would like a loan of $700 in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo, 57 years old, is married to a farmer with four grown-up children. Her family lives in the Philippines, their native land. She has operated a "sari sari store" (a community-based store) to make a living for her family for almost a year.   

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy different groceries such as canned goods and drinks to sell in her store. She dreams of seeing improvement in the business five years from now. Her business monthly income is usually spent to maintain their immediate needs at home.

loans.use: to buy different groceries such as canned goods and drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Khận

texts.en: It is a big responsibility of the parents to be the head of the household. Mr. Khan never takes time to visit anywhere. He always cares about the living standards of his family.  Nowadays, he is a construction worker. He earns about $3 per day. As for his wife, she doesn’t laze at home. She takes time to work as a fish seller. She earns perhaps $3 per day also. Both of them would like a loan of about $250 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 57 years of age, widowed and has four children. She has owned and managed a general store for almost five years now. She is earning an average net profit of PHP 7,000 each month. She wants to improve her store for stability to satisfy their basic needs at home and help finance the education of her grandchildren.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy stocks of soft drinks, junk foods, coffee, sugar, breads and canned goods to sell in her general store. Pilar also plans to put up another income-generating project to expand her ventures in the business to ensure big profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, coffee, sugar, breads and canned goods to sell

location.town: Hill top Nagsabaran, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an oven.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 52 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, she has run a variety retail store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from raising pigs. She has repaid 18 previous loans from NWTF. 

Carmelita is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional meat (cow, pig, chicken, etc.) to sell for her business. Cristina has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat to sell in her butcher shop

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling dried fish and salt in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her business for two years. She also earns an income by providing motorcycle transportation services and by raising pigs. Jonalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en:
Adolfa is 41 years old and married with three children aged 15, 13, and 4. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Adolfa has been engaged in farming for nine years. She tills land located in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her husband. She grows rice crops and then sells her harvest at the market.

Adolfa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Meksida

texts.en:
Meksida's husband has died, and she lives together with her school-going younger son. 

Meksida is a tailor. She has been successfully running the business for many years, and now she is known as a good tailor in the city. 

Meksida would like to sew coverings for furniture and help her elder son in running his own business of furniture making. With the requested loan Meksida plans to purchase fabrics. 

Collaboration between Meksida and her son will promote the businesses of both. This will also bring additional income to Meksida.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling fruit and candies in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fruits and candies to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 17 years. Marilyn earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fruits and candies to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice. Melinda is borrowing PHP 24,000 from NWTF to purchase additional materials needed for her beauty salon business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed for her beauty salon

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 52-year-old mother with two adult children. Her husband's occupation is farming. They both work hard for the improvement of their living situation. 

She manages a beauty salon offering services such as hair cutting, pedicure and manicure to customers. The business has been operating for 12 years already. Her income from the business is spent to finance their daily expenditures. 

To improve the services offered in the salon, Lolita is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy the needed materials and cosmetics such as scissors, comb, razors, hair iron, and chemicals for hair relaxing, hair rebonding and hair spa.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs, razors, hair iron, and chemicals for hair relaxing, hair rebonding and hair spa.

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Edferina's Group

texts.en:
Edferina is 49 years old, married and has a daughter who is studying in class 5th. Edferina has studied until intermediate. She operates a tuition center at her home and teaches different subjects to her students. She is also a very good housewife.She performs her household duties very actively and takes care of her child very well.  Her husband works in a government sector for a low income. 
 
Edferina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her tuition center. With the loan, she will buy furniture and books to provide better learning facilities to her students. 
  
She has been operating her tuition center for the past four years and hopes that after the loan, she will be able to provide better facilities to her students and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy furniture and books

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa, 34, is married with five children, aged 9 months to 11 years. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. With her earnings from farming, Alisa is able to provide food for her family and to send her children to school.

Alisa is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She hopes to be a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arzuman

texts.en:
Arzuman lives together with his wife. He is a driver. He does various transportation jobs with his two lorries. 

Unfortunately, the lorries are old and need new accessories to work effectively. 

With the requested loan, Arzuman plans to purchase new wheels for his trucks. With new wheels, Arzuman will do his work with more quality, meet his clients' demand and attract new customers. This means additional income and better living conditions for Arzuman.

loans.use: to pay for new wheels for his trucks.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol, 44, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Mirasol operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Mirasol earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the unit. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mirasol hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is a 48-year-old married woman with 11 children living in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. The oldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is 12.

Charita and her husband are both farmers. She helps him till the land where they grow rice crops. Charita works hard to support her family. She said it is not easy sometimes because they have a big family. But Charita is still happy with her life.

Charita is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes to start another business that would help augment their income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat lives together with his wife and son, who has recently returned from the army. 

Ararat keeps livestock and cultivates land. He would like to plant trees, but he doesn't have a water-supply system to water the orchard. 

With the requested loan, Ararat plans to purchase a water pump and pipes. After developing the orchard, Ararat will not only sell fresh fruits, but he will also dry fruits and make jams to sell and increase his income. 

Additional income will help Ararat to insure a brighter future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a water pump and pipes.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 26 years old and has two children.

Cresencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cresencia has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for five years and earns additional income from selling gasoline.

Cresencia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is age 36 and has been in farming for over 10 years in Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya. She employs two farmhands. She is married with four children between 15 and 3 years old. Her farm produces milk that she sells at the local market.

Milcah has made a first loan request of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy proceeds will enable her to educate her children. She has her eyes focused on buying a vehicle to help her transport her produce to the market as well make deliveries for other farmers.

She points to dairy diseases as her greatest challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
This is Rolinda, 41, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Federico, a bus inspector, and mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide continuous income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. A dream for most poor Filipino parents like Rolinda, as she herself has been an undergraduate, she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Rolinda operates a market stall. She sells meat, fish and vegetable products in the community market. She buys a quantity of meat, fish and vegetables and sells it per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more meat, fish and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rolinda dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for meat, fish and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Gerelmaa, 45, lives with her husband, 43, in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her husband, Mr.Khureltulga, has run a transportation business since 2001 and since 2009 she supports him in his business as a conductor. They have both gained a lot of experience in this business field but couldn't save very much.

The couple owns an old house and wooden fence on a small piece of land. Recently, it has become too bad and uncomfortable to live in, as for a long time, they could not make any repairs or adjustments. Therefore, Gerelmaa is taking a loan to make repairs to her house and fence.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house and fence.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is married and her husband operates a business selling sweetmeat. He is well known in his area for the taste of his sweets and earns a reasonable income from his business every month. 

Rehana is a housewife who stays at her home and does her household responsibilities. She also helps her husband in his business by preparing sweets for his shop. She is a very caring mother and raises her children very well. She has given birth to eight children. Only two of them are able to attend school due to poor financial conditions.
  
Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the required ingredients such as milk, sugar and dried fruits to make better quality sweetmeat for his customers and to increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past eight years and has good experience in his business. Rehana hopes that an investment will be more productive for him and increase his income. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. 

Note:  In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for sweetmeat

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has one child.

Khaled has been the owner of a laundry since 2010. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.


He is requesting $2700 to renovate and to change the decoration of his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To renovate and change the decoration of his shop.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Editha works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Editha is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 57 years old and married with 7 children. Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like noodles, groceries, etc.. She has been running the sari-sari store for 27 years and also earns an income from coconut farming and selling slippers. Emelia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Emelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is trading in fruits and vegetables from a rented booth. He has been engaged in this business for two years. Armen would like to increase the variety of products and develop his business further. This loan will help him to increase his sales and get more income. 

Additional income will help Armen expand his business by opening a new shop. He will also provide better living conditions for his family. Armen lives together with his wife and school-aged son.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 43, is married with five children. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for seven years. Her husband mainly manages their farm. Elena also runs a sari-sari store, selling items like packed noodles, shampoo, canned goods and other products. She earns about 2,500 PHP a month from her store.

Elena is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and other farming supplies. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira keeps livestock. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but the income is barely enough to meet their ends. Elmira would like to increase the livestock and develop agriculture. With the requested loan she plans to purchase calves and forage. Development of agriculture will help Elmira to increase her profit and improve her family's living conditions. Elmira lives together with her husband.

loans.use: to pay for calves and forage.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida, 54, is a widow and sole parent of five children. She works hard to generate income from her rice retailing business in their village. With this business, she is able to sustain the needs of her children.

Leonida wants to buy five cavans of milled rice to retail and to buy new products, such as canned goods, to sell in her stall. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to pursue this business improvement.

From three years managing the business, she estimates her average net income at 2,000 PHP per month, which is used in providing for her family's basic needs and for further business development.

loans.use: to buy five cavans of milled rice to retail and to buy for new products, such as canned goods, to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Gilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Gilda has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the store for 7 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Gilda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and lives with seven family members. Three of the family members work.

Haydar has been an owner of a store selling mobiles and accessories since 2008.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, a good reputation and is well known in his area.
 
He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors and aluminum showcases. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors and aluminum showcases.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is married and her husband operates a grocery store in the market. He has recently started this business three months ago and needs a loan to put stock in his store such as spices, sugar, rice and cooking oil. Therefore, Ghazala has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for this purpose. 

She operates a plastic bottle making business. She receives orders from different factories and fulfills their orders on time to earn profits. She is very supportive and started her business in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She is the mother of four children. Only her eldest son is able to attend school. The others remain at home. 

She is hopeful that with the extensive grocery stock, her husband will be able to increase his clientele base and his income as well. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ghazala.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 31, is single. He is a boda boda operator and has been in this business for the last two years. 

This is his first loan with KADET and he plans to expand his business by purchasing fuel for his mini fueling station. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to expand his business further.

Michael’s dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing fuel for his mini fueling station.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 39, is a married woman with two children, aged 14 and 7. Her husband is a rice mill operator.

Elsa is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for seven years. Elsa also runs a small sari-sari store, selling items like sugar, vinegar and canned goods. Elsa works hard to support her family.

Elsa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks. She dreams for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and more items to sell such as canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 49-year-old mother who is married with one child. She manages a hog raising business to create income for a living. The income she generates from the business is a big help to her husband (a farmer) in financing the studies of their children and necessities at home. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy piglets to raise and feed. This has been a newly opened business for almost a year now. She has earned PHP 2,000 net income in her previous pig disposal. Her income from the business was used to invest in the education of her children. In the future, Pacita is hoping to increase her income in the business to create a stable source of livelihood for her family.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Irene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 26 лет. Разведена. У нее пятеро детей. Замира живет вместе с родителями. У нее средне - специальное образование. Она работает кассиром в средней школе. Кроме того она два года как занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этом ей помогают ее родители и брат. Она берет кредит для закупа коровы с теленком.
texts.en: Zamira lives in Yavan. She is 26 years old, divorced, and has five children. Zamira lives with her parents. She has a vocational education. She works as a cashier in a high school. Additionally, she has worked in animal husbandry for two years. She breeds cattle for sale. In so doing, she helps her parents and brother. She is taking out a loan to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family by buying and selling charcoal.  She has requested an 11,000 Philippine peso loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid back eight loans from Kiva field partner NWTF before this loan. She has had her charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.  She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Aubrey

texts.en:
Aubrey, 23 and single, has been in the transportation business for the last three years. This is his first loan from KADET and with it he plans to buy another motorcycle. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. 

His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Davit

texts.ru:
Давит родился в 1980 г. в городе Капане, там же окончил среднюю школу. Давит женат и имеет двух дочерей: старшей 3 года, младшей год. В рабочие часы за детьми ухаживает бабушка, так как жена Давита работает в Сюникском полицейском управлении сопровождающей женщин-заключенных. 
Сам Давит занимается частным бизнесом начиная с 2008 г.: на своем собственном автомобиле КАМАЗ занимается грузоперевозками из города Капана в Иранскую республику, город Джулфа. За месяц Давит совершает две поездки по маршруту Капан-Джулфа-Капан, продолжительность каждой поездки составляет от 8 до 10 дней. Давит говорит, что работа дальнобойщика сложна и требует большой концентрации внимания на протяжении всего маршрута. Давит гордится тем, что благодаря своему бизнесу он может содержать свою семью.   
Благодаря прибыли, полученной от перевозок Давит содержит свою семью 
Давиту необходим кредит на сумму в 1,000,000 драм для ремонта двигателя своего КАМАЗ-а.
texts.en:
Davit was born in 1980 in the town of Kapan where he graduated from secondary school. Davit is married and has two daughters: his oldest daughter is three years old and youngest is one. During working hours the children are looked after by grandmother because Davit's wife works in the Suniksky police department as a warden in the female prison.

Davit does own business since 2008. On his own KAMAZ truck he transports freights from Kapan to the town of Djulfa in the Iranian republic. In a month Davit makes two trips by route Kapan-Djulfa-Kapan each trip lasting 8-10 days. Davit says that the job of a trucker is very difficult and demands high level of concentration during the entire length of the trip. Davit is proud that because of his business he can support his family. Thanks to the income he receives from the freight transportation he is able to do that.

Davit needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 dram to repair the engine of his KAMAZ vehicle.

loans.use: to repair truck engine

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Margaret, 33, is a hardworking business lady. She is married and blessed with three school-going children. For the past 11 years, she has been running a general shop to make a living, supplementing this with earnings from engaging in dairy farming. In the next five years, she wants to have upgraded her shop into a mini-supermarket. Her dream is to be financially stable.

Margaret is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two bags of sugar, a bag of rice, maize flour and a carton of bar soap. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two bags of sugar, a bag of rice, maize flour and a carton of bar soap.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and married with six children.  She earns a living by farming rice, which she has been doing for a year.  She also earns income from selling vegetables.

Lolita is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through Kiva field partner NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand, 41, is married with three children. His spouse works overseas as a domestic helper. Ferdinand is a farmer working in the Philippines. He earns an average of 15,000 PHP each cropping season, which is usually in April and November.

He plants and harvests rice for future sale and has been doing this for 20 years. He wants to improve his rice crop and thus would like a loan of 10,000 PHP to cover labor fees for tilling and other preparation needed in his field. He also wants to buy farming supplies, such as seeds to plant and fertilizer, to maintain a good harvest.

In the future, Ferdinand hopes to give his children an education through his income from farming. He also wants to someday live comfortably together with all his family members.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for tilling and other preparation needed in his rice field and to buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizer to maintain a good harvest.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a jeweler and her second son has a mobile repair shop. Her daughters are studying in a local school. 

She is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband is a jeweler by profession. He makes gold and silver jewelry sets and also sells artificial jewelry. He has a good number of clients in his area because he offers them jewelry at very reasonable rates. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s jewelry business. With the loan, he will buy artificial jewelry sets to sell in his shop. He has been operating his business for the past 28 years and Misbah is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 57, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Maximo, a farmer, and is the mother of two children who already have their own families. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Josefina operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias, as well as a variety of hanging plants and others. She also grows local banana and pineapple in her small farm for extra income. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales daily.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and garden supplies for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Josefina dreams of being able to expand her farm and garden through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm and garden supplies and materials she needs for her business.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
With a bicycle, Silvina, 59 years of age, sells her native cakes and vegetables in their village. With her perseverance, she generates an income of PHP 2,000 a month in these activities, which she spends for the needs of her family and for paying her obligation to ASKI.

To further improve her business and sustain the needs of her family, Silvina would like to ask for additional capital amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional raw materials to make native cakes and additional vegetables such as string beans and squash.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make native cakes and to buy vegetables such as string beans and squash

loans.name: Anik

texts.en:
Anik engages in farming. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but it is barely enough to make ends meet. 

Anik would like to increase her livestock and develop the family's agriculture. Development of agriculture will help Anik to sell more dairy and increase her income. Additional income will provide financial means for Anik to renovate the house and improve the condition of her household. 

Anik lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two little grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Gaddy

texts.fr: Gaddy   est un Evangéliste, il est âgé de 43 ans, il est marié, et il est né au Rwanda.  Il a 8 enfants  dans son charge et ses enfants sont  entre 6mois et 20 ans et 7 vont à l’école .Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans des études  secondaire. C’est son quatrième   cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va payer les frais des études  pour ses enfants. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  de facilite ses enfants à accéder aux études supérieur pour qu’ils préparent leurs futures. Dans l’avenir il voudrait avoir une famille bien éduqué, et assure le développement  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaddy is a preacher. He is 43 years old and married, and he was born in Rwanda. He supports eight children, who range in age from 6 months to 20 years. Seven of then attend school. Gaddy has three years of secondary education. 

This loan cycle is his fourth one with ACB. He is going to cover the cost of schooling for his children. His strategy for growth is to facilitate his children's access to higher education, so as to prepare for their future. He would like to have a well-educated family in the future and to assure his family's development.

loans.use: to cover the cost of schooling for his children

loans.name: Sayinzoga

texts.en:
Sayinzoga is 37 years old and is married with two children aged 4 and 6 years old.   He has been selling second-hand clothing for one year. His business is well-organized and he works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday.  

Sayinzoga has requested a loan in order to expand his business by purchasing more second hand clothes to sell. With any profits, he plans to reinvest in his business, to save for his future and he hopes he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in her rice farming. She wanted to enhance her farming business towards the improvement of her rice production. 

She is now 57 years old and is married to a farmer working in the Philippines. Together with her spouse, they raise crops primarily planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise. They have been doing it for 25 years. They are now veterans in farming but despite that, Carmelita and her husband are still interested in improving their farming practices for further business development.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, 47, is an ambitious business lady. She is married and blessed with three children.
