For the past three years, she has been operating a retail shop to make ends meet, supplementing this income with earnings from tea growing and dairy farming ventures. In the next five years, she wants to have transformed her business into wholesale so that she gets nearer to her dream of being a prominent business lady.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a 90kg sack of maize flour, two bags of sugar and two cartons of bar soap. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for instilling in her the savings culture.

loans.use: to buy a sack of maize flour, two bags of sugar, and two cartons of bar soap.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, 36, is married and blessed with two children, aged twelve and three. He is a tailor and has been in the business for five years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. and he has borrowed 10,000 KES to purchase stock for his business. The anticipated profits will be used to pay fees for his children and to improve the stock of his business.

His dreams are to improve his business as well as the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase sewing threads and materials for his business.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 52 years old and married. She earns a living by selling clothes, dishes and so on. This is her second successful year in this business. Her business is well organized. She operates her business from 7 am until 8 pm every day except on the weekend. 

Seraphine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more goods such as clothes, dishes, etc to sell. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Top purchase goods to sell such as clothes, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Mt Meru Group

texts.en:
Yusufu, who is in his early 30s, is single with one daughter who still goes to school.  He has had a film production business for two years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his business, which started at a very low level. It has grown reA. big and famous.  He also takes care of his parents and household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He wishes for a loan to increase his film production equipment.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mt Meru", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more film production equipment

loans.name: Farah's Group

texts.en:
Farah is married and her husband works. His income is not enough for the whole family, which is why Farah supports her family by operating a small grocery shop from her home. She has converted her guest room into a grocery shop. Through her store, she sells daily use items such as spices, sugar, rice etc. at reasonable rates. 
Farah is the mother of three children. Her eldest son is studying while the other two children have not started their education yet. Farah has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her grocery shop business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill the demand of her customers and increase her profits. Farah is very confident that an investment will bring more profits to her and improve her business condition. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farah.

loans.use: to buy groceries for grocery shop business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, 43, is married and has two children, aged seven and 23. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She and her husband till their own land where they grow rice crops. Elvira works hard to help provide for her family's needs.

Elvira has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and other farm supplies. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 27 years old and married. He's been selling cakes and tea for the past two years. His business is well organized and he works from 8 am until 8 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Felicien has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more farine [flour] to make cakes and to expand his tea business. He plans to reinvest the profits in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more farine [flour] to make cakes and to expand his tea business.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is age 29 and has been farming for nine years. He is married with two children, ages 6 and 2 years old, with the first born already in school. He lives with his family in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. He makes additional income from a motorcycle business.

Collins has made a second loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He says the better breeds he wants to purchase will double his income from the dairy business and improve his family's standard of living immensely. Collins says a number of farmers can't access funds to do meaningful business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella, 42, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a farmer, and is the mother of three children, two in high school and the youngest not yet studying. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bella grows pineapple and some bananas in their farm in Cavite, the high lands where it is suited to grow these crops. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores which she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of 9,000 PHP in sales monthly.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies. Part of the loan will go to farm maintenance. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bella dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 years old and single. She sells meat. Her business is well organized. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 9 pm every day. She has two years experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase large quantities of meat for resale to the restaurants. With her profit, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Norik

texts.ru:
Норику 52 года, он родился в селе Шикаох (Shikahogh), окончил сельскую среднюю школу. Норик женат, имеет сына и дочь: сыну 23 года, он учится в Ереванском медицинском университете на шестом курсе бесплатного отделения, дочке 19 лет и она учится в Капанском политехническом институте на втором курсе платного отделения геологического факультета. Норик вместе со своей женой работает в Шикаохской сельской школе. Норик работает в этой школе охранником. 
Также Норик и его жена занимается сельским хозяйством начиная с 1990 г.: они разводят крупный рогатый скот, выращивают овощи и фрукты. Также Норик имеет пастбище, для уборки сена на котором он нанимает механизатора, по причине неимения собственного трактора. На Капанском городском рынке Норик реализует свою сельскохозяйственную продукцию своим постоянным клиентам и таким образом содержит свою семью и платит за обучение дочери. 
Кредит на сумму 700.000 драм необходим Норику для организации уборки сена:  для аренды трактора и найма механизатора, покупки топлива и т.д.
texts.en:
Norik is 52 years old, he was born in the village of Shikahogh and has graduation from the village secondary school. Norik is married and has a son and daughter. His son is 23 years old and he studies in the Yerevan medical university, he is in his second junior year semester in the tuition-free department. His daughter is 19 years old and she is studying in the Kapan polytechnic institute, she is in the second semester of her freshmen year in the paid department of geology. Together with his wife Norik works in the Shikahogh village school. He works as a security guard in this school.

Also, Norik and his wife are in the agriculture business since 1990, they breed large horned cattle and grow fruits and vegetables. Norik also has a pasture for collecting hay for which he hires a machine operator because he does not own a tractor. Norik sells his agriculture production to his regular customers on the Kapan town market and by doing this he supports his family and pays for his daughter's education.

Norik needs the loan in the amount of 700,000 dram to organize collection of hay: to rent out a tractor and hire an operator, to buy fuel and etc.

loans.use: to organize the collection of hay

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 37 years old and married with three children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old. Her business is well organized. She employs two people in her business. She has four years experience and she owns a studio to help her photography business. Antoinette operates her business from 8 am to 7 pm every day.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more cameras and other materials for her studio to produce more pictures. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, save for the future and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more cameras and other materials for her studio.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is married and her husband operates a construction supplies business. He is very good in his customer dealings and receives a good number of orders every month. 
Nazia is a housewife as well as a working lady. She sells cattle such as sheep and goats. She buys them when they are young and sells them after raising them up. She also operates a thread-making business. She purchases old warm clothes and gets thread out of them to earn extra income for her family. 
Nazia has a daughter who is four years old and has not started her education yet. She has a plan to enroll her daughter in a school next year. 
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for buying sheep and goats for her animal sales business. She has a plan to sell sheep and goats on Eid (a Muslim occasion when people buy animals for slaughtering). She has been operating her business for some time now and hopes that she will make good profits. Nazia is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for animal sales business.

loans.name: Maria Diana

texts.es:
María tiene 31  años de edad, ella es soltera, y sin hijos, cuenta con casa propia.  La cual está ubicada en el distrito de Lambayeque,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias


María se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores y aves de corral, desde hace 4 años  ella  cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. 

Ella  desea adquirir mas animales menores y alimentos para sus aves ya que la demanda aumenta durante esta temporada  por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María  es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo Las personas que la conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old, single, and she does not have children. She own her own home and it is located in the district of Lambayeque. It is equipped with water and electricity. The neighborhood is a small community consisting of approximately 50 families.

Maria raises and sells small livestock and poultry. She has been raising poultry, ducks, turkeys, and hens from the rear section of her house for the past 4 years. When the livestock have attained a good level in their development she offers them up for sale to the merchants who visit the region where she lives.

She wants to acquire more small livestock and feed for her poultry. There is an increase in demand during this season. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

Maria is very devoted to her work. Those individuals that know her hold her in great esteem and care for her.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 44 years old and married with six children. She takes care of 12 relatives. She sells wedding clothes in her shop. Her business is well organized. She has three years' experience in her business and works from 7:30 am until 7 pm every day. She currently employs one person to help her.

Solange has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more and different styles of wedding clothes to sell. Solange will reinvest any profits in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more wedding clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow

loans.name: Matilde Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina tiene  49 años D. edad, cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en una zona llamada Lagunas del departamento D. Lambayequea 40 minutos D. la ciudad del Chiclayo , al norte D. Perú.

Florentina cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, ya que cuenta con varios años D. experiencia. 

La creciente demanda que la bodega D. Florentina que ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en comprar mas artículos novedosos y abarrotes en mayores cantidades a las que compra ahora  por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.

Florentina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y D. muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Florentina is 49 years old and she owns her own home, located in the region called Lagunas in the department of Lambayeque. It is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in Peru's north.

Florentina has a grocery store set up in her house and she manages the business herself. She offers essential needs products and general groceries for sale to her neighbors and clients in the region. The business enjoys a good demand especially because she has earned many years' experience.

The increasing demand experienced by Florentina's grocery store has caused her to think about adding more inventory and new products in larger quantities. For this reason she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. 

Florentina is a very hardworking woman of very good character. Those individuals who know her hold her in great esteem and care for her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and new products for her store.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and married with five children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. She sells sorghum and beans. Her business is well organized. She has ten years' experience in this business and she works from 7 am until 6 pm every day. 

Judith has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more beans and sorghum to sell. Judith will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase small livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who go to school.  She has been running a food vendor business for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 11 a.m. (for five hours only) daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees, to buy fabrics to sell door to door and to pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to start a beauty salon. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Bahari", which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To start a Beauty Salon business.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Eric 25, is a hardworking and determined business man.  He is married and blessed with three children.  Since the year 2002 he has been making a living by repairing automobiles.  In the next 5 years, he wants to own his own garage so that he is able to succeed and make meaningful investments. 

He is requesting for 30,00 Kenya shillings to buy filters and alternators. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for he is now able to support his family and business.

loans.use: to buy filters and alternators

loans.name: Samuell

texts.en:
Samuel is a 42 year old and he is married with four children.  He offers medical services .  He has been in this business for the past two years, he earns a monthly income of about KES 17,000 which he uses to support his family.

He has been loaned KES 20,000 by KADET LTD.  This is his sixth loan.  He intends to use the entire loan to stock up his business with drugs, injection needles, bandages, rubber glove, surgical spirit, e.t.c

The anticipated profit from the business will be used to continue to support his family as well as for savings so that he may one day be able to open and run a private mortuary alongside his medical centre.

loans.use: he intends to use the entire loan to stock up his business with drugs, injection needles, bandages, rubber glove, surgical spirit e.t.c

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 50 years old and does sewing and embroidery to earn money for her family. She started this business to financially support her husband who is a post office employee and also operates a milk sales business after his job. 
Kosar has two sons and three daughters. Her eldest son left his education after 5th standard and started making shoes. Her elder daughter has studied till 8th and supports Kosar in her embroidery business. Her remaining children are continuing their education.  
Kosar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s milk-selling business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo to be able to get a larger quantity of milk to sell. He is very experienced in his business and always sells pure milk to his customers at reasonable rates. Kosar is hopeful that after the loan investment his business will grow as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's milk-selling business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a mother of seven; she is married and is 56 years old.  She is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns an average annual net income of PHP 30,000 every cropping season during April and November.  Income generated from the business supports their daily needs and pays for the children's school fees. 

She is asking for a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to use to pay the labor fees of hired people working for her in the rice field and to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.  She has always wanted to do farming and she has been in this business for over 20 years.

loans.use: to pay labor fees of hired people working for her in the rice field and to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 42 years old, married, with four children all of whom are still below the age of eighteen years.  He operates a boutique at the New Market in Malindi town.  He has been in this business for the past five years now and it usually gives him a monthly income of about KES 10,000 with which he uses to support his family.

He has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET LTD and this serves as his first loan from the company.  He plans to stock up his business with ladies’ make ups, body lotions, perfumes, bathing soap, hair weaves as well as wigs, necklaces and bracelets.

He wishes to use the anticipated profit from the boutique to continue looking after his family as well as to continue restocking and gradually expanding the business so that in future, he may come to own his own well established beauty store in the area.

loans.use: TO HELP EXPAND THE CLIENTS BOUTIQUE

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, 55, is married to Julio, a farmer. They lived in the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. The couple is blessed with three children, the eldest of whom is married. The second child has already stopped studying, while the eldest is currently enrolled in high school.

Josefina has been engaged in the hog raising business for almost 20 years and she used to raise three hogs. The family get their income from hog raising and from buying and selling cows. Josefina is thankful that her husband helps her in maintaining their businesses. 

Her family's expenses have increased due to expensive basic commodities. Josefina would therefore like to ask for 25,000 PHP of additional capital. She will use this amount to purchase livestock feed and to buy and sell cows. She hopes her loan request will be granted so that she can increase her income to be able to save some amount to use when she becomes weak.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and to buy and sell cows.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a farmer in his hometown of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is single and 28 years old. He has been in farming for eight years. His farm produces potatoes, tea and milk, which he sells at the local market.

Vincent has requested his first time loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to construct a zero-grazing unit and plant nappier grass for his dairy cows. He says these will boost his production and reduce his expenditures immensely. He wants to buy more land for effective farming in the future.

Vincent says small land ownership is the challenge for many farmers.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Llusmila  tiene 67 años de edad, ella es viuda y  tiene  01 hijo menor de edad, ella vive con su familia (hijo), en un caserío del departamento de Cajamarca, esta zona el caserío es mediano con aspiraciones a superarse.
 
Lusmila  se dedica a la crianza, engorde de ganado vacuno y adicionalmente vende leche desde hace varios años ella se dedica a esta labor, por que actualmente cuenta con clientela fija y fidelizada a su negocio rubro, Lusmila  cría su ganado en corrales cerca de su domicilio y los vende en los mercados locales  y vende leche al colegio de dicho caserío.

Lusmila está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar ganado pequeño para su engorde y alimento balanceado para su ganado porque actualmente que cuenta con bastante pasto natural.

Lusmila es una mujer de buen carácter que le gusta ayudar a los demás y tiene muy buenas referencias , por parte de las personas que la conocen
texts.en:
Lusmila is 67 years old and she is a widow. She has a young son. She lives with her family (her son) in a community in the department of Cajamarca. It is a medium-sized community which aspires to improve. 

Lusmila raises and fattens cows and she also sells milk. She has been in business for many years so she has a steady and loyal clientele. Lusmila raises her cattle in corrals located near her house and she sells them in the local markets. She sells the milk to the neighborhood high school.

Lusmila requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase calves to raise and fatten and to purchase balanced feed for the cattle she currently has. She has plenty of natural grasses.

Lusmila is a woman of good character and she enjoys helping others. She has very good references from those individuals who know her.

loans.use: to purchase calves and livestock feed.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony, 41, is married with two children, aged 18 and 14. He has been a farmer for 20 years, primarily growing rice to sell. According to Tony, he earns about 13,000 PHP a month from farming. With these earnings, he is able to provide for his family's needs and send his children to school.

Tony is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. He hopes that his business will grow and for his children to finish college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Colette

texts.en:
Colette, 32, is a Rwandan entrepreneur with three children, aged five to 12. Her husband sells a variety of metal products.

For the past 15 years, Colette has also sold metal products such as metallic tubs, doors and windows. The profits from this business have enabled her to expand her business, pay for her children's medical insurance and improve their overall standard of living.

She requires this loan to purchase more metal products that she and her husband will sell.

With the future profits generated from the business, she plans to begin building her family house and accumulate savings so that she may provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy metallic goods.

loans.name: Kisukuru Group

texts.en:
Suzana, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children. One of her children goes to school. She has had a charcoal business for six months now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to open a shop to sell rice.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kisukuru", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ginorah

texts.en:
Ginorah, 22, is married and sells porridge and light foods such as doughnuts and chapatis. She has been in this business for one year and earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES, which she uses to help take care of her family.

This loan of 20,000 KES is her first from KADET Ltd. She intends to use 10,000 KES of the loan to put up a structure to accommodate her current business and the rest to start up a new business selling used clothes. 

With the anticipated profit, she will continue sustaining her businesses and help look after her family. In the future, she hopes to own her own restaurant and boutique.

loans.use: to put up a structure to accommodate her current business.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito, 54, is married with five children. He is a farmer who tills land in Banga, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice crops to sell to rice traders. Warlito also raises ducks. He works hard to increase his income and support his family.

Warlito has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide and other farm supplies. He hopes that through his business, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and hybrid corn for his farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing another posho mill.

loans.name: Safudin

texts.en:
Safudin, 28, is a carpenter and married to Ewa, 26. They moved from Sulawesi to West Timor seven years ago. From their marriage, they are blessed with three children: Rey, 8, in the third grade of primary school, Ramadhan, 5, and Rendra, 3. 

Safudin sells ready-made wood for building material. He started the business two years ago. Prior to running this business, Safudin worked as a carpenter in a furniture workshop for three years. Equipped with skill and experience from his previous employer, Safudin initiated his own business using his savings. The income generated from the business depends on the amount of ready-made wood ordered by customers.

In running the business, Safudin sometimes faces challenges such as the increasing price of wood from the supplier and his limited amount of equipment. Based on this situation, Safudin requires a loan to improve his current business. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from TLM to purchase one cubic of timber, plane wood and a ripsaw. Safudin expects that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: to purchase one cubic of timber, plane wood and a ripsaw.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Саодат более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Она в основном продает продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. Кредит берет для покупки безалкогольных напитков, масла, яиц, сахара, мыла, зубной пасты и щетки.
texts.en: Saodat lives in Khujand. She is 40 years old. She is married. She has two children. Saodat has worked in trade for more than five years. She has a general store. She mainly sells food and household goods. She is taking out a loan to buy soft drinks, butter, eggs, sugar, soap, toothpaste and brushes.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, butter, eggs, sugar, soap, toothpaste and brushes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, 46, earns a living through farming. She lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Eva has been engaged in farming for 10 years, primarily growing rice crops to sell. She currently needs to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide but does not have the capacity. She applied for a loan and hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 47 years old and has 11 children. Due to financial reasons she was not able to educate her children. Her eldest son works with his father in his Punjabi food restaurant and the next three children work in other cities. Her remaining children stay at home. 
Naseem is a housewife who stays at her home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is a very caring mother and has raised her 11 children with great care. She also supports her husband in his business by preparing food. 
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, because her husband wants to buy furniture for his restaurant. This will allow him to provide better seating arrangements for his customers. He will also buy the necessary ingredients for making better quality food for his customers in order to increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past six years. Naseem is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband and improve the family's standard of living. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: to buy furniture and required ingredients for her husband's Punjabi restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings for cabbage, kale and 'dania'.

loans.name: Erinestine

texts.en:
Ernestine is a 35-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with four children between the ages of two and eleven. Her husband works as a driver.
For the past 15 years, Ernestine has been running a business selling vegetables. The success of this business has enabled her to pay her children’s medical insurance. She is requesting this loan to purchase three baskets of tomatoes, 100kg of peanuts, and 20 liters of cooking oil that she can sell at a profit. With her future profits, she plans to pay her children's school fees, feed her family, and make savings.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Florena

texts.en:
A rice farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, 33-year-old Florena is married and has four sons ranging in age from 11 to 2 years. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Florena, who has been growing and selling rice for nine years, earns about 4000 PHP per month and is now requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes for increased farming success.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Frederikus

texts.en:
Frederikus, 43, is married to Magdalena, 42, and they have three children: Viktoria, 13 years old and in the 3rd grade of Junior High School; Thomas, 9 years old and in the 5th grade of Primary School, and Katarina, 6 years old and in the 1st grade of Primary School.

Frederikus and family live near a public swimming pool located in the downtown. He utilizes this opportunity to generate money for his family by renting out swimming equipment such as swimsuits, floats, swimming goggles etc. He started the business two years using his own capital, and it is doing well, especially during the weekend when many people go to the swimming pool.

Frederikus is requesting a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from TLM to add more equipment such as floats, swimsuits of various sizes and swimming goggles. He believes that the loan will be a great support for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment such as floats, swimsuits in various sizes and swimming goggles.

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sikitu, leader du groupe d’affaire « Heshima »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 28 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants, tous étudient. Elle est  vendeuse de la viande (porc) et sociétaire d’une boucherie.  Son mari est aussi un boucher.  Elle vend ses marchandises dans une boucherie au public. Il y a 3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  3 Cochons (porcs) à abattre.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Heshima » est restreint à 6 femmes.
texts.en:
Sikitu, our client, is the leader of the business group "Heshima". She is 28 years old, an entrepreneur, married, and the mother of four children, who are all students. She sells meat (pork) and is a partner in a butcher shop. Her husband is also a butcher. She sells to the public and has been in this business for three years. 

However, Sikitu just completed nine loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan must serve to provide her with three pigs for slaughter. In addition, her ambition is to educate her children and to buy a plot of land on which to build easily.

Our client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. It is appropriate to note that the business group "Heshima" is restricted to six women.

loans.use: to buy three pigs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Valijon

texts.ru: Валичон житель города Худжанд. Ему 23 года. Он женат. Детей не имеет. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Валичон предоставляет услугу, он развозит людей по маршруту Худжанд - Нов и обратно. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомобиля Газель, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Valijon is a resident of Khujand. He is 23 years old, married, and does not have children.  His wife is a homemaker. Valijon  provides a taxi service.  He drives people on a route from Khujand to Nov and and vice versa. He has been doing this work for two years. He is taking out a loan to repair his vehicle (he has a Russian-made Gazelle) in order to provide a safe service.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Jocelinda

texts.en:
Jocelinda is 27 years old and married. She has a 5-year-old son. Her husband is a farmer.

Jocelinda has been engaged in farming for five years. She helps her husband till their land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. While her husband manages their farm, she runs their sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned goods and noodles to the people in her community.

Jocelinda has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to be able to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 28 years old and married with three children between one and three years old.  In addition, he takes care of five relatives. He has owned a small boutique selling goods such as sugar, soap, rice, and cooking oil. His business is well organized and he works daily from 7 am until 8 pm. 

Theogene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as sugar, soap, rice, cooking oil and local drinks. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like sugar, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married with two children. She is grateful for her farming business because through it, she earns an average net income of 25,000 PHP every cropping season, which happens twice a year. 

She has grown rice and corn for seven years now. The profit she generates from it enables her to support the needs of her family and in sending her children to school continuously. Due to lack of capital, Lea is asking for a loan to buy the seeds and fertilizers she needs in her farming business.  

Lea also raises pigs as another source of income for her family. She hopes for the maintenance and further growth of her agriculture business for a bright future for her two children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers she needed in her farming business

loans.name: Rafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s vegetable selling business. He operates his shop in the market where he sells fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers. His rates are very fair and that’s why he makes good sales every month. 

She is the mother of two sons: the elder one is a vegetable seller as mentioned above while her younger one works in a factory.  Her elder son has been operating his business for past 10 years and Rafiqan is very confident that her son will be able to improve his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Kiprono

texts.en:
Kiprono is a father of six children who are all in school. He has been a farmer for the last 13 years in his hometown of Litein. He employs two farmhands and produces milk, tea and eggs for the local market. His family fully relies on farming for their livelihood.

Kiprono has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will help him diversify his business and improve his family's living standards. He says he is also focusing on building a modern dairy unit for his animals.

Kiprono says animal diseases are a challenge but surmountable.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 44-year-old married man with two children. He sells plastic products, such as basins, plates, and so on, at Gongoni Market in Malindi. He has  been in this business for five years. It gives him a monthly income of about 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He has been loaned 30,000 KES. This is his first loan. He intends to use the entire loan to stock up on goods for his business, like plastic cups, serving trays, and plastic chairs for young children.

He wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue looking after his family as well as to restock and gradually expand the business so that in the future he may come to own his own wholesale plastic store.

loans.use: to add to his stock of plastic goods

loans.name: Console

texts.en:
Console is a 33-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is a widow with six-year-old twins. For the past four years she has run a hair salon, and this business has helped her meet the needs of her family.  

She requires this loan so she may purchase and install hairdryers in her salon. She plans to begin to save her future profits so that she may provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy hairdryers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 35 years old. She is a married woman with a 14-year-old child. She has been a rice farmer for 12 years. Her earnings from farming allowed her to start a sari-sari store. She sells canned goods and other various products to the people in her community.

Julieta is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm supplies. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also hopes for her child to finish college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old. She is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 21 years old, and the youngest is 15.

Maria is a farmer who tills land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 20 years. Maria works hard to support her family and send her children to school.

Maria has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Cesielyn

texts.en:
Cesielyn is a 28-year-old mother of three children around school age. She is married to a farmer in the province of Quirino. She has helped her husband manage their farming business for almost 15 years now. She is grateful for their determination in growing their farm because the profits earned from it greatly help in covering their daily needs and the school allowances of their children.

Cesielyn is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy farm supplies needed to maintain their farm, such as corn seed and fertilizers. Because of the loan, Cesielyn anticipates a larger amount of income from the next harvest, for she is providing sufficient farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as corn seed and fertilizers, needed to maintain their farm

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a 40-year-old lady, married with five children: two daughters and three sons. Her elder daughter is an embroidery expert while the second one sews clothes. Her three sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Robina is also an embroidery expert. She receives a good number of orders from her neighboring clients every month and crafts beautiful designs on cloth to attract more customers. Her husband has three buffaloes and sells their milk to community clients for a profit. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy another buffalo to expand his milk selling business. This will help him sell a larger quantity of milk every day and earn more income. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Robina is confident that an investment will not only help her husband as an asset for his business but also increase his household income that will allow his family to live a better life. 

She is new loan user with Asasah and this is her first application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Thercianne

texts.en:
Thercianne is a 49-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur, married with no children.  Her husband sells charcoal and she sells eggs on the wholesale market. 

She has run this business for the past five years, and the profits she has earned have enabled her to provide for her extended family.

She requires this loan to purchase more eggs so that she can continue to earn a profit and renovate her house and put aside savings.

loans.use: to buy eggs for sale.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a 28-year-old single man who sells household items. He has been in this business for the past two years; he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000/=. which he uses to look after himself as well as business capital.

He has been loaned KES. 30,000/= as his first loan. The client intends to use the entire loan to add more stock to his business inventory by buying additional serving dishes, spoons, eating plates, water basins , buckets, etc. 

He wishes to utilize the anticipated profit from the business to open up another sales point in town and hopes that in future, he may come to own his own supermarket.

loans.use: to add stock to his plastics sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 43 years old and is married with three children. She earns an average of Php 26,000 every harvest season, twice a year, as a farmer working in the Philippines. She grows rice and has been doing this for 25 years now. 

She is asking for the loan amount of Php 10,000 to pay for labor costs to prepare her rice field and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for good production.

In the future, Judy hopes for a bigger production of rice to generate more income for the comfortable living she wants to give her family someday.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs to  prepare her rice field and to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase piglets to be raised and a fishing net.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
This is a 40-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with four children between the ages of 6 and 20 years old.  Her husband works in a hotel and she runs a general store.

She has been running her store for the past six years, and she requires this loan so that she may purchase beans, rice, and cooking oil that she will sell for a profit.  She hopes to generate enough profits so that she can accumulate savings.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 27-year-old single lady who sells used clothes in Gongoni Market in Malindi. This lady has been in this business for the past two years now and earns a monthly income of about Kshs.7,000/= which she uses to look after herself as well as using some of it to run her business. 

Lydiah has been loaned Kshs.30,000/= by Kadet Limited and this serves as her first loan from the company. She intends to use her loan to purchase additional stock of used clothes for her business with the aim of expanding it due to the rise in her clientele in the region. The client wishes to use some of her anticipated profit to continue running her business as well as continue saving a portion of it so as she will be able to run her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Muborakhon

texts.ru: Муборакхон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она вместе с детьми и мужем занимается животноводством. Разводит у себя дома крупнорогатый скот. В основном она откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности Муборакхон занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Muborakhon lives in Khujand. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband and children work in animal husbandry. She breeds cattle at home. Basically, she fattens and sells cattle. Muborakhon has been doing this work for six years. She is taking out a loan to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 40 years old and married. He has three children aged 12, 11, and 2.

Reynaldo is a farmer who tills a plot of land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. He grows rice and vegetables then sells his harvest at the market. Reynaldo works hard to sustain his family and his children's education.

Reynaldo has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to have a good business and for his children to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is a 40-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with four children between the ages of 4 and 14 years old  Her husband raises animals and she sells fruit.

She has been running her fruit business for the past 15 years, and she requires this loan so that she can purchase 100 bunches of bananas, 80 pineapples, and 4 sacks of avocados that she will sell for a profit.

loans.use: to buy fruit for sale.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina is 34 years old, married and makes a living by operating a grocery store. She has been in this line of work for two years and earns about KES 10,000, all of which she uses to care for her family. She is applying for her second loan to buy additional items to sell to her customers, including cooking oil,  flour, sweets, vegetables, fruits and other groceries. She plans to invest the additional profits she earns into her store, and dreams someday of owning a chain of several stores.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers, including cooking oil, flour, sweets, vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 26 years old, married, and has a one-year-old child. She sells goods such as Irish potatoes and bananas. She has three years of experience in her business and works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. Jeanne currently employs one person to help her.

Jeanne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand the inventory of her goods (Irish potatoes and bananas). With the profits, Jeanne will reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a resident and a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. She is 38 years old and has been in farming for the last six years with her produce of tea and milk being sold at the local market. She is married with three children between 17 and 13 years old.

Lorna has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter that will help her in feeding her dairy cows. She says the machine will help improve the animal production due to good feeding. She adds that the income will enable her to educate her children.

Lorna notes that insufficient animal feed remains the major challenge for the farmers.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Ephraim Livingstone

texts.en: Ephraim is 26 years old and single. He makes a living by running a transport services business at a local market in Kisumu. He has been running this business for seven years and says that it is profitable despite a shortage of capital. He is applying for a loan to buy spare parts for his rickshaw to ensure that it is in good condition and safe to operate. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by buying a fleet of rickshaws and other vehicles to provide services to more people in the area. He describes himself as friendly and very responsible.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose is a 60-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who has a child who is now 30 years old. She is a widow and supports herself and her child by selling fruits. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and has been able to earn enough money to pay for her child's school fees and meet her family’s overall needs. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, including tangerines, passion fruits and bananas. She hopes to earn enough money in the future to accumulate some savings.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en: Ndoro is 56 years old, married, has four children and earns a living as a livestock farmer. He has been in this line of work for nine years and is applying for his third loan from KADET. He plans to use this loan to expand his herd by buying more goats. He plans to use the additional profits made possible by this loan to make repayments and further expand his business. His dream is to someday own a very large herd of animals and be a very successful businessman.

loans.use: to expand his livestock herd by buying more goats.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en: Colleta is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. For the last three years she has made a living by running a taxi service, and is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced to our organization by a friend who is also a client. She plans to use her loan to buy equipment for her taxi, including two spare tires, and money for gasoline. She is confident that these purchases will help her expand her business because they will improve the condition of her vehicle. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her taxi business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and gasoline for her taxi.

loans.name: Shakar

texts.en:
Shakar is 66, widowed and has three grown children.  She worked for a long time as Director of the local school and is known as a very accurate and persistent person.  In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, she started her business in gardening. She has been growing cherries, raspberries and apples. The earnings from selling her harvest allowed her to diversify her activities by engaging in breeding cattle.  Today she has a farm with cattle, which still needs to be developed. For this reason, Shakar has applied for a loan of 100.000 KGS to purchase more cattle for fattening and reselling. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. Phiona has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. 

Phiona sells her products at the market, retail. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.  She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

The main business challenges for Phiona include lack of enough capital to buy many bales and the ever increasing price of used clothes and also building rental rooms.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing used clothes.  

Phiona lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all four of whom are in school.  Teopista has a pub.  She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week.  

Teopista sells her products at the market, retail.  She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. 

The main business challenges for Teopista include thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pub.    

Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  Christine has a business selling used shoes.  She has been in this business for one year, and she works six days out of every week. 

Christine sells her products at the market, retail.  She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand shoes.   The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and ever increasing costs of bales of clothes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing used clothes herself and also to sell wholesale only. 

Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 47 years old. He is well behaved and a born-again Christian. He is married and blessed with three children of whom two are in school. For the last three years, he has been providing for his family by repairing mobile phones. He wants in the next five years to have opened up his own company and his dream is to see that company grow into a big company.

He is requesting 50,000 Kenya shillings  to buy a new remote station. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learnt how to manage his business efficiently and effectively

loans.use: to buy a new remote station for cell phone repair.

loans.name: Albert

texts.ru:
Алберту 39 лет, он живет в деревне Лчашен, Гегаркуникского региона, вместе со своей матерью, женой и двумя маленькими дочками. Мать Алберта инвалид II группы, жена преподает в сельской школе, но в данный момент находиться в декретном отпуске. 
После окончания средней школы, Алберт в течение долгих лет жил в России, а по возвращении в Армению устроился на работу на Севанский хлебозавод пекарем. Параллельно со своей работой на хлебозаводе, Алберт занимается сельским хозяйством: разводит коров, овец и свиней, а также выращивает картофель. Основной доход семье Алберта приносит продажа сельскохозяйственной продукции, что и дает ему возможность содержать свою семью. 
Алберту необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм на покупку корма для скота, а также для покупки нескольких телят, что в будущем поможет ему увеличить доход своей семьи.
texts.en: Albert is 39 years old.  He lives in the village of Lchashen, in the Gegharkunik region, with his mother, his wife and two young daughters. Albert's mother is an invalid, and his wife teaches at a rural school, but at the moment is on maternity leave. After graduating from high school, Albert lived in Russia for many years, and on his return to Armenia he took a job at the Sevan bread factory as a baker. Along with his work at the bakery, Albert is engaged in agriculture.  He breeds cows, sheep and pigs, and he grows potatoes. The family's primary income comes from the sale of agricultural products, which enables him to support his family. Albert needs a loan of 500,000 drams to purchase feed for livestock, as well as to buy a few calves that will help him in the future to increase his family's income.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals and buy some more calves

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has five children, none of whom are in school.  Rose has a business selling local gin.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Rose sells her products from home, wholesale and retail.     

Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin.   The main business challenges for Rose include thieves and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale only and also to start going to villages of Kasese for jerrycans of local gin.    

Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include  medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya for the last seven years. His farm produces vegetables, milk and maize for the local market. He is married with three children between 10 and 5 years old.

Joseph has made a loan request of 62,400 KES with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that he will use the income to purchase a pedigree dairy cow as his farming business grows. He adds it will also provide a sustainable source of income for the family.

Joseph sees common droughts as the challenge in farming, especially for the dairy farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Verdianne

texts.en:
Verdianne is 31 years old and married with three children between the ages of four and nine years old. Her business is well organized. She employs one person in her business. Verdianne has two years of experience and she sells vegetables and cooking oil.

Verdianne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more vegetables and cooking oil to sell. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Fulgence

texts.en:
Fulgence, age 26 and single, has owned a motorcycle transport business for the past five years. His business is well organized and open daily from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Fulgence has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy essential materials like tires for his motorcycle transport. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more essential materials like tires.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a farmer and a businessman in Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya. His business involves selling vegetables at the local market. He has also been a farmer for the last 10 years, producing milk, potatoes, cabbage and maize.

Titus has made a loan request with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He sees inaccessibility to reliable artificial insemination services as a challenge to farmers such as himself.

Titus says he hopes to improve his business and rear pedigree cows with the hopes of increasing his income to uplift the living standards of his family

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Renathe

texts.en:
Renathe is 36 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by selling vegetables, cooking oil, and so on. She has had three successful years in business. Her business is well-organized and she operates it from 7 a.m until 8 p.m every day. She employs one person to help her.

Renathe has requested a loan in order to expand her business by buying more cassava, Irish potatoes, vegetables and cooking oil to sell. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, potatoes, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Nosirjon

texts.ru: Носирчон проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 27 лет. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. У него имеется среднее образование. Носирчон уже пять лет, как занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке "Ганчина", где продает мужскую обувь. Кредит берет для покупки сезонной обуви.
texts.en: Nosirchon lives in Dushanbe. He is 27 years old and single. He lives with his parents. He has a high school education. Nosirchon has been tradinng in the market for five years. He rented a store in the Ganjina market where he sells men's shoes. He is taking out a loan to buy seasonal footwear.

loans.use: to buy seasonal footwear.

loans.name: Lavurik

texts.ru:
Лавурик родилась в 1948 году. Она живет в городе Севане вместе со своей семьей, которая состоит из ее мужа, сына и невестки. 
До 1995 года Лавурик работала на швейной фабрике, а на протяжении последних 16 лет она занимается собственным бизнесом: продает одежду на Севанской городской ярмарке. Лавурик продает одежду как для взрослых, так и для детей. Ее муж помогает ей в бизнесе и еженедельно они ездят за покупкой товара для бизнеса в Ереван. Товар они покупают на оптовых рынках Еревана. 
В преддверии начала учебного года Лавурик хочет увеличить ассортимент предлагаемой продукции и для этого ей необхорим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм. Данный кредит является для Лавурик седьмым, и она никогда не задерживала свои выплаты по кредиту.
texts.en: Lavurik was born in 1948. She lives in the town of Sevan with her family, which consists of her husband, son and daughter. Prior to 1995, Lavurik worked in a sewing factory, and for the past sixteen years, she has worked in her own business: selling clothes at the Sevan city market. Lavurik sells clothing for both adults and children alike. Her husband helps her in the business and they go every week to buy goods for the business in Yerevan. They buy goods in wholesale markets in Yerevan. In anticipation of the school year Lavurik wants to increase the range of products she offers, and for this she needs a loan of $ 1,000,000 AMD. This loan is Lavurik's seventh, and she has never been late paying for a loan.

loans.use: To add her stall's clothes assortment

loans.name: C4831 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 37 years old and is married with two children aged 13 and 14. Among her family only Eugenie works, so she has to work hard in order to  provide everything that is necessary for her family.

Eugene sells foodstuffs such as bananas, Irish potatoes, and beans. Eugene is also the leader of her borrower group which is called "Tuzamurane." The group is made up of three women and two men and most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs.

Eugenie and her group have requested a loan in order to buy more inventory so as to expand their businesses. Once they have grown their businesses, they hope to satisfy their customers and to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, potatoes,beans and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a 55-year-old married father of five children ranging in age from 27 to 16 years, operates a farm as his primary business and has had a studio as a secondary business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Peter is now requesting his first loan with KADET after having been introduced to it by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm and stationery for his studio business. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will expand the studio enterprise. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses to boost income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm and stationery for his studio business.

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru: Хурсаной проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Хурсаной после отъезда мужа занялась бизнесом. Она более шести лет занимается торговлей арбуза. Ее бизнес является сезонным. Она берет кредит для закупа дыни. Хурсаной хочет расширить свою деятельность и получить хороший доход.
texts.en: Khursanoy lives in ​​Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is working abroad. After her husband left, Khursanoy went into business. For more than six years, she has been selling watermelons. Her business is seasonal. She is taking out a loan to buy melons. Khursanoy wants to expand her business and make a good income.

loans.use: Для закупа дыни

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 33 years old and is married to Jane. They are blessed with three children. He is a rice farmer. He has been in the business for seven years with a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and to employ laborers. 

With the anticipated profits from the business he will start a greenhouse project. His hopes are to educate his children and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers, and to employ laborers

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 62, married, and has six children aged thirty-four, thirty-three, twenty-seven, twenty-four, nineteen, and sixteen. He has been farming for thirty years and has a monthly income of 16,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy water pipes and repair his water pump. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his farming by purchasing a bigger farm. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy water pipes and repair his water pump

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49, single, and blessed with three children. 

She owns a restaurant and butcher shop. She has been doing this business for the last 10 years and makes 24,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month. 

She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET Ltd. with which she plans to purchase chairs, tables, mats, and sufuria (cooking pots). She will use the extra profit to educate her children. 

She hopes to supply all the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, mats, and sufurias (cooking pots)

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is 60 years old and married to Michael. She has been keeping poultry for ten years with a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to pay the school fees of her children. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will add more poultry to her business. Her hope is to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To pay the school fees of her children

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 32 years old and married to John. They are blessed with one five-year-old child. She has been selling tissues and rice for the past two years, making a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to add tissues and sacks of rice for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her  dream is to open a wholesale shop which will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy tissues and sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Reine

texts.en:
Reine is a 29-year-old single woman living with her brother. She is from Lebanon. This woman started her business as a hairdresser and beautician from her home. She has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years. She works independently. Her business is essential because with its income, she is able to help her brother pay their living expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase beauty products in addition to new hairdressing equipment and supplies. In the future, she is planning to open her own beauty salon where she will provide her customers with top quality beauty services.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products in addition to new hairdressing equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is twenty-seven years old, married and has one child aged two years old. She operates an shop in which she does printing and photocopying at Kahawa Sukari and she is served by the Thika Branch of SMEP. She has been in this business for one year now and says that the challenge she has are financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of Kes. 70,000 to purchase a photocopy machine to grow her business. She hopes that in future she will have the best shop in Kahawa Sukari. She describes herself as patient.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлюда  родилась в г. Каракол ( Иссык-Кульская область),  где сейчас и  проживает.  Она родилась  и выросла в среднеобеспеченной семье,   после окончания школы вышла замуж и в 1986 году родила первого  сына.  Для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью всем  необходимым, ей приходилось много работать . Сейчас у нее трое  детей( дочка и 2 сына), младшие сын и дочь учатся в школе.  В 2004 году, Мавлюда решила начать свой бизнес в торговле товарами широкого потребления. Начав деятельность со стартовым капиталом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS), она сумела развить свой бизнес и на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль около 10,000 сом в месяц.  Небольшой торговый павильон Мавлюды (площадью 2х3 м) пользуется популярностью за счет хорошего ассортимента товаров, но к сожалению не позволяет увеличить объем торговли. Поэтому Мавлюда решила обратится в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для увеличения ассортимента товаров. Планируемую прибыль она хочет вложить в покупку еще одного павильона на местном рынке.  
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Mavluda was born in the town of Karakol in the Issyk-Kul province where she now lives. She was born and raised in the middle income class family and after graduating from school she got married and gave birth to her first son in 1986. To provide for her family with all the necessary things she had to work very hard.

Right now she has three children - a daughter and two sons. Her youngest son and daughter go to school. In 2004 Mavluda decided to start her own business in the trade of consumer goods. When she began her business with a starting capital of 20,000 soms (KGS) she was able to develop her business and to this day her monthly profit is around 10,000 soms.

Mavluda's small trade pavilion with a size of two by three meters is very popular due to a good variety of products offered, but unfortunately it does not allow to increase the volume of sales. This is why Mavluda decided to come to Bai Tushum and Partners to ask for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to increase the variety of her products. She plans to invest the profit in purchasing of another pavilion on the local market.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to expand the variety of products

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is from the village of Gtashen in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married with four children – two daughters (33 and 43 years old) and two sons (39 and 45 years old). Rima has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for twenty years. Her current savings are not enough to grow her business. Rima would like a loan to purchase pigs and cows. According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by twenty percent. She hopes to save a little extra money to repair the family home. Rima considers herself a hard-working, honest person and enjoys living in Gtashen near her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and cows

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Eva has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Eva sells her products in a shop, retail.

Eva has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  The main business challenges for Eva include transportation, ever increasing prices of commodities, and defaulters  .Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.

Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Munavara

texts.ru: Мунавара проживает в города Вахдат. Возраст, 54 года. Разведена. Имеет четверых детей. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. В этой области Мунавара работает более 5 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки яиц, масла, муки, сахара, конфет, мороженного и натуральных соков.
texts.en: Munavara lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 54 years old, divorced, and has four children. She has a secondary education. She works trading in the market. She has a general store.  Munavara has been doing this for more than five years. She is taking out a loan to buy eggs, butter, flour, sugar, candy, ice cream and natural juices.

loans.use: to buy eggs, butter, flour, sugar, candy, ice cream and natural juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 35 years old; married to Faith. They are blessed with one child aged three years. Clement has been in the spare part selling business for the past nine years with a monthly income of KES 8000 which he uses to support his family needs.
