He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use his loan to add a stock of spare parts to his business inventory. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will open a car wash business. His hopes and dreams are expanding the two businesses which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To add a stock of spare parts to his business inventory.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the town of Maralik.  Even though Kristine has a university education, the difficult economic times have forced her to be a farmer for the past nine years.  She is the proud mother of three children: a five-year-old daughter and two sons (nine and ten years old).  Kristine would like to increase the number of livestock with a microfinance loan.  She expects that this investment will increase the family income by 25%. Kristine and her husband hope to continue growing the family farm and purchase new equipment. They can develop the business and later pass it on to their children. Kristine enjoys living in Maralik. She knows all the townspeople and has relatives close by.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his beauty salon

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is 19 years old and lives in the airport community. She stopped her education at only 5th grade. She is married and has a two-year-old child who is not attending school. She received money from her husband to start her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper and charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 39 years old and married to Nelious, is the father of a seven-year-old. Wilson has been in the spare parts business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Having repaid his previous loan, he is now requesting a second loan from KADET to add a stock of spare parts to his shop. With the anticipated extra profits, Wilson will expand his business. His dream is to own a big wholesale shop for spare parts which will help him improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to add a stock of spare parts to his shop.

loans.name: Taphroza Ijai

texts.en: Taphroza is 41 years old, married, with six children aged between sixteen and four years old. She runs a tailoring business at a local market in Kisumu. She has been running this business for four years and says that, although the business is profitable, her major problem is lack of adequate capital. She is using the loan to purchase materials to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, Taphroza hopes to expand her business and educate her children to the university level. She describes herself as humble and God-fearing.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 30 years old and single. He has been selling car spare parts for ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his basic needs. He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to venture into farming also which will help improve his living standard.

loans.use: To expand his spare part business

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en: Wilfred is 47 years old, married to Leah. They are blessed with two children, fifteen and twelve. He has been in the farming business for one year with a monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business he plans to expand his farming business. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children and buy a large farm and export its produce.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 28-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has 10 years of experience working as an aluminum laborer. He works on a freelance basis with one full-time employee assisting him in achieving the work tasks.  He deals directly with customers and construction entrepreneurs. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his tools in order to reinforce his business operation and strengthen it. In the future, he is hoping to be able to open his own aluminum shop.

loans.use: to renew his tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent and refurbish a small beauty salon

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and four siblings. He has more than 10 years of experience working as a blacksmith. In 2006, he started to work autonomously sticking with multiple projects. In addition to his private work, he helps his uncle from time to time who also works as a blacksmith. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a cutter machine and additional necessary tools.  He is certain that with the loan help, his business income will increase. In the future, he is hoping to make the needed savings to be able to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase a cutting machine and other necessary tools

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 45 years old, married with two children aged 18 and two years old. She operates a boutique in Thika town well known by the name "Rahab's Boutique." She has been in this business for two years and says the major challenge she has is financial constraints. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase clothes for sale. Rahab hopes to grow her business and open three more other boutiques in Thika. She describes herself as patient and focussed.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living alone. He has six years of experience working in the agricultural field. In 2008, he started to work on his own, cultivating all types of vegetables and bananas. His goods are all sold to local markets. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers. He will also use the loan to perform the needed maintenance on the water canal to supply the land with enough water to help his crops grow.  He is sure that the loan will help him increase his business productivity by a large percentage, which will return higher profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and perform maintenance on the water canal

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is married with 4 children, three of whom are already at school. He is a farmer in his hometown of Litein, South Rift Kenya employing one farmhand and producing milk and tea for the local market.

Philip has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit for his animals. He says this will help protect the animals and improve their production. He is planning on purchasing more land in the future.

Philip sees small land ownership by farmers as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 32 years old and she lives in Airport community. She used to worked as a janitor in a school to obtain her 8th grade education. She is married and has two children aged 12 and 16 who live with her and go to school. Her husband works with Firestone. For the past seven years she has being selling plastic materials. She is requesting a loan to purchase plastic dishes, buckets and plastic cups for her business. She hopes to build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase plastic dishes, buckets and plastic cups for her business

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en:
Marcelline is 38 years old and is married with three children aged between 2 and 15. She also takes care of 2 relatives aged between 17 and 50 years old. She sells charcoal. Her business is well-organized. She has three years experience in her business and she works from 7am until 6pm every day, except Saturday. She currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. With any profits, Marcelline will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Bassel

texts.en: Bassel is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a furniture painter for the past eight years. In 2006, Bassel was able to open his own shop.  He completes his work in a professional way and always meets his clients' demands. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new paint and an air compressor. In the future, he is looking to invest in new materials to further expand his business. He hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase paint and an air compressor

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is married with 5 children aged between 13 and 5. He has been farming for 8 years producing pineapples, tea and milk. He lives with his family of six in his native town of Litein South Rift Kenya.

Christopher has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says he will use the additional income to pay for the education of his children. He adds that his focus is to be able to build a dairy unit for his dairy cows.

Christopher says fluctuations in market prices are a great challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 31 years old. He is married with one child and takes care of 12 relatives. He has owned a studio business for the past two years. His business is well-organized and he works daily from 7am until 6pm. He currently employs 2 people to help him.

Janvier has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more cameras for his studio. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business, to save for his future and to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more cameras for his studio.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, aged 37, is a single mother of three children aged eighteen, thirteen and four. She runs a restaurant that has been in operation for five years.The business earns her a monthly income of KES.110,000. This is her third loan term with KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. Catherine will use the funds to buy food stuffs like baking flour, maize flour, vegetables and rice. She hopes to educate her children and own a modern hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs e.g baking flour andvegetables

loans.name: Badriah

texts.en: Badriah is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is from Lebanon. She has owned a small mini-market in her town since 2009. She sells all types of sweets, dairy and daily products, chicken, etc. Her business income is very important; she is helping her husband. This will be her second Kiva loan, and she is very thankful for the results of the previous loan. Today, she is requesting a loan of $2000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. In the future, she is planning to expand her business by adding more items to her shop.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with four family members.

Thaer has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan in order to make a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs to his market.

loans.name: Martha Muthoni

texts.en:
Martha, a 35-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of 11 and 1, has been operating a clothing sales business for five years now in the town of Thika; she also has a mobile money transfer service. Financial constraints constant her major challenge.

Martha is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase more clothes for sale. Describing herself as hardworking and focused, she hopes to grow her business and in future build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon living alone. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2009. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 10 years. His main service route is between his town and the surrounding areas. He also serves customers upon their requests. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a very good client paying on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his taxi. After doing those repairs, he will be able to expand his business operation into other areas without facing any mechanicA. problems.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Enit

texts.es: Enith D. 65 años vive en Polo nuevo ubicado en la  zona nororiental del Departamento del Atlántico, en la cuenca hidrográfica del Río Magdalena, allí vive con su esposo,  tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la actividad mercantil. Ella venD. mercancía variada al detalle en un punto comercial ubicado en una vía muy transitada, lo cual potencializa el volumen D. sus ventas.  Enith inició su negocio desD. el año 2006 cuando quedando desempleada y comenzó,  por iniciativa D. su hija que ya tenía como negocio, vender productos mediante guías especializadas, comprando una vitrina surtiéndola D. productos que le abastecía su hija, gradualmente fue construyendo un capital con el cual adicionó calzado ropa femenina y otros productos que pedía su doméstica clientela. En la actualidad venD. D. contado y también a crédito al detalle mediante pedidos D. sus clientes con los cuales planea la forma D. pago. Su meta más adelante es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un almacén muy reconocido en Polonuevo, por tener todo lo que sus habitantes necesitan y pueden comprar. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará  artículos D. papelería y productos D. confección D. los cuales hay muy poca competencia en el pueblo y que harán que  su inversión sea exitosa. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital D. trabajo, que gradualmente planea aumentar mediante sus credikiva futuros y su disciplina D. trabajo. Mientras esto ocurre su negocio presenta  liquidez, sus cuentas por cobrar rotan apropiadamente  para este tipo D. negocios y su nivel D. rentabilidad demuestra solvencia para responder a sus gastos.
texts.en: Enith is 65 years old and lives in Polo Nuevo, located in the northeast zone of the Department of the Atlantic, in the geological basin of the Magdalena River. She lives there with her husband and has 2 children. She is in the retail traD.. She sells a variety of merchandise on a retail basis from a sales point located on a highly traveled road, which is good for her sales volume. Enith started her business in 2006 when she became unemployed, and thanks to the initiative of her daughter who already had this kind of business, she began to sell products ordered from specialty catalogs. She bought a display case and stocked it with products provided by her daughter. Gradually she built up some capital, which she used to add shoes, women's clothing and other products in demand among her domestic customers. Currently, she sells retail on a cash basis and also on credit based on orders from her customers, with whom she works out the form of payment. Her goal for the future is to expand her business until it becomes a well-known store in Polo Nuevo, stocked with everything that the local inhabitants need and are able to buy. With her Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she will buy paper goods and clothing products, for which there is very little competition in the village, and which will make her investment successful. Her greatest challenge is her insufficient working capital, which she plans to gradually increase through future Kiva loans and her own working discipline. Meanwhile, her business enjoys liquidity, its accounts receivable turn over appropriately for this type of business, and her profitability level provides enough solvency to cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy paper goods and clothing products to sell.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been working in the agriculture field for the past 15 years. In 1999, he purchased a plot of land where he started to cultivate all types of vegetables according to the season. He has one part-time employee helping him with the farming work. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies such as fertilizers and seeds. This is his second Kiva loan and he has been very reliable with his repayments. He estimates that with the coming harvest, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single and lives with five family members.

Atheer has been an owner of an aluminum workshop since 2009. He sells and makes doors, windows and kitchens. He has good experience in this field,  a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan to purchase an aluminum cutter machine and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase an aluminum cutter machine and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Waed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, single and lives with one family member.

Waed has had a food market since 2008 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to make a sliding door and to purchase additional foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to purchase additional foodstuffs.

loans.name: C4716 Imbaraga Group

texts.en:
Clementine is 40 years old and is married with four children aged between 12 and 24.  She is a businesswoman selling goods such as lotions, cooking oil, and sugar. Clementine is also the leader of this group, which is called "Imbaraga" in the local language. This word means "effort" in English. Clementine employs one person to help her and she has one year of experience. She starts her work at 8:00 a.m. and works until 8:00 p.m. every day. She is the second person from the left in the picture, the one who is raising her hand.

Clementine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more salt, sugar, cooking oil, and so on. Once their businesses have expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and save for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, cooking oil, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en: Teo lives in Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, all of whom have finished school .Teo has a business selling cereals.  She has been in this business for less than one year and she works three days out of every week.  Teo sells her products in a shop at wholesale. Teo has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of dried maize. The main business challenges for Teo include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing maize and to own a delivery van. Teo lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of dried maize

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has been working in mixed farming in her hometown of Nyamira for the past three years. She produces and sells maize, bananas and milk which are all sold to the local market. She is married with six children who all attend school.

Teresa has made a loan request of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will help her to educate her children and to purchase more land for better farming practices.

Teresa says scarcity of pesticides and costly farm fertilizer are a great threat to farmers

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Serapie

texts.en:
Serapie is 42 years old. She is married with four children and takes care of four relatives. She earns a living by selling products such as bananas and sweet potatoes. This is her thirteenth successful year in business. Her business is well-organized and she operates her business from 7 am until 6 pm every day. She currently  employs 2 people to help her. 

Serapie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more bananas and sweet potatoes for sale. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business and she will be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as bananas and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child.

Rabih has owned a farm for raising calves and cows since 2000. He has a lot of experience in this field and a deep understanding of the local consumer. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a Friesian cow. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a Friesian cow.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is 35 years old, married and they have three children aged between fifteen years and three years old. She bakes and sells cakes to local people at Makongeni area in Nairobi. Besides the bakery she also operates a salon. She has been in this business for ten years now and hires one employee. She says the major challenge she has is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and others to grow her bakery business. She hopes to grow her business and in future open a big bakery. She describes herself as hardworking, outgoing and humble.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: C4370 Abisungane Group

texts.en:
Marie is 37 years old. She is married with four children and takes care of seven children. She is also the leader of this group which is called "ABISUNGANYE" in the local language. Marie employs two people to help her and she has five years of experience in this business. She works from 6am to 9pm every day except Sunday. 

Marie and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of food and drinks for sale

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 35 years old and married with six children and two relatives. She sells clothes such as elder's clothes and children's clothes. Her business is well organized. 

The hours of her business are from 8 am to 6 pm every day except on the weekend. She has five years experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her.

Jeanne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes such as elder's clothes and children's clothes for resale. With her profit, Jeanne will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosiris

texts.es: Rosiris vive en el Barrio Olaya donde se dedica al arte de las confecciones de prendas de vestir femenina, oficio que emprendió como un negocio hace 2 años, inicialmente estaba ubicado en su propia vivienda, pero como fue creciendo,  porque gradualmente aumentó su infraestructura de maquinarias, se vio en la necesidad de arrendar un local para responder a su necesidades locativas y la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta más adelante es continuar perfeccionando su infraestructura, mediante la adquisición de maquinarias que le ayuden a mejorar los tiempos productivos e incrementar sus ventas. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para invertir y aumentar su clientela,  y esto es justamente lo que planea lograr con sus credikiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen, telas, encajes e insumos en general, para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y tener un stock, que le permita responder con efectividad. Actualmente Rosiris cuenta  con un  operario fijo y clientela fija,  localizada en los barrios aledaños a los cuales vende ropa terminada, también ofrece el servicio sobre medidas, es decir maneja la estrategia 1 a 1, sus proveedores son almacenes reconocidos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, a los cuales le compra de contado; igualmente brinda asesoría a sus clientes como un servicio complementario orientándolas en su vestir. Financieramente su negocio maneja una buena liquidez para responder a sus gastos y obligaciones a acorto plazo, sus cuentas por cobrar tienen una buena rotación adaptada a las especificaciones de su negocio  y su expectativa y potencial de crecimiento es  muy amplia.
texts.en:
Rosiris lives in the Olaya neighbourhood. She makes women's clothing. She started her business 2 yeas ago. Initially it was based in her own home, but as it grew she acquired new infrastructure such as machines and had to rent out some premises to meet the needs of her business and the demand from her customers. 

Her goal for the future is to continue to improve the infrastructure of her business through the purchase of new machines that will help her better her production times and increase sales. Her main challenge is the lack of working capital to invest and increase her customer base, and this is what she's aiming to achieve with her Kiva loan. She has now applied for her first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy fabric, lace and other materials wholesale to fulfil orders from her customers and have enough stock to respond effectively to business demand. 

At the moment Rosiris has an employee and a stable client base in the working class neighbourhoods where she sells her finished clothing. She also offers a tailor-made service on a one-to-one basis. Her suppliers are established warehouses in the city of Barranquilla, where she buys in cash. She also provides a consulting service to her customers, advising them on how to dress. 

Her business enjoys a solid financial situation, with good liquidity to meet expenses and short-term debt. Outstanding accounts have a good rotation, adapted to the specific needs of her business, and the growth expectations and potential of her business are excellent.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace and other materials wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y un nieto D. 18 años D. edad, ella administra una tienda donD. ofrecer productos D. la canasta básica, este negocio surgió por la necesidad hace 27 años, la atienD. D. 5:00am a 9:00pm, poco a poco ha ido surtiéndola.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, comprando productos como aceite, condimento, huevos, pan y azúcar, estos materiales son necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes, porque le permite mantenerse en las ventas.
Para doña Ana su aspiración es ver su negocio surtido D. mercadería, que cada cliente encuentre lo necesario y esto le permita a ella contar con ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and an 18 year-old grandson.  She runs a store where she sells basic household products.  Her business was born of necessity 27 years ago.  She serves in her store from 5.00am to 9.00pm and has stocked it little by little.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.  She will buy products such as rice, herbs and spices, eggs, bread and sugar.  These are essential products to sell her customers as they allow her to keep making sales.

Ana's aspiration is to see her business stocked with merchandise and each customer able to find what they need.  This will allow her to make income.

loans.use: to buy oil, herbs and spices, eggs, bread and sugar

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has been in dairy farming for 10 years and employs 6 farmhands on a casual basis. His farm produces bananas, coffee, sugarcane, maize, milk and beans. He is married with 2 children ages 8 and 4. Julius also operates a retail shop to supplement his farming income.

Julius has requested a loan of 47,100 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will generate income that will improve his family's living standards and help in paying for the education of his children.

Julius says too much rain is the common challenge in farming since it leads to too much destruction of produce on the farm before maturity.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pablo Vño

texts.en:
Pablo has now been 10 years in a farming business to financially secure the needs of his family. He is 48 years old and been married to a simple housewife. They were blessed with only one child. 

He is accustomed to visiting his rice crop every now and then to ensure that his plants are growing well. He works hard for his only child's future.  He wants him to grow comfortably and with abundance as opposed to what he went through in his childhood. He aims to give him a complete education, because as he said, his profession someday is the only lifetime inheritance he can give him. 

Pablo sees it as an opportunity to take out a loan through KIVA so he is requesting the amount of P18,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides to maintain his crop growth. Part of the loan will be used in irrigating his rice field to cope with the negative effect of drought.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to maintain his crop growth.

loans.name: San Geronimo 4 Group

texts.en:
The San Geronimo solidarity group formed in July, 2011 and is made up of Joaquin, Hector, and Jimmy. Joaquin, the group leader, lives in Choluteca, Honudras with his wife and four children.

Joaquin makes a living by raising and selling livestock, and gets up at 4 a.m. each morning to tend to his herd. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to purchase cattle. In his free time, Joaquin enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes, belts, TV controls, flashlights, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela es una mujer casada que vive en el barrio 20 de Julio con su esposo y sus dos hijos, en las edades de 17 y 19 respectivamente. Allí mismo se dedica a la producción y distribución de panes, negocio que inició  en el año 1994, cuando procedente de Barichara en el departamento de Santander, llegó ella y su familia a la Costa Caribe Colombiana y se residenciaron en casa de su cuñado inicialmente,  para 3 meses después arrendar una tienda y dedicarse a producir para su familia durante 5 años y posteriormente con su hermano y su esposo,  emprendieron el hoy negocio de fabricar panes y venderlos tienda a tienda, negocio a negocio y en la comunidad. Su sueño más adelante es lograr la preparación personal y profesional de sus hijos, y hacer un segundo piso para independizar el espacio productivo del familiar.

Mientras todo esto ocurre, en su negocio maneja una rotación de inventarios de 1 día, porque compra diariamente, así como también vende diario sus clientela que la conforman un gran volumen de distribuidores de panadería en tiendas, quienes llegan al negocio con sus motoscicletas o bicicletas para llenar sus canastas   y una vez lo logran, van de negocio en negocio a distribuir los panes por  toda la ciudad; ellos compran los  panes a crédito todas las tardes y cuando terminan de vender o sea en esa misma tarde o en la mañana siguiente, le pagan a Mariela.  Su rentabilidad aunque es muy pequeña, el volumen de ventas le permite la sostenibilidad de su negocio y también le permite lograr el bienestar familiar. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograr su crecimiento y expansión a otros municipios, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como harina de trigo, mantequilla, vitina, huevos, queso, con lo cual aumentaría su capacidad productiva y con ello sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mariela is a married woman who lives in the "20 de Julio" neighborhood with her husband and two children, aged 17 and 19 respectively. 

She works in the production and distribution of bread, a business that she started in 1994 when she and her family came to the Colombian Caribbean from Barichara in the department of Santander. At first they stayed with her brother-in-law, then after three months she rented a shop and worked for the next five years at generating an income for the family. After that she, her husband and her bother launched the business that they still run today, making and selling bread for the shops and businesses in the community. 

Her dream for the future is that her children should achieve a personal and professional education. She would also like to build a second floor so that she can separate their living and working spaces.  

Currently her business has a one-day inventory turnover, because her product is purchased daily. She sells daily to her client base which is made up of bread distributors who arrive at her business with their motorcycles or bicycles to fill up their baskets, and from there they go from business to business to sell bread throughout the city. They buy the bread on credit every afternoon, and when they have finished selling that day or the following morning they pay Mariela. Her profit is still very small but the volume of sales allows her to sustain her business and expand to other municipalities. Her biggest challenge is insufficient working capital to achieve growth. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first funding from Kiva Field Partner, Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use the loan to buy basic ingredients such as wheat flour, butter, eggs and cheese, thereby increasing her productive capacity and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients such as wheat flour, butter, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Jacqueline Lizbeth

texts.es: La Srta. Jacqueline es soltera,tiene 22 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza (perfumes, cosméticos, cremas, etc.), no tiene carga familiar y cuenta con buenas referencias personales por parte de sus vecinos. Su negocio básicamente esta situado en el domicilio donde vive, el cual pertenece a sus padres. Su sueño de Jackeline es poder ampliar su negocio y aperturar su propio local donde poder exhibir sus productos. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas productos y en una vitrina para mostrar sus artículos de belleza. La Srta. Jacqueline manifiesta que esta muy agradecida por el crédito que se le ha brindado ya que esta desarrollando sus metas y sueños.
texts.en: Jacqueline is 22 years old, she is single and she engages in selling beauty products (perfumes, cosmetics, creams and so on). She has no family of her own to be responsible for, and she can count on good references form her neighbors. Her activity is mainly located in the house where she lives, which belongs to her parents. Jacqueline’s dream is to expand her activity and to open her own shop where to put her products on display. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchases of more products and of a showcase to display her beauty products. Jacqueline says she is very grateful for the loans she has been granted, as it is helping her carrying out her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a display case for her products

loans.name: Melva Albertina

texts.es:
Melva, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, vive con su esposo y un hijo D. 8 años, ella aprendió a hacer tortillas desD. joven, pero decidió instalar el negocio por necesidad, ya que quería tener una fuente D. ingresos y colaborar con el esposo en los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. maíz y leña, pues estos materiales son los necesarios para preparar la venta D. tortillas.
Su objetivo es generar ganancias del negocio, invirtiendo en materiales para tener la disponibilidad D. materia prima.
texts.en:
Melva sells tortillas.  She lives with her husband and 8 year-old son.  She learned how to make tortillas when she was young but decided to set up her business through necessity as she wanted to have a source of income and support her husband with their household expenses.

Melva is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood as these materials are necessary for making her tortillas.

Melva's goal is to make profits from her business, investing in supplies so that she can have raw materials available.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for making her tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a course in cosmetology and to buy supplies so that her beauty salon looks better.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, age 47, is married and has five children. Her husband helps her in managing her general store and in taking care of their children or family as a whole. She sells everyday products in the store situated near their town in Isabella province. 

Her husband purchases goods to sell twice a week in a "tricycle", going to the wholesale grocery store. Her observed average daily net income is as low as P 300 and is used to save for future use and loan amortizations every week.  

Edna is asking for a loan of P 19,000 to purchase drinks, spices, snack foods and vegetable oil to sell in the store.  She carefully and responsibly does her task to grow as an entrepreneur and a borrower at the same time to improve whatever business she may have someday.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, spices, snack foods and vegetable oil to sell.

loans.name: Bernarda Del Carmen

texts.en: Bernarda lives in Choluteca, Honduras where she makes a living selling cosmetics and cookware. Bernarda has run this business for several years and has a good customer base in her village. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase lotion, deodorant, moisturizer, lipstick, eyeliner, foundation, perfume, and cookware

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es: Omaira de 46 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 17 años, allí se dedica a la venta de queso, y también  comercializa mercancía variada como sabanas, toallas, productos cosméticos y todo lo que sus clientes necesiten y puedan pagar, con tal de tenerlos satisfechos. Cuando inició su aventura emprendedora en el año 2002, lo hizo porque quedó desempleada , así fue como en un principio se dedicó a la venta de carnes frías entre su primer mercado doméstico, sus  amigos y familiares, gradualmente adicionó a su negocio la venta de queso a crédito, de lo que  recibía un pago semanal y como construyó una clientela fija y se fue capitalizando, identificó necesidades entre sus clientes que a ella le pudieran generar ingresos , así fue como mediante pedidos se dedicó también a la venta de cosméticos de marcas muy reconocidas, ropa, toallas, sabanas y en general a cubrir necesidades de las amas de casa, por eso estas constituyen hoy,  su más apreciada clientela. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo insuficiente con el que cuenta, pues diariamente agrega a su negocio nuevos clientes y no puede responder tan oportunamente como ella quisiera, este es la razón de acceder a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará productos de tocador, perfumería, productos de baño y de cama. Su mayor desafío es lograr una adecuación de su vivienda y que sus hijos logren realizar estudios universitarios y sean persona exitosas..
texts.en:
Omaira is 46 years old and lives in the town of Soledad, 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her husband and their two children ages 13 and 17. 

Omaira sells cheese and a variety of merchandise such as sheets, towels, cosmetics, and anything that her customers need and can pay for.  She started her entrepreneurial venture in 2002 because she was unemployed.  In the beginning she sold cold cuts along with other domestic merchandise to her friends and family.   Gradually, she added cheese sales on credit from which she received a weekly income and built a steady clientele.  She capitalized by identifying her customer's needs which enabled her to generate income.  This is how she started taking orders for name brand cosmetics, clothing, towels, sheets, and in general, merchandise to cover the needs of housewives, her most valued customers.   

Her greatest challenge is insufficient working capital, so every day she has to add new customers to her business and can't respond as promptly as she would like.  For this reason she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy toiletries, perfumes, and bed and bath products.  Other major challenges for her are having adequate housing and sending her children to college so that they can be successful people.

loans.use: buy toiletries, perfumes, and bed and bath products.

loans.name: Ana Yancy

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, tiene varios años de dedicarse al negocio, lo realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo varias calles ofreciendo la mercadería.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frutas como manzanas, sandia, jocotes, papayas y piñas, esta compra le ayudara para tener suficiente productos para continuar vendiendo y generando ganancias para su familia.
El sueño de Ana es que algún día pueda su propia vivienda, donde llevar a sus hijos para que crezcan cómodamente y tengan una vida digna.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and two children.  Her business is selling fruit and vegetables.  She has been in this business for several years and makes her sales as an itinerant vendor, walking through several streets selling her merchandise.  She is requesting a loan to buy fruit such as apples, watermelons, jocotes (hog plums), papayas and pineapples.  This purchase will help her to have enough products to continue making sales and making profits for her family.

Ana's dream is to some day be able to own her own home where her children can grow up comfortably and have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, watermelons, jocotes, papayas and pineapples

loans.name: Karla Guadalupe

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Karla le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía.
Solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en compra de zapatos, juguetes y aparatos de electricidad (Cafeteras, planchas, licuadoras y tostadores) ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para  comprar la mercancía y así tener ingreso a su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene tres hijo bajo su responsabilidad y desea que tengan los estudios necesario para su futuro. 
Doña Karla planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio con la nueva inversión que realizara con este préstamo.
texts.en:
Karla’s business needs more variety of merchandise.  She is asking for a loan to buy shoes, toys and home appliances (coffee makers, irons, blenders and toasters) because she lacks the necessary capital to buy the merchandise to generate family income since she’s a single mother with three children in her care and she wants them to have the necessary schooling for the future.

Karla plans to repay the loan with profits obtained in her business that’s she’ll earn thanks to the new investment she’ll make with this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing sales.

loans.name: Sadith Jacqueline

texts.es: La Sra. Sadith tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo vive con uno, quien esta en edad escolar, Sadith se dedica a la venta de cerveza y licores, el cual se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio ya que este se encuentra en buena zona comercial; el crédito lo va a invertir en el abastecimiento de su negocio (compra de cerveza); su sueño de Sadith es poder ampliar su bar y poder vender comida. La Sra. Sadith esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Sadith, 35, is a single mother.  She has four children but only one who is still school age lives with her.  Sadith sells beer and liquor from home since it’s located in a good commercial area.  She will use the loan to buy stock items for the store (to purchase beer).  Sadith’s dream is to be able to expand the bar to be able to sell food.  Sadith is very grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase leather, glue, nails, soles, insoles, laces, and heels.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery, de 42 años, es una mujer trabajadora, esta casado con Eleazar, su esposo, ambos tienen 7 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Unión Leticia. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño cuarto que acondicionó en su hogar, ya por las noches vende hamburguesas; este oficio le resulta muy rentable y puede apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Pero no solo a esa actividad se dedica Nery, desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra, ya cuando creció y consolido su familia, comenzó a adquirir terrenos de cultivo en los que siembra habas, arveja y espinaca; con el tiempo y la experiencia que tiene, logró adecuarse bien al mercado y alquiló más terrenos de cultivo, con ello puede sembrar en grandes cantidades, por ende obtiene mejores ganancias. Ahora ella quiere comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo; como también abrir su propio restaurante, donde está segura obtendrá buenas ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde reina la unión y solidaridad. Por ello espera de un pequeño apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes.
Nery de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su cultivo de habas, ya que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Nery, 42, is a hard working woman married to Eleazar, her husband.  They have 7 children and live in a rented house in Unión Leticia.  Starting early every morning she starts selling food from a small room she equipped at home for this purpose.  At night she sells hamburgers.  This occupation is quite profitable and she’s able to help cover household expenses.  

But, this isn’t Nery’s only occupation.  Since she was a little girl she learned how to work the land and when she grew up and formed her own family she started to acquire farmland where she grows Lima beans, peas and spinach.  With the time spent and experience she’s gained she managed to secure a spot in the market and she has leased more land which allows her to plant even greater amounts and thus earn better profits.  Now, she wants to buy her own land as well as open a restaurant of her own where she’s sure she’ll earn good profits.

She is a member of the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank and this is the sixth MFP loan where she is very happy to belong to her communal bank where unity and solidarity reign.  She’s hoping for a small financial support to continue with her plans.

If Nery were to receive your support, she’ll invest the requested money in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her Lima bean crops which will be harvested soon.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.en:
Nemesio is a responsible father to his two children and a loving husband to his wife. He gives his best in the  farming business just to feed his family abundantly. He is now 49 years old yet very hopeful to uplift his family out poverty. 

Nemesio is asking for the loan amount of P 15,000 to purchase gasoline or crude to use in irrigating his rice field to maintain a quality harvest. He always sees to the development of the business.  Because of his dedication in his work, Nemesio shared that he was able generate P 50,000 average net income that he used to support the studies of his children and in maintaining their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline or crude to use in irrigating his rice field.

loans.name: Iyali Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Iyali". Está ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Maria de los Angeles es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 31 años, estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de pan, ella tiene 3 hijos, inició hace 4 años ya que su esposo tuvo un accidente grave y lo dejo paralitico por lo que emprendio este negocio para poder mantener a su familia, la señora piensa que apesar de todo puede salir adelante con el apoyo de su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar pan de dulce. Sus clientes son personas de su comunidad que la prefieren por su buen trato y por la calidad de su pan. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir. También espera con esto obtener mejores ganancias y así tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This group is called "Iyali" and it is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico.  The group has ten members.  Maria de los Angeles is the group's president.  She is 31 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She has three children and she sells bread for a living.  She started this business four years ago as her husband had a serious accident which left him paralyzed.  She started the business so that she could support her family.  Maria believes that, in spite of everything, she can get ahead in life with the help of her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy 'pan de dulce' (sweet bread).  Her customers are people from her community who prefer to buy from her because of her good customer service and the quality of her bread.  At the time of requesting this loan, she feels excited and has a great desire to do well.  She hopes that she will be able to make better profits and thereby be able to enjoy a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy bread and sweet treats

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan   lives in Uganda.  She is single and has three children, one of whom is in school.  Susan has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week.  

Susan sells her products from home, wholesale.   She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through   brick laying.

The main business challenges for Susan include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only.    Susan lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include   food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer de 42 años, que vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 5 años de edad y desde hace 1 año, impulsada con apoyar a su esposo en la gestión de su hogar y su necesidad personal de sentirse útil a su familia, decidió en compañía de su esposo vender queso en el barrio donde antes vivía, pues allí tenía muchos conocidos amigos y familiares que apoyarían su iniciativa, como hasta la presente ha ocurrido, pues ellos en la actualidad son su principal mercado y también ha agregado empleados de la empresa donde trabaja su esposo y muchos referidos, que ahora conocen la calidad de sus producto. Cuando construyó este mercado,  decidió darle rienda suelta a su creatividad e incursionó en la venta de deditos de queso, empacadas en pequeñas bandejas, aprovechando su materia prima que es el queso, producto que ella compra en mayor cantidad ,  y es otro negocio que le suministra ingresos simultáneos y con el que le ha ido muy bien. Como también con productos complementarios que prepara y vende como los bolis de frutas , productos congelados a base de frutas naturales de la región, como guanábana, mango, coco y hasta chocolate.  Su mayor anhelo es que su microempresa tenga una mejor infraestructura y que logre apoyar la sostenibilidad y el crecimiento personal y profesional de su familia. Mientras esto ocurre trabaja en su negocio con un margen de contribución del 61,29%  y con muchas ganas de incrementar su capital de trabajo para expandir sus productos. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará implementos de cocina, como la mesa en lámina galvanizada, una vitrina calentadora, un horno para pizza, pues aprovecharía el conocimiento técnico que tiene su esposo en la preparación de este último productos, que planea impacte a la comunidad pues no hay mucha competencia en el barrio y en sus alrededores, para finalmente generar nuevos ingresos.
texts.en: Isabel is a 42-year old woman who lives with her partner and their 5-year old son. Last year she felt motivated to help her husband with the household finances and she had a personal need to feel useful for her family. So she decided to start selling cheese with her husband in a community where they used to live. They have many acquaintances, friends, and family there who supported their initiative and continue to do so to date. They are their primary market and they have also acquired as clients the employees of the company where he works and other referred clients who now know about the quality of their products. When built her business she decided to let her creativity run free and she began selling cheese fingers packaged in small bundles. She took advantage of the fact that the primary product is cheese and it is a product that she buys in larger quantities. This is another business that earns a second source of income and it has done very well. She also sells complimentary products that she prepares, such as frozen fruit snacks. She prepares them with natural fruits from the region, such as soursop, mango, coconut, and even chocolate. Her greatest dream is to give her business a better infrastructure and to be able to support the person and professional development of her family. As she works towards her goals she works with a contribution margin of 61.29%. She is very eager to increase her working capital to expand her products. This is exactly the reason why she requests a Kiva loan, a first time loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase kitchen implements such as a galvanized steel table, a heated display, and a pizza oven. She will be able to profit from her husband's technical knowledge with respect to the preparation of these products. She plans to have an affect on the community especially because there is not much competition in their neighborhood and surrounding areas. Her goal is to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen implements such as a galvanized steel table, a heated display, and a pizza oven.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Mariam has a business of selling old clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Mariam sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Mariam has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through frying chapats. The main business challenges for Mariam include seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes and also to be a wholesaler. She would also like to build her own house. 

Mariam lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (father). Farida has a business of selling sugar canes. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  

Farida sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale. She has requested a loan for 500,000 Ugandan Shillings, from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugar canes. The main business challenge(s) for Farida include seasonality and transportation of bundles of sugar canes from the villages to her stall. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van. Farida lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugar canes.

loans.name: Rene Adalid

texts.en: Rene lives in Choluteca, Honduras where he runs a metalworking shop. He has had this business for the past 8 years and works for commercial customers as well as private homeowners. Rene is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to purchase materials.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, corrugated tin, iron, and solder

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, convive con Roberto, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos; Frank, Jean y Derlis; ellos viven en armonía familiar en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia. Todas las mañanas a primeras horas del día trabaja en un programa de apoyo, promovido por el gobierno peruano, “Construyendo Perú”; ahí se dedica a limpiar las calles de su localidad ya que el relieve en el distrito es accidentado, las quebradas, laderas o pendientes, pampas, impide el transito de sus habitantes; aquí Faustina trabaja arduamente para poder ayudar a los pobladores de su localidad; ya en las tardes y muy animada, se dirige a su terreno de cultivo donde hace ya 20 años se dedica a la siembra de zanahoria, papa, maíz y lechuga; los que posteriormente vende en el mercado central de su ciudad de Tarma. Además de cuidar de sus pequeños conejos, a quienes alimenta para poder venderlos. Lo que más le gusta a ella es trabajar junto a su familia en su terreno de cultivo, es por ello que está juntando dinero para poder comprarse su propia casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está feliz de pertenecer a su asociación, donde encuentra alegría y progreso. Además de aprender a ser cada día mejor. Por ello espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Faustina de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para el maíz que está cultivando, como también semillas para el cultivo de zanahoria que posteriormente sembrará.
texts.en: Faustina is 39 years old and she is a very hardworking and happy woman. She lives together with her husband Roberto and they have 3 children together: Frank, Jean, and Derlis. They live with family harmony in a rental house located in the community of La Union Leticia. Every morning for the first hours of the day she works in a support program set forth by the Peruvian government named "Construyendo Peru", meaning "Building Peru". She cleans the streets of her community. The geography of the district is rugged terrain, meaning that the hillsides or slopes and the grasslands prevent the transit of its inhabitants. Faustina works arduously to help the population in her locality. In the afternoons she sets out very eagerly to work in the cultivation she has maintained for 20 years, planting carrots, potatoes, corn, and lettuce. Later on she sells the produce in the central market of the city of Tarma. She also raises and feeds small rabbits for later resale. What she most enjoys is working together with her family on their plantation. She is saving money to buy a house of their own. She is a member of the communal bank "La Union Hace la Fuerza", meaning "Strength comes from Unity" and it is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is happy to be part of this organization, finding happiness and progress. She also learns to improve more every day. She hopes to have the support from all of you to be able to continue on with her objectives. Faustina will invest the funds she requests in the purchase of natural fertilizers for the corn she is cultivating and she will also purchase seeds for the carrot plantation she will subsequently start.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and carrot seeds.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.es: Lilibeth de 29 años de edad vende ropa productos capilares y medicina natural, en su negocio ubicado en su propia casa donde vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella inició su negocio hace 10 años pues lo aprendió de su madre que en ese momento tenía su actividad mercantilista, que ofrecía en Sincelejo, capital del departamento de Sucre, ubicada al noroeste del país, en la Costa Caribe Colombiana, lugar donde viajaba con gran frecuencia. Así fue como Lilibeth entusiasmada por su madre aplicó esta experiencia en la ciudad de barranquilla y allí comenzó su estrategia de mercado, e inició su negocio con el que actualmente cuenta para para lograr un importante ingreso y apoya a su cónyuge en el hogar. Lilibeth hoy ha agregado nuevas líneas de productos, como ropa femenina y le ha ido muy bien con sus clientes, pero  su capital de trabajo aun no es suficiente para responder oportunamente a sus compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante un credikiva, pues con él comprará jeans, suéteres y  sandalias en mayor volumen y ganaría descuentos por hacerla de contado y en mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Lilibeth is 29 years old and she sells clothing, skin products, and natural medicines. She has her business in her own home, where she lives with her husband and their 6-year old son. She started out her business 10 years ago, having learned from her mother. At that time she had her business in Sincelejo, capital city of the department of Sucre, located in the north east of the country, on the Columbian coast to the Caribbean. It was a location to where she traveled frequently. Lilibeth started out under her mother's encouragement and by applying her experience in the city of Barranquilla. She started her market strategy and she started out the business which she still has and it represents an important source of income with which she is able to help her husband with the support of the household. Lilibeth has added new lines of products, such as ladies' clothing and it has done very well with her clients. But her working capital is still not enough to respond in a timely manner to her buyers. She applies for a first time Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase jeans, sweaters, and sandals in larger volumes in order to qualify for volume and cash discounts.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, sweaters, and sandals in larger quantities.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica Niagara lives in Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly mother).  

Monica has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Monica sells her products from home, by means of wholesale. Monica has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings, from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, a bag of maize flour and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through selling raw food. The main business challenge(s) for Monica include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler.     

Monica lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, a bag of maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Karen Maria

texts.es: Karen Maria tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 7 años que tiene el negocio,  es una persona muy abnegada pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, Karen tiene que alistarse temprano todos los días para alistar su bolso y salir a ofrecer polvos, lápiz labial, brillos, cremas, shampoo y perfumes. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de estos productos. Sueña con establecer una pequeña tienda en donde quiere aumentar su inventario.
texts.en: Karen María, 37, sells cosmetics.  She’s had this business for over 7 years.  She is a very self-sacrificing person for she is always watchful of her customers’ requests.  She has two minor children in her care.  Karen must get ready early every day to arrange her bag and go out to sell compacts, lipsticks, glitter, creams, shampoo and perfume.  She is asking for the loan to buy these products.  She dreams with setting up a small store where she wants to increase her stock inventory.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother). 

Matilda has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Matilda sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested for a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings, from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Matilda include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell by wholesale only. 

Matilda lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity and she doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith de 43 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora; ella convive con Wilfredo con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia. Con la ayuda, empeño y dedicación de su esposo pudo progresar y lograr sus objetivos, ya tiene 2 casas y ahora quiere comprarse un camión, con ello podrá trasladar los productos que hace 21 años viene sembrando con esmero y ahínco. En su terreno de cultivo siembra, arveja, papa y maíz, los que después de cada cosecha, lleva a la capital del país para comercializar a los compradores del mercado central, donde le pagan más por los alimentos que produce. Edith viaja por lo menos 3 veces por semana, de adquirir un camión, reducirían los gastos de envío. Le gusta mucho la agricultura y sobre todo sembrar arveja, porqué invierte poco y obtiene mayores utilidades en corto tiempo, menciona con mucha serenidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus planes. Además se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Edith de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para distribuirlos en sus cultivos de habas.
texts.en: Edith, 43 years old, is a happy and hard-working woman.  She lives with Wilfredo, with whom she has 5 children.  They live with only 3 of them in their own house located in the town of La Unión Leticia.  With the help, determination, and dedication of her spouse, she was able to make progress and meet her goals.  She already has 2 houses and now wants to buy a truck.  With it, she could transport the produce that she has been growing with care and diligence for 21 years.  On her farmland she grows peas, potatoes, and corn.  After each harvest, she brings them to the country's capital to sell to the buyers from the central market, where they pay more for the food she produces.  Edith travels at least 3 times a week, and acquiring a truck would reduce the shipping costs.  She likes farming a lot, above all planting peas, because she invests little and earns more profit in a short time, she mentions very serenely.  She belongs to the "La unión hace la fuerza" communal bank, and this is her third credit with MFP.  She hopes for the support of all of you to continue with her plans.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Edith, when she receives your support, will use the money she is asking for to purchase natural fertilizers to spread on her bean fields.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos de 31 años de edad, hace menos de dos años empezó a trabajar como ayudante de una microempresa de artesanías y manualidades y unos meses después de haber iniciado, el propietario de este negocio se fue a Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, dejándolo encargado de este negocio. Carlos aprovecho para disciplinarse y ahorrar, así como para adquirir herramientas de trabajo y construir su propia clientela. Gradualmente continuó especializándose en este aprendizaje, mientras estudia para ser el futuro abogado con el que sueña. Como en la actualidad maneja líneas de productos dirigidos a jóvenes,   almacenes cristianos y distribuidores nacionales, tambien ha construido un mercado en la universidad donde estudia, así como también en el sector donde vive, pues es usual que los jóvenes usen escapularios, rosarios y que las amas de casa celebren sus fiestas entregando en ella souvenires como estampas, botones etc. 
En la actualidad su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo, que no lo deja expandirse y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales como productos resinados, cueros, ganchos, argollas para producir artesanías pues tiene un importante pedido y debe comprar en volumen y de contado, para obtener un buen descuento y responder a su nuevo cliente, con el fin de fidelizarlo y que regrese a comprarle. Su meta más adelante es finalizar su carrera de derecho, y ayudar con su negocio a su familia. Mientras esto ocurre, Carlos trabaja con un empleado a quien le paga diariamente, en su sector no tiene competencia, maneja su microempresa con un margen de contribución del 44.22% y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas promedia de 28,36%.
texts.en:
Carlos, 31, started working as an assistant at a crafts and manual arts micro business a little less than two years ago.  A few months after starting, the owner of this business moved to Bogotá, the capital of Colombia, leaving him in charge of the business.  Carlos took advantage of this to become disciplined and to save up as well as to acquire work tools and establish his own clientele.  Gradually, he continued to specialize in these skills while studying Law to become a lawyer in the future, which is his dream.  He currently handles lines of merchandise directed to young people, Christian stores and national distributors, he’s also built up a market at the university he attends as well as in his neighborhood because it’s common for the young people to wear scapulars and rosaries and it’s also customary for housewives to give away souvenirs at their parties like religious prints, buttons, etc.

His main challenge right now is insufficient working capital which keeps him from expanding and this is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy materials like resinated products, leather, hooks and hoops to make crafts because he has an important pending order and he must buy in quantity and pay cash to receive a good discount and be able to keep his commitment to his new customer to win him over and make him a regular, repeat customer.  His goal for later on is to finish getting his Law degree and help his family with his business.  While this occurs, Carlos works with one employee that he pays daily.  He has no competition in his sector and is handling a contribution margin of 44.22% and a profit margin on sales averaging 28.36%.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Diarío Javier

texts.es:
Darío, un hombre de 33 años nacido en Pedernales en la provincia de Esmeraldas tiene una hija de 8 años. Desde hace 2 años vende fruta en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Vive con su madre Silvia quien es comerciante. Desde muy joven se dedicaba a ayudar a sus padres en la actividad que hoy es su sustento.

Nos cuenta que uno de los obstáculos que ha tenido en su vida es haber dejado los estudios ya que debía trabajar y ayudar a su madre. El sueña con algún día vender fruta que él mismo produzca, es decir tener sus propias plantaciones.

Solicitó a Fundación Alternativa un crédito el cual le permita invertir en fruta ofrecida por proveedores mayoristas que le dan un precio menor que los actuales y así poder ser más competitivo y que su margen de ganancia sea mayor. A darío le gusta mucho compartir con su hija y su madre, el espera que mejorando su situación económica pueda darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Darío is 33 years old.  He was born in Pedernales in the Esmeraldas province.  He has an eight year old daughter.

He has been selling fruit in the Santo Domingo canton in the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province for two years.  He lives with his mother, Silvia, a merchant.  Since he was very young he has helped his parents in the business activity that is now his support.

He tells us that one of the obstacles that he has had in his life is having left school because he needed to work and help his mother. 

His dream is to one day sell fruit that he himself produces.  In other words, he wants to have his own fields.

He requested a loan from the Fundación Alternativa.  It will allow him to buy fruit from wholesale providers.  They give him a cheaper price than what he now pays.  That way he will be able to be more competitive, and his margin of earnings will be bigger.

Darío really likes spending time with his daughter and his mother.  He hopes to improve his financial situation to be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: La siempre alegre Lizet de 29 años, es una mujer feliz; pues ama a su esposo Oscar con quien tiene una hija, Jatniel de 5 años, a la que educan en unión familia. En su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar. Para cuidar adecuadamente de su familia, dejo su trabajo de profesora de inicial; donde cuidaba a niños menores de 5 años, pero asegura que muy pronto regresará. Asimismo su esposo trabaja en el gobierno local como ingeniero agrónomo, en proyectos de desarrollo rural. Consiente de los gastos que ocasionó dejar su trabajo. Ella abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad y materiales de escritorio. Pero la actividad que apasiona a Lizet y Oscar es la agricultura. En sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas siembra café, el cual cosecha una vez al año, vendiendo su grano a la cooperativa de la localidad de Sanchirio Palomar, por intermedio de su padre, que es uno de los socios de la cooperativa. Ahora ella desea mejorar su producción y seguir progresando con su negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura que concretará sus objetivos, pues espera del apoyo financiero de todos ustedes. Lizet de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus plantaciones de café. Además de surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
The ever-cheerful Lizet, 29, is a happy woman because she loves her husband, Oscar.  They have a daughter, Jatniel, 5, who they educate in family unity in their own house located in Unión Palomar.

In order to adequately care for her family, she left her job as a pre-school Teacher where she cared for children under the age of 5 but she assures that she will return to work soon.  Her husband works for the local government as an Agronomy Engineer on rural development projects.  

Aware of the costs that her leaving work entailed, she opened a small grocery store in her house where she sells basic need items and stationery supplies.  But what Lizet and Oscar are most passionate about is agriculture.  She grows coffee on her four hectares of land that is harvested once a year.  She sells her grains to the cooperative in Sanchirio Palomar through her father who is a member of the cooperative.

She now wants to improve production and continue to progress with her store.  She is a member of the “Desarrollando para el Progress de Prisma”  (Developing for Prisma’s Progress) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where she is sure she’ll reach her objectives because she hopes to get financial support from all of you.

If Lizet were to get your support she will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among her coffee plans as well as merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and stock items for her store.

loans.name: Karim Patricia

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y ahi conocimos a la socia Karin y nos cuenta:
