“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 37 años edad, soy madre soletera y tengo dos hijos y vivó en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico que es la repostería”.
 
Karin tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde prepara tortas, pasteles y otras cosas más. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Karin requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina preparada, maicena, leche, huevos, chantillí, mantequilla y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Patrón Santiago de Santiago" meets every month in the city of Cusco and there we met one of the members, Karin, who told us the following:

"I was born in the city of Cusco, I'm 37 and a single mother with two sons.  I live in the same city I was born in and that's where I have my bakery business.".

Karin has a small shop in her house where she prepares cakes, pies and other products.  She has been in business for three years and it has gone well thanks to all the effort she puts into it.  Karin is in need of a loan to buy ingredients such as prepared flour, corn starch, milk, eggs, whipped cream, butter and other items.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as prepared flour, corn starch, milk, eggs, whipped cream, butter and other items.

loans.name: Marlis

texts.es: Marlis es una mujer de 41 años, muy emprendedora que vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 20 años; a sus 25 años empezó un proceso de aprendizaje en el arte de la confección de ropa, haciendo cursos en una caja de compensación y en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “Sena” , organizaciones a quien le debe su conocimiento técnico del oficio. Todo esto fue impulsado porque debía lograr el sostenimiento de su hija mayor, (única en ese momento), y emprender una actividad que le generara ingresos. Así fue que cuando emprendió su negocio lo hizo ofreciendo servicios de confección de ropa,  con la estrategia de mercado, uno a uno o sobre las medidas particulares de cada cliente y este fue su principal mercado. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido y desea mejorar su infraestructura, así como agregarle calidad al proceso con maquinarias que le faciliten su tarea. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva con el cual comprará una maquina “sobre hilo-puntada de seguridad”, además de telas y agujas, que necesita para tener un stock y desarrollar su creatividad con nuevos diseños de confección.  Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos logren ser profesionales y que el crecimiento de su negocio, sea parte de su estrategia para lograrlo. Mientras esto ocurre, se esfuerza trabajando en su máquina día a día y manejando una rotación de inventarios de 13 días, de sus cuentas por cobrar de 9 días  y un capital de trabajo que no responde al cumplimiento de sus sueños, por esto planea hacerlo crecer  y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su financiación con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo..
texts.en:
Marlis, 41, is a very enterprising woman living with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 11 to 20.  At the age of 25 she started an apprenticeship learning dressmaking skills taking courses at non-profit social service agencies and at SENA, the National Learning Service, organizations that she owes all her technical training to.  All of this was motivated by her need to support her oldest daughter (the only one at the moment) and to start an activity that would generate income.  

This is how she started the business.  She did it offering dressmaking services and her market strategy was either one on one or made to order for each customer; this was her main market.  Currently, her business has grown and she wants to improve its infrastructure as well as improving the quality with machines that make her job easier.  This is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan to buy an overlock with chain stitch machine as well as fabric and needles that she needs to have in stock to develop her creativity and new dress designs to manufacture.

Her greatest dream is that her children manage to become professionals and that her business’s growth becomes the strategy for its attainment.  While this occurs, she works hard at her sewing machine every day.  Her inventory turns over every 13 days and her accounts receivable in 9 days.  Her working capital does not quite suffice to reach her dreams and this is why she plans to make it grow and the reason behind her loan request to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

loans.use: to buy an overlock with chain stitch sewing machine as well as fabric and needles.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y ahi conocimos a la socia Cristina y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 37 años edad, soy casada y tengo dos hijos y vivó en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico que es la venta de mochilas”. 

Cristina tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de mochilas en el centro comercial “Paraíso”.  Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Cristina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo mochilas, maletines, cartucheras, bolsos y otras cosas más. Su sueño de la socia abrir un tienda donde pueda vender exclusivamente mochilas de marca.
texts.en:
The "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank holds its meetings every thirty days in Cusco city. It is here that we meet the member named Cristina, and she tells us: 

"I was born in Cusco city. I am 37, married, have two children, and live in the same city in which I was born. It is here that I run my business, which is selling backpacks."

Cristina has a small backpack stall in the "Paraiso" shopping centre. She has had this business for two years and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into her work. At the moment, Cristina requires a loan for the purchase of merchandise, for example backpacks, briefcases, cases, bags, and other items. Her dream is to open a store where she can sell brand-name backpacks exclusively.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, for example backpacks, briefcases, cases, bags, and other items.

loans.name: Lucero Del Mañana Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Lucero del mañana”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores, que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran negocios como la venta de ropa, puestos de bazar, pastelería, cocinería, costuras y almacén de abarrotes. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Olga presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto aparece sentada en el primer asiento de izquierda a derecha, se dedica al comercio en general, ya que prepara y vende empanadas, además de instalarse con un puesto de artesanía en una plaza, vendiendo artesanía en macramé, guantes, pantys, ropa de polar, todo esto desde hace 5 años. Ella también comercializa sus productos desde su casa y comenta que le va muy bien.
Su mercadería la compra en una importadora y de acuerdo a cada temporada. 
Con el crédito comprará calzas, calcetines, poleras y camisetas de polar, ropa principalmente para la temporada de invierno, además agregará la venta de anillos. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido, para ofrecer su mercadería.
Olga vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad, sus sueños son costearles una buena educación, de ésta manera brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de participar de los servicios de Fondo Esperanza, ya que además ha conocido experiencias en los negocios de otras socias y la solidaridad existente al interior del grupo del Banco comunal. Considera que las capacitaciones le han servido para potenciar los valores de la institución en el grupo. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "Lucero del Mañana” and has 18 members who all work in different fields including businesses such as clothes sales, market stall, confectionery store, cooking, sewing and grocery store.  All of the bank's members live in the city of Temuco.

Olga is the community bank president.  In the photo she is sitting on a chair on the far left of the picture.  Olga works in commerce.  She makes and sells empanadas and also has a craft stall in the town square where she sells macrame handicrafts, gloves, underwear and fleece clothing.  She has been doing all this for five years.  Olga also sells products from home and says that business is doing very well.  She buys her merchandise from an importer in accordance with each season.

Olga will use her loan to buy pants, socks, fleece tops and t-shirts, mainly winter clothing.  She will also start selling rings.  Her goal is to have an established sales location where she can sell her merchandise.

Olga lives together with her husband and her two children aged 16 and 10.  Her dream is to pay for a good education for her children and thereby provide them with a better quality of life.  She is very happy and grateful to be participating in Fondo Esperanza's services.  She has learned from other members' business experiences and enjoys the level of support that exists within the group.  She believes that the training sessions have helped her to promote the institution's values within the group.

Temuco is the capital of Araucania region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the surrounding areas there are a series of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and a very beautiful native flora and fauna which can be found in nearby nature reserves.  50% of the Mapuches (indigenous people) of our country live in this region.

loans.use: to buy pants, socks, t-shirts and fleece tops, mainly winter season clothes.  She will also buy rings to sell

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Kpakpakanme Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLOIRE A DIEU KPAKPAKANME est composé de cinq personnes qui habitent le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agnès est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Agnès est âgée de 40ans et vit au Bénin. Agnès est mariée à un carreleur du nom de Wilfrid. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Agnès et son mari assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Agnès prépare de la bouillie de maïs qu'elle vend à son domicile. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de sa famille, Agnès vend  des produits divers. Agnès s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLOIRE A DIEU KPAKPAKANME, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The "Gloire a Dieu Kpakpakanme" group comprises five people who live in the same area in Benin. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ in order to raise the level of their businesses. The group representative, named Agnès, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Agnès is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a tiler named Wilfrid. The couple do not have any children. Agnès and her husband together pay for the various household expenses. To achieve this, Agnès prepares maize "bouillie" (a type of starchy porridge) that she sells at home. Along with this activity, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her family, Agnès sells various items. She gets her supplies in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales and income, Agnès is seeking a first loan, together with the other members of the "Gloire a Dieu Kpakpakanme" group.

loans.use: To buy maize.

loans.name: Sousouwe Group

texts.fr: SOUSOUWE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Loukiatou. Les membres du groupe habitent la même maison. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Loukiatou est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Loukiatou est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Abou. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Loukiatou  prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend au Bénin. Loukiatou mène cette activité depuis deux ans. Loukiatou s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Loukiatou et aux autres membres du groupe SOUSOUWE de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: The Sousouwe group comprises three people, and its president (with the raised hand in the photo) is named Loukiatou. The group members live in the same house. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is seeking its first loan through ALIDÉ. Loukiatou is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a merchant named Abou. The couple have two children, both of whom are in school and live with their parents. Having ended her studies in primary school, Loukiatou prepares food that she sells in Benin. She has run this business for two years. She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. This business provides her with an income that helps her pay for various household expenses. This first loan will certainly allow Loukiatou and the other Sousouwe group members to raise the level of their businesses and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: To buy bags of yams.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y conocimos a la socia Hernestina y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 38 años edad, soy madre soltera y tengo un  hijo y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico principal que es la venta de verduras y frutas”. 

Hernestina tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el mercado de Mojospata donde vende verduras y frutas. Ya son cuatro que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Hernestina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo frutas y verduras. Su sueño de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank holds its meetings every thirty days in the city of Cusco. Here we meet the member named Hernestina, and she tells us:

"I was born in Cusco city. I am 38 and a single mother of one child. I live in the city in which I was born and this is where I have my main job: selling fruits and vegetables."

Hernestina has a small stall in the Mojospata market where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has had this business for four years and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into her job. At the moment, Hernestina needs this loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as, for example, fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as, for example, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Luis Clemente

texts.es:
Luis  es un hombre trabajador que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vende toda clase de víveres en su pequeña tienda. Tiene 15 años de antigüedad con su tienda por eso quiere continuar vendiendo víveres para mantener un volumen de ventas mayor. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando ya que también tiene un estudio fotográfico. Con el préstamo desea comprar mas víveres como arroz, enlatados, bebidas para poder venderlos a un mayor volumen y así mejorar la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking man who has a small store in the front of his house.  He sells all kinds of groceries in his small store.  He has had this store for 15 years, and he wants to continue selling groceries to maintain a higher sales volume.

He has a lot of aspirations for his business, and so he wants to continue working, since he also has a photographic studio.  With this loan he wants to buy more groceries such as: rice, canned goods, and drinks, so that he can sell them in greater volume and in this way improve his family's life.

loans.use: rice, canned goods and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, treatments, general clothing, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Ledis

texts.es: Ledis de 43 años y madre de dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 9 años,  no tiene otra meta que apoyar a sus hijos para que sean felices y triunfadores.  Ella tiene como actividad principal la compra y venta de cervezas, gaseosas y Pony Malta al por mayor y al detal, negocio que nació hace 3 años   y  cuenta con una experiencia de 10.  Su negocio funciona en un apartamento  propio en la urbanización Las  Cayenas. Maneja  ventas de contado y a crédito, su principal mercado lo constituyen   vecinos del sector, tiendas, negocios aledaños y amistades.  Ledis como es una mujer trabajadora también  cuenta con otros ingresos  productos de la   venta de dulces y artículos ofrecidos mediante guías especializadas, mientras también trabaja como coordinadora de un colegio privado. Su negocio cuenta con unos excelentes estados financieros, una excelente capacidad de pago y un buen patrimonio que respaldan sus operaciones de financiación. Ledis planea hacer crecer su negocio porque está entusiasmada, pues cada día se extiende más su clientela, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará mercancías variadas, y cajas de refrescos y bebidas en mayor volumen, aprovechando así su buena clientela y su reconocimiento en es esta urbanización.
texts.en:
Ledis is 43 years old and the mother of two children who are 7 and 9 years old. Her sole goal is to support her children so that they are happy and successful. Her main business is the purchase and sale of beer, soft drinks and Pony Malta [a brand of wheat soda] for wholesale and retail sale. She started the business three years ago and has ten years of experience. She runs her business in her own apartment located in the neighborhood of Las Cayenas.

She operates both cash and credit sales. Her main market consists of neighbors, stores, neighboring businesses and friends. Ledis is a hard working woman. She has other sources of income including candy sales and products offered through catalogues, in addition to working as the coordinator of a private school. Her business is in excellent financial condition, very solvent and a good asset that supports her finances.

Ledis plans to grow her business because she is enthusiastic. Every day she expands her customer base. This is why she is getting this loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase a variety of merchandise and crates of wholesale soft drinks and beverages, taking advantage of her good customer base and her recognition around the neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise and crates of wholesale soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Kory

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un commerçant établi dans le marché central de sa localité ou il gère une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et de consommation courante.Il est marié et père d'un enfant.Il s'occupe avec son commerce des dépenses d'alimentation, de santé, d'habillement, de consommation d'électricité de sa famille. La position de sa boutique, située au cœur du marché lui a permis d'attirer de plus en plus de clientèle et de faire des bénéfices consistants.Pour satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse d'augmenter, il sollicite un crédit de 500 000F afin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises.Ainsi, il compte acheter 20 sacs de riz, 05 barils d'huile, 50 caisses d sucre, 30 caisses de lait, 10 sacs d'aliment bétail et des produits divers. Les bénéfices générés par la vente de ces produits lui serviront à la prise en charge de sa petite famille. Il ambitionne d'ouvrir un magasin de vente de produits alimentaires .
texts.en:
This borrower is an established merchant at the central market in his town where he runs a shop selling grocery items and typical consumables. He is married and the father of one child. With his business, he covers the cost of food, health care, clothing, and electrical use for his family. His shop, located in the heart of the market, enables him to attract more and more customers and to make substantial profits. 

To satisfy the ever-increasing demand, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to increase his stock of merchandise. Thus, he intends to buy 20 sacks of rice, 5 barrels of oil, 50 cases of sugar, 30 cases of milk, 10 sacks of animal feed, and various products. 

The profits generated by the sale of these goods will serve to support his small family. His ambition is to open a store for selling grocery items.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of rice, f barrels of oil, 50 cases of sugar, 30  cases of milk, 10 sacks of of animal feed, and various goods

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 31 años, es un padre de familia muy dedicado a los suyos, vive en una casa alquilada con su esposa e hijo. En la búsqueda de oportunidades  logró conseguir un trabajo como peón en  una fabrica de ladrillos. Su empeño y dedicación le permitieron  producir  ladrillos de buena calidad y en la actualidad él ha hecho su propia fábrica. Vende lo que produce, es un comerciante intermediario de ladrillos que puede dar fe de la calidad de los ladrillos a sus clientes. Poco a poco esta capitalizando e incrementando sus ganancias que en la actualidad puede adquirir de primera mano  varios millares de ladrillos para vender,, generándole buenos ingresos. Por el momento continúa trabajando de manera dependiente pero se ha propuesto tener su propia fábrica de ladrillos. Es la novena ocasión en que tiene un crédito con MFP, se siente muy complacido de ser parte de su banco comunal de las que tiene buenas enseñanzas que le enseñan en su vida diaria. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá para abastecerse de más ladrillos como parte del crecimiento de su capital.
texts.en:
Jesús is 31 years old and a dedicated father to his family. He lives in a rented house with his wife and child. Looking for opportunities, Jesús was able to secure a job working at a brick factory. His commitment and dedication enabled him to produce bricks of good quality and now he has his own brick business. He sells what he produces, but he also acts as a middleman, which allows him to test the quality of bricks that he offers to his customers. Little by little, Jesús has been able to capitalize and increase his earnings to the point that he can acquire firsthand several thousands of bricks to sell so that he can generate good income. At the moment, he continues to work as an employee but has hopes of having his own brickyard.

This is the ninth time he has received a loan from MFP. Jesús is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank because it has provided him good lessons that he can use in his daily life. The money he is requesting will be invested in more bricks to add to his growing capital.

loans.use: to purchase bricks to sell.

loans.name: Mossane Madeleine

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants et son mari.Elle tient devant son domicile une petite table pour servir du "café Touba" à des clients le matin de bonne heure.Cette activité qu'elle pratique depuis deux ans lui permet d'avoir des revenus assez modestes pour améliorer l'alimentation de sa famille et supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.Face à l'augmentation constante de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un prêt de 150000F pour renforcer son stock en achetant pour améliorer le confort de ses clients. Les bénéfices tirés de cet investissement l'aideront à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, ses enfants en particulier. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un restaurant au marché central.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman who lives with her three children and her husband. She has a little table outside her home where she serves "Touba" coffee to customers early in the morning. She has been in this business for two years and it brings her in a modest income with which to improve her family's nutrition and pay school fees for her children. 

In view of her growing clientele, she is asking for a loan of 150,000 F to add to her stock and to her chairs and benches so that her customers will be more comfortable. The extra income from this investment will help her to improve living conditions for her family, especially for her children. Her ambition is to open a restaurant in the central market.

loans.use: to buy two containers of Touba coffee, three cases of sugar, and also add to her chairs and benches.

loans.name: Marve Luz

texts.es: Marve Luz es una mujer muy emprendedora que vive en el municipio de Baranoa con su esposo y sus dos hijas menores de edad, allí se  dedica a la  venta de Prendas de productos de murano y de plata, así como a la lencería; su principal M. lo constituyen los docentes  del municipio a quienes ofrece –financiamientos con pagos mensuales. Ella  pide una  cuotas inicial correspondiente al 20%,  tiene  5 años de experiencia e inició su alternativa mercantil con el fin de apoyar   la gestión de  hogar-, pues su esposo como trabajador independiente   tenía todo el gasto a su cargo;  también Marve Luz genera otros ingresos adicionales a través del Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar social en su programa  de “madrés comunitarias”  iniciativa de grupos de mujeres que a finales de la década de 1970, empezaron a atender a niños y niñas de barrios populares buscando compensar la ausencia obligada de los padres y las madres, que salían a trabajar  y que el Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar (ICBF) aprovechara   para organizar el programa   como estrategia para ampliar la atención a los menores de las familias más pobres, a bajo costo  y  en contraprestación reciben una “beca” en dinero, por su labor de cuidado, realizada en su propia casa. Marve Luz le gusta su trabajo y tiene 2 hijos con los que tiene grandes propósitos, ellos son su motor y está empeñada en hacer crecer su negocio con tal de lograr este reto. La  clientela  de Marve Luz ha crecido ampliamente con los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su credikiva  es el tercer financiamiento que hace a esta organización para comprar nuevas diseños de accesorios de plata que están muy de moda y tiene encargados. Marve Luz trabaja en su negocio conservando una rentabilidad no menor del 35% y una rotación de cartera  en un plazo no mayor de 60 días y así mismo recupera su inversión. Con su credikiva trabajará para que su capital de trabajo continúe creciendo porque es insuficiente para responderles a sus nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Marve Luz is an enterprising woman who lives in the town of Baranoa with her husband and their two young daughters.  There she has a business selling jewelry made of crystal and silver.  In addition, Marve sells lingerie.  Her primary customer base is composed of local teachers to whom she offers financing and monthly installment plans.  She asks for a down payment of 20%.  Marve has five years of experience and started this commercial venture as a way to help manage her household.  Her husband is self-employed and assumes responsibility for all of the expenses.  Marve earns additional income working for the Colombian Institute of Social Welfare in the “Community Mothers” Program that was started by groups of women in the 1970s.  This initiative was started in order to look after children living in crowded neighborhoods by seeking child support from their absent fathers and mothers who have left to find work.  The Colombian Institute of Family Welfare (ICBF) took advantage of this initiative and started its own program with the strategy of providing low-cost child care to the poorest families.  Caretakers who look after these children in their own homes receive grant money for their work.  

Marve Luz enjoys her job and has two young daughters who she dreams of seeing become successful professionals.  They serve as her motivation, so she is committed to growing her business in order to see her dream come true.  Her customer base has grown tremendously as a result of the loans she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This Kiva loan is her third instance of financing with the organization.  She will use the money to buy new designs of silver accessories that are in style and have been ordered.  In her business, Marve Luz is able to maintain a profitability rate of no less than 35% and an inventory turnover period of no more than 60 days so that she can recoup her investment.  Her Kiva loan will help her continue growing because her operating capital at the moment is insufficient in helping her respond to new customers.

loans.use: to purchase silver accessories in the latest designs.

loans.name: Yamina Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamina del Socorro tiene su negocio que es ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Tiene más de 11 años en su actividad. Lo inicio como medio de vida, sus hijos son personas mayores, pero uno de ellos se hace cargo de realizar los recorridos en el taxi por la ciudad. El financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, tapizados de asientos, reparación de ciertas cosas. Sabe que tiene una gran competencia pero siempre aconseja a su hijo a brindar el mejor servicio para que sus clientes siempre se encuentren satisfechos. Sueña con obtener otro vehículo para generar más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Yamina del Socorro has been managing a business that provides taxi services for more than 11 years. She started earning her livelihood in this manner since her children are grown. One of her children is responsible for driving the taxi around the city.

This loan will be used to buy tires, upholstery for the seats, as well as pay for a few repairs. Yamina knows that there is plenty of competition, so she advises her son to provide the best service to his customers so that they remain satisfied. Her dream is to obtain another vehicle for generating additional household income.

loans.use: to purchase tires, seat upholstery, and to pay for repairs.

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Amparo soltera comerciante, mujer trabajadora, su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda,  tiene su negoció venta de cosméticos  desde hace tiempo, inicio con ahorros propios, dificultades encontraras son el alza de los precios teniendo que subir el precio de sus productos y no tener la aceptación de los clientes.  Los planes son aumentar el inventario con variedades de mercadería e incrementar las ventas obteniendo mayores ganancias. 
Con el préstamo comprar de materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedrines, hierro,  bloques, piedras canteras, estribu, alambre de amarre, clavos entre otros materiales para la construcción de un cuarto en la parte trasera de su vivienda.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo  de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Amparo is single and works as a merchant. She is a hardworking woman who has plans to improve the infrastructure of her home. Amparo has been in the business of selling cosmetics for some time. She started out using her own savings, but she has encountered difficulties due to the rise in prices. As a result, she has had to increase the price of her products, which is not popular with her customers. Her plans include increasing her inventory with a variety of merchandise and generating more sales to earn better income.

With this loan, Amparo will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, iron, blocks, quarry stone, braces, wire, nails, and other materials for building a room at the back of her house. She is grateful for the support that will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée à un homme polygamme qui vit avec 4 épouses.Elle est en location dans une maison avec ses quatre enfants.Elle mène l'activité d'aviculture depuis un an pour subvenir à ses propres besoins,à ceux de ses enfants et pour appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des nombreuses charges familiales.Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000F à l'IMCEC pour l'achat de 200 poussins et l'aménagement de son poulailler. Les revenus obtenus de cette activité lui serviront à supporter les dépenses liées aux besoins de sa famille. Elle envisage dans le futur d'implanter une grande exploitation avicole dans sa parcelle située à la périphérie de la ville.
texts.en: This borrower is married to a polygamous man who has four wives.  She lives in a house with her four children.  She has been running a poultry business for a year to help meet her own needs, those of her children, and to help her husband meet the many family expenses.  She is requesting a loan of 250,000 F from IMCEC to buy 200 young chickens and to maintain her chicken-raising facility.  Her income earned from this work will help her to meet the expenses associated with her family’s needs.  For the future, she foresees establishing a large poultry enterprise on her plot located at the edge of town.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks and to establish her own chicken coop.

loans.name: Mamy Aissatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune fille célibataire , sans enfants, âgée de 25 ans.Apres une formation en informatique et en gestion, elle ouvre avec un ami, une boutique de vente de téléphone portables et d’accessoires informatiques.Elle fait aussi des prestations de service en bureautique.Cette activité qu'elle mine depuis sept mois constitue sa première expérience professionnelle.Elle a adhéré à l'IMCEC pour trouver les ressources nécessaires à l'acquisition des produits qu'elle vend.Elle sollicite ainsi un premier crédit de 100 000F destiné à l'achat de 10 téléphones portables dont la revente lui rapportera des revenus consistants afin de satisfaire ses propres besoins.Elle ambitionne d'ouvrir un centre commercial dans le domaine des nouvelles technologies de l'information et de la communication(bureautique,internet,accessoires...).
texts.en: The borrower is a single  woman, without children, 25 years of age. After completing her education in computer science and management, she opened together with a friend, a store selling cell phones and computer accessories. She also provides business services. This work, which she has been doing for seven months, is her first professional  experience. She has joined IMCEC in order to obtain the resources necessary for buying goods for resale. She is thus seeking her first loan of 100,000 West African francs intended for the purchase of 10 cellular phones, reselling which will bring her   steady income  and allow her to support herself. Her long-term goal is to open a business center for information technology and communication (business services, Internet, accessories…).

loans.use: to buy 10 cellular phones

loans.name: José Roque

texts.es:
En santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas en el cantón Santo Domingo encontramos a José, un hombre de 56 años quien se dedica al rencauche de zapatas de vehículos. José está separado de su esposa y vive con sus dos hijos. Su hija menor tiene quince años y está cursando la secundaria mientras que Jonathan un joven de 28 años con capacidades especiales no trabaja. José es el único que lleva el sustento al hogar, dice que no recibe ayuda económica de nadie. En su tiempo él comparte con sus dos hijos.

José nos cuenta que a pesar de que su jornada de trabajo es larga nada se le hace difícil porque le gusta lo que hace y por ello entrega a sus clientes un trabajo de calidad.

Hace muchos años José trabajaba como operario aprendiz, pero desde hace quince años se independizó y puso su propio taller de reparación. Hoy en día necesita renovar algunas de sus máquinas, lo cual facilitaría su trabajo y para ello contactó a Fernando quien es asesor de Fundación Alternativa para poder sacar un crédito y así mejorar su negocio.

El sueño de José es poder tener su casa propia, y en un futuro cercano su carro propio. Todo esto para ver a sus hijos gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
We find José in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas in the Santo Domingo canton.  He is 56 years old, and he repairs brake shoes.  José is separated from his wife, and he lives with his two children.  His youngest child is 15 years old, and she is in high school.  Jonathan, age 28, has special needs and does not work.  José is the only one who supports his household.  He says that he does not receive financial support from anyone.  He shares his time with his two children.

José tells us that in spite of his long work day, nothing is difficult for him because he likes what he does.  Therefore, he delivers quality work to his customers.

A long time ago José worked as an apprentice operator.  However, he became independent 15 years ago, and he established his own repair shop.

He now needs to refurbish some of his machines.  This will facilitate his work.  In order to do so he contacted Fundación Alternativa’s adviser to be able to get a loan and improve his business.

Jose’s dream is to be able to have his own house.  He also dreams of having his own car in the near future.  All of this is to see his children enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his business.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: En el hogar las mujeres parecieran tener una dotación especial D. fortaleza que las hace invencibles.  Pueden dedicar cualquier cantidad D. horas a trabajar incansablemente hasta alcanzar sus objetivos. Así es la señora Carmen Rosa ella tiene 52  años y está casada hace 30 años. Ella pertenece al grupo  María  Elena Moyano y está conformada por  nueve integrantes, tiene con el grupo 3 años. Es mamá D. cuatro hijos y su familia fue la mayor motivación para trabajar desD. la casa. La  satisfacción que le ha dejado el ser negociante es ver que sus hijos crecieron sanos y que ha logrado sacarlos adelante, y también gracias a la ayuda D. su esposo que día a día ayuda con la venta D. la comida y mazamorras. La señora Carmen aseguró que ahora va a iniciar su segunda etapa, lo que significa que podrá invertir sin ningún problema, con la implementación D. vitrinas en el negocio.
texts.en: In their homes the women would appear to have a special gift of strength that makes them invincible.  They can dedicate any amount of time to tirelessly work until they meet their objectives.  This is how Mrs Carmen Rosa is.  She is 52 years old and has been married for 30 years.  She belongs to the group María  Elena Moyano which is maD. up of nine members.  She has been in the group for 3 years.  She is mother to four children and her family was the main reason for her deciding to work from home.  The satisfaction that she has gotten from being a business person was from seeing her children grow well, getting them ahead.  Also she is thankful to her husband who helps her daily with the sale of the food and maize mush.  Mrs Carmen is now going to start her second phase with the implementation of display windows in the business, which means that she will be able to invest without a problem.

loans.use: to purchase display windows and supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita y su esposo el señor Juan tienen tres hijos que están estudiando.
Solicitan un préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la inscripción de la escuela donde estudiaran sus hijos y no quieren que se queden que pierdan esta años sin ir a la escuela por falta del pago. 
Doña Margarita planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en limpieza en una casa. Ya que Don Juan se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo de su trabajo. 
Desean que sus tres hijos tengan el estudio necesario para que puedan tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita and her husband Sr. Juan have three children in school. They are requesting a loan because they do not have the necessary funds to pay the tuition to the school that their children attend. Margarita and her husband do not want them to fall behind in school because of the inability to pay.

Doña Margarita plans to repay the loan using the salary she earns from her work as a house cleaner. Don Juan will take care of the family expenses using the income from his job. They want their three children to have the necessary education so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition.

loans.name: Nancy Cecilia

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 57 años madre de cuatro hijos de 27, 23, 22 y 19 años y vive con sus padres de 80 años de edad. Tiene un pequeño local de venta de jugos, tostadas, cerveza y recargas para teléfonos celular en la parroquia "Luz de América" de Santo Domingo. Esta mujer ha atravesado varias dificultades que han marcado su vida: la muerte de su esposo y la enfermedad de su padre. 

Nancy para sustentar su hogar y ayudar a sus padres hace dos años empezó su negocio propio con su hija. Lo más difícil es la larga jornada que diariamente tiene que es de 15 horas. Ella quiere comprar más productos para vender en su local y así obtener más ingresos, por esta razón solicitó un préstamo el cual ayudará para mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Su gran sueño es ver profesionales a todos sus hijos y por supuesto ver a sus padres en mejores condiciones de vida; sabe que para lograrlo debe hacer un gran esfuerzo y luchar hasta alcanzar su meta.
texts.en:
Nancy is 57 years old.  She has four children; ages 27, 23, 22, and 19.  She lives with her 80 year old parents.  She has a small place where she sells juice, 'tostadas' (fried tortillas), beer, and rechargeable calling cards.  She sells in the Luz de América parish in Santo Domingo.  This woman has gone through various difficulties that have marked her life, her husband’s death and her father’s illness.

In order to support her household and to help her parents, two years ago she started her own business with her daughter.  The most difficult part is the long work day, which is 15 hours every day.

She wants to buy more products to sell at her place.  That way she will get more income.  That is why she requested the loan, which will help her improve her income and her quality of life.

Her big dream is to see all of her children become professionals.  Of course, she wants to see her parents with better living conditions.  In order to do so she needs to make a great effort and struggle until she reaches her goal.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: La Buena Union 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Evangelista is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 1-2” (The Good Union). The members are micro entrepreneurs who sell clothing, assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts and bread.  Some members also have businesses such as a beauty salon or grocery store. The businesses are located mainly in the city of El Seybo, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Evangelista makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their 4 children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is being sick most of the time due to a chronic illness. Her favorite thing to do is to be at her home. Evangelista has sold bread for about 5 years.  She makes different kinds of bread by herself and sells it. She started the business with her first loan from Esperanza. Evangelista became a Esperanza Internacional client because she wanted to work and go forward with her business.

Evangelista is very excited about receiving her tenth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous two loans satisfactorily and taking an important step toward her business’s growth. She will use this new loan to buy fresh ingredients to make the bread, such as flour, butter, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other goods.  She will use the profits to save for her family’s future, because she wants to build her house in a concrete block structure. She thanks all of you for your support. 

In this loan, we are adding two pictures to complete a picture with 10 members since it was impossible to get a photo that captured everyone.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Eugenio Leonel

texts.es:
Eugenio Leonel, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive solo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Eugenio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse una finca. 

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Eugenio Leonel is 21 years old, single, and lives alone in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "Jesus Nos Ama" (Jesus Loves Us) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Los Amarillos, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Eugenio is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys his supplies at Briones Agrochemicals and then sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan for growing corn. He will buy composts and supplies for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies and improve in his farming activities. The challenges he faces include diseases that could impact his crops, such as “red stripe” (a strain of virus that attacks corn). His dream is to buy a farm.

Eugenio enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase compost and farming supplies.

loans.name: Betel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BETEL” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Sonia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de deportivos, medicina natural, pollerera, venta de humintas, costura, carnicería.

La señora Sonia,  indica que este es el segundo ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de un banco. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sal que viene trabajando desde hace treinta años, el que aprendió de sus papás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de sal), que comprara de los salares de Pacajes y posteriormente lo distribuirá a las fábricas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la verificación en el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Betel" will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the Santiago II central office.  This group is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors headed by Sonia.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses including selling: vegetables, sports shoes, natural medicines, traditional clothing, and baked tamales.  The membership also includes a dressmaker and a butcher.

Sonia says that this is her second loan cycle working with Pro Mujer.  She joined because of a recommendation from a bank. She has had a business selling salt for 30 years, a trade she learned from her parents.

The loan that she will take now will be used to increase her capital (purchase salt.)  She will buy the salt from the salt flats of Pacajes, and later she will distribute the salt to the factories.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can, because she is married and has 3 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the check-ups in the health clinic.

loans.use: to purchase salt

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Geraldine es socia D. L. Alcancía Comunal “CORAZÓN D. JESÚS” que  está integrada por 10 personas responsables.
Geraldine resiD.  hace muchos años en un centro poblado D. Matucana  junto a su pequeño hijo, elL. se dedica al servicio doméstico, en L. cual  lleva alrededor D. 5 años dedicándose a dicha labor, pero también nos cuenta que hace 2 meses empezó ayudar a una amiga con L. venD. D. desayunos cerca a  un paradero D. su localidad, lo cual obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar, Geraldine tiene una gran responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera y a tenido  que sacar adelante soL. a su pequeño. A futuro a Geraldine le gustaría instalar un restaurante donD. brinD. variedades tipos D. comida y así generar más ingresos para que pueda mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su hijo. Con el préstamo solicitado va a compra insumos para L. venta D. desayuno como pan, maca, quinua, avena y ropa para su niño. L. Alcancía Comunal “CORAZON D. JESÚS” están comprometidos a seguir trabajando bien y agradecen por el préstamo. Los socios Vilma y Bryan no pudieron estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en: Geraldine is a member of the communal bank "Corazon D. Jesus," which is maD. up of 10 responsible people. Geraldine has lived for many years in the community of Matucana with her small child.  She has been working as a domestic for about 5 years, but also she tells us that 2 months ago she started to help a friend selling breakfasts near a bus stop in her area to obtain more income for her household.  Geraldine has a great responsibility, since she is a single mother who has had to proviD. for her little one on her own.  In the future, Geraldine would like to start up a restaurant where she would proviD. a variety of types of food, and in this way generate more income so that she could improve the quality of life for her child.  With the loan requested, she will buy supplies for her business selling breakfasts, such as: bread, maca (an Andean root vegetable), quinoa, oats, and clothing for her child.  The communal bank "Corazon D. Jesus" is committed to continuing their good work, and they are grateful for this loan.  The members Vilma and Bryan were not able to be present in the picture because they had to work.

loans.use: to buy bread, maca root and quinoa

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar hombre trabajador tiene a sus hijos estudiando en la primaria, que sean profesionales son las metas de alcanzar. Su  profesión es albañil y trabaja por cuentas propias desde hace tiempo, también tiene un pequeño negocio de alquiler de video juegos que le genera un ingreso mas.  Como proyecto es el mejoramiento poco a poco de la infraestructura de su casa. Para dejarle a sus hijos tenga comodidad y seguridad. 
Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, bloques, piedras canteras, estribu, tablones de madera, hierro, alambre de amarre entre otros materiales de construcción. ofreciéndole a sus hijos proteccion ante tantos disturbios que existen.
texts.en:
Cesar is a hardworking gentleman. His children attend elementary school and want to achieve their goal of becoming professionals. Cesar is a mason by trade and has been self-employed for some time. He also has a small business renting out video games as a source of extra income. His plans include gradually improving the infrastructure of his house so that he can provide his children comfort and security.

With this loan, Cesar will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, quarry stone, braces, wooden planks, iron, wire, and other items. This will provide protection for his children since there are disturbances that occur in the area.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a security wall around his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, pasta, rice, sugar, eggs, little sandwiches and bread, for her business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 61 años de edad, vive en compañía de su esposo y dos hijos, la granja de cerdos la tiene desde hace 10 años, aprendió el oficio con sus padres, hoy en día atiende las labores todo el día.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y concentrado, este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar el número de cerdos, crecer con la granja y tener alimentación suficiente para la clientela.
Los sueños de María son seguir trabajando con préstamos que le permitan crecer y aumentar su potencial, realizando buenas ventas y generando ganancias.
texts.en:
María raises pigs.  She is 61 years old and lives with her husband and two children.  She has owned her pig farm for 10 years and learned the business from her parents.  She currently does her work all day long.  She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and concentrate.  This loan will help her to increase her number of pigs, grow her farm and have enough feed for her customers.

María's dreams are to continue working with loans that allow her to grow and increase her potential, making good sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos de 20, 19, 17 y 12 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, inicio junto a su esposo desde hace 10 años, inicia desde muy temprano hasta las 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimentación (concentrado), este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar la granja y tener la alimentación deseada para un tiempo.
Espera tener un buen resultado para comercializar los cerdos, proveer para su familia lo necesario en alimentación, salud y educación y sobre todo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Antonia lives with her husband and four children aged 20, 19, 17 and 12.  She raises pigs, a business she started together with her husband ten years ago.  She starts very early in the morning and works until 4.00pm.

Antonia is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed (concentrate).  This loan will help her to expand her farm and have the feed she needs on hand.

Antonia hopes to achieve a good result so that she can sell her pigs and provide her family with everything they need as regards food, health and education, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed (concentrate)

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group Prosperidad y Esperanza 1 & 3, (prosperity and hope). She lives in a simple structure with her three children. Rosa is a single mother, dedicated to working hard and providing for her family. She said her most difficult challenge is to help her children to go forward with a good education and a safe living.

Rosa is excited about her 4th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for approximately seven years, starting with her own resources. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by increasing her inventory of beauty products, cosmetics, a blow dryer and other equipment. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business. She will use the profits to save, because she wants to make her dream come true:  To have a store and a bigger beauty salon and spa.

Rosa's group is located in Santiago, an area known for tobacco and beef production. Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic.  The group members are dedicated to selling cloth, food, shoes and jewelry. Rosa thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, a blow dryer and other equipment

loans.name: Winay Jakaña Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WINAY JAKAÑA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Doris. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercialización, producción y servicios.

La señora Doris,  indica que hace cinco años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las señoras de anterior grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de jugos y masitas que viene trabajando en una casa.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fruta y masitas), que comprara del Tejar y los venderá en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud y todas las capacitaciones de negocio.
texts.en:
The “WINAY JAKAÑA” community bank are starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The group has eight members and is led by a board of directors which is headed by Doris.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include sales, production and services.

Doris says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for five years.  She joined through an invitation from some ladies who belonged to a previous group.  She currently has a business selling juice and pastries.

Doris is taking out this loan to increase her capital (buying fruit and pastries).  She will buy her products in El Tejar and sell them in her store.  This work allows her to make the income she needs to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the health services and all the business training.

loans.use: to buy fruit and pastries

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 63 años, vive actualmente en su casa propia al lado de su hermano. Toda su vida se ha esforzado para tener una estabilidad económica que le permita el bienestar de los suyos, nunca se ha casado y en la actualidad vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Tiene un negocio desde hace 20 años, que es una bodega, en la que ella misma se encarga de atender. Para ella es muy importante contar con dinero para volver a invertir en su negocio, siempre procura que este abastecido de variados productos, así engancha a sus clientes. Asimismo nos menciona que le gusta este trabajo, por que puede disponer de su horario y eso le da ventaja de no descuidar su casa. En adelante desea tener una tienda con mayor variedad en mercadería. Es su segunda vez que esta trabajando con MFP,  se enteró de esta financiera por medio de un volante que le hicieron llegar a lo cual ella misma ha solicitado información y tomó la decisión de solicitar un  préstamo para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar más productos y abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is 63 years old and currently lives in her own home with her brother. All of her life she has strived to achieve financial stability so that she can provide for her own welfare. Margarita never married and currently lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She has a store that she manages and has been in business for 20 years. Margarita believes it is very important to have money to reinvest in her business because she is always restocking her inventory with various products, which helps to draw in customers. She also says that she enjoys this form of work because she can set her own schedule and not neglect her household chores. In the future, Margarita hopes that her store will have a wider variety of merchandise.

This is the second time she has worked with MFP. Margarita learned about the organization through a promotional flyer that she received, so she requested information and made the decision to request a loan in order to improve the condition of her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of more products so that she can restock her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise so that she can restock her store.

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es:
Hilda, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización D. cerdos, es madre soltera y vive con 5 hijos D. las edades D. 17, 15, 14, 10 y 8 años, ella es la responsable D. mantener a sus hijos, pues todos están jóvenes y aun no se defienden, ella inicio la granja D. cerdos como un negocio para poder tener ingresos, sus padres le enseñaron y la motivaron para que se decidiera.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. cerdos y concentrado, con este préstamo aumentara el numero D. cerdos en la granja y tendrá mejores condiciones para comercializar en el tiangue.
Sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan superarse, a través D. su esfuerzo y dedicación, para que ellos se sientan apoyados.
texts.en:
Hilda raises and sells pigs.  She is a single mother and lives with her five children aged 17, 15, 14, 10 and 8.  She is responsible for supporting her children as they are young and still not able to look after themselves.  She started her pig farm business so that she could make income.  Her parents taught her the business and motivated her to start working in it.

Hilda is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs and concentrate.  She will use this loan to increase the number of pigs on her farm and have better conditions so that she can sell her animals in the local street market.

Hilda's dream is for her children to do well in life, through her effort and commitment, so that they feel supported.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate

loans.name: Moises Tony

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés vive en la localidad de la guardia,  barrio lindo, es nacido en el departamento de Tarija, quedo viudo hace unos dos meses, este es un golpe muy fuerte para el Sr ya que ahora es el único sustento de la familia, su actividad principal es chofer propietario, perteneciente a la asociación de taxi, tiene tres hijos a su cargo que se encuentran en edad escolar y los cuales están también están trabajando, su hija mayor de 14 años es la que le ayuda en las labores del hogar, el destino del crédito es para terminar de construir una habitación y barda en su domicilio, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
Moisés lives in the town of La Guardia, in Lindo neighborhood.  He was born in Tarija department.

Moisés became a widow two months ago.  This was a very hard blow for him because he is now the only source of support for his family.  His main business activity is working as a driver in a car that he owns.  He belongs to a taxi association.

Moisés has three school-age children in his care who are also working.  His eldest daughter, who is 14, helps with the housework.

Moisés will use this loan to finish building a room and a perimeter wall around his home.  He feels grateful to the institution for the financial support they have provided.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Las Daliass Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Daliass" se ubica en el estado de Puebla, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes la señora Belen es integrante del grupo. Tiene 19 años estudio asta la secubndaria y es soltera. Su negocio es una tienda que inicio hace 1 año ya que debido a la falta economica dejo de estudiar, actualmente pretende retomar sus estudios con ayuda de su negocio que poco a poco va creciendo y cada vez tiene mayor numero de clientes. Sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre encuentran todo lo que necesitan y a buen precio. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente entusiasmada ya que surtirá nuevamente su tienda, quiere este prestamo para comprar enlatados, articulos de limpieza y refrescos ya que es lo que más le solicitan. Tambien espera tener mas clientes y mejorar sus ganancias para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This group is called "Las Daliass".  It is located in the state of Puebla in Mexico.  The group is composed of 9 members. Belen is a member of the group.  She is 19, has a secondary school education, and is single. Her business is a shop that she started a year ago, since she had to give up school due to lack of money.  Now she is trying to take up her studies again with the help of her business that is growing little by little and has more customers all the time.  Her customers prefer her because they always find everything they need at a good price.  At the time she requested this loan, she felt enthusiastic because she will be able to restock her shop.  She wants this loan to buy canned goods, cleaning items, and soft drinks, since those are what people ask her for the most.  She also hopes to have more customers and improve her earnings in order to provide herself and her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, cleaning items, and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of office phone equipment.

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Norma vive por el sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, es la tercera ciudad de más importante del país, su gente es muy cálida y amable.
 
Doña Norma tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad que  estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero, ha migrado en busca de trabajo para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora Norma es artesana, trabaja en la  elaboración de juegos artificiales, esta actividad lo realiza hace 15 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como carrizos, papel periódico, cartón, pega, piola, etc.  para continuar con su trabajo.
 
Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma lives in the sector of Yanuncay in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its cold climate as well as its natural, architectural, and cultural beauty. It is the third largest city in Ecuador. The people are warm and friendly.

Doña Norma is 36 years old, married, and has two children (ages 16 and 14) who attend high school in the city. Her husband is abroad because he had to look for work in order to provide a better future for their family. Norma owns the home that she lives in.

She is an artisan who makes fireworks. Norma has been in this business for 15 years and works Sunday through Sunday without a fixed schedule.

She is receiving her third loan as a member of the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of materials such as reeds, newspaper, cardboard, glue, cords, and other items so that she can continue her work. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase reeds, newspaper, cardboard, glue, cords, and other items for making fireworks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread to use in her vertical weaving of bags, hammocks and backpacks.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora María vive por el sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, es la tercera ciudad de más importante del país, su gente es muy cálida y amable.
 
La Señora María tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 24, 22 y 19 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una universidad de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo este año ingresa a la universidad. Su esposo le ayuda en la atención de su tienda, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 26 años, trabaja en ella de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, detergentes, huevos, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir más su tienda.

Su meta es agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Señora María lives in the Yanuncay neighborhood of the city of Cuenca. The city has a cold climate and great natural, architectural and cultural beauty. It is the third most important city in the country and its people are warm and friendly. 

Señora María is 50 years old, married and with her husband  has three children who are 24, 22 and 19 years old. Her two eldest children are studying at the city’s university and her youngest child will enter the university this year.  Her husband helps tend to her store and the house where they live is their own.
 
Señora María has had her grocery store for 26 years. She works there Sunday to Sunday from seven in the morning until ten in the evening.

She is in her fourth loan through a communal bank. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, eggs, cold cuts and other basic needs items to better supply her store.

Her goal is to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, eggs, cold cuts and other basic needs items.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa de treinta y ocho años de edad vive en casa propia con sus siete hijos. Ella posee un puesto de verduras en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de la localidad donde reside, vende todo tipo de verduras y la gente la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan a un buen precio y con excelente servicio. Nicolasa es una mujer emprendedora y llena de energía en el trabajo para ella la clave de su futuro está escondida en su vida diaria y está dispuesta a encontrarla es por eso que le solicita a integral un crédito que le permita comprar verduras para surtir el puesto como ayote, pipianes, ejotes, limones, hiervas, yuca entre otros, así lograra mantener a flote su negocio y lo verá crecer día con día. Nicolasa tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her seven children.  She owns a vegetable stall in the market in her town where she sells all types of vegetables.  People prefer to buy from her because she always has what they need at a good price and she provides excellent service.  Nicolasa is an entrepreneurial woman who is full of energy for her work.

For Nicolasa, the key to her future is hidden in her daily life and she is ready to find it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow her to buy vegetables with which to stock her stall such as squash, pipian (a type of squash), green beans, lemons, herbs, cassava, etc.  In this way, she will keep her business afloat and she will watch it grow day by day.  Nicolasa is confident that, in this way, she will be able to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy squash, pipian, green beans, lemons, herbs and cassava

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de sesenta y dos años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos. El posee una panadería con que saca adelante a su hogar, él elabora pan dulce y simple de excelente calidad, como semita, pasteles de piña, margaritas, pan frances; es muy visitado por las personas del lugar pues su pan tiene un  sabor exquisito y lo vende a muy buen precio. 

El junto a su esposa se levantan desde muy temprano a elaborar el pan y Roberto lo vende por las mañanas y tardes de forma ambulante; Es un hombre trabajador lleno de metas por alcanzar. Él piensa que mientras menos mire para atrás, mas fácil se le hará mirar para adelante y lograr sus  sueños es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, sal, levadura, bandejas entre otros  para aumentar la producción y que crezca el negocio. Roberto tiene fe que su duro esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Roberto is 62 years old living with his wife and children.  He has a bakery that he uses to support his home.  He bakes sweet and plain bread of excellent quality like ‘semitas’ (a tart of bread dough filled with jam or other rich fillings), pineapple cake, ‘margaritas’ (a type of sweet bread), French bread.  He is visited by many of the local residents because his bread is delicious and he sells it at a very good price.

Together with his wife he rises very early to make the bread and Roberto sells it during the morning and afternoons in an ambulatory manner.  He is a hard-working man who is full of goals to reach.  He thinks that the less one looks back the easier it is to look forward and make your dreams a reality.  This is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and trays, among others, to increase production so that the business will grow.  Roberto trusts that his hard work will make it possible for him to provide his family with economic stability.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, yeast and trays.

loans.name: Janco Pampita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JANCO PAMPITA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lorenza. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chuño, producción de chuño, mecánico, venta de papa, albañil, venta de fruta 

La señora Lorenza,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratado), que viene trabajando desde hace diez años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de chuño y papa) que adquirirá de las comerciantes de Achacachi y lo comercializará de la feria de la Ceja los días jueves y sábado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos.  

En la fotografía nos acompaña la señora Justina, que hizo reverción por problemas familiares, ella esta de manta cafe y sombrero negro.
texts.en:
The “JANCO PAMPITA” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi regional center. It is composed of eight members and is governed by a board, which is headed by Lorenza. The businesses pursued by the communal bank's members are diverse, including sales of chuño [dehydrated potatoes], chuño production, mechanic services, potato sales, mason services, and fruit sales. 

Lorenza reports that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution on the invitation of the promoter. Currently, she has a business in which she sells potatoes and chuño. She has operated this business for ten years, having learned the profession from her mother. 

The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her capital (buying chuño and potatoes). She will buy the products from dealers in Achacachi and sell them at La Ceja market on Thursdays and Saturdays. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has two children. 

In the photograph, the group is also accompanied by Justina, who withdrew because of family problems; she is wearing a brown blanket and black hat.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and chuño [dehydrated potatoes]

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa, de 53 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus tres hijos en las edades de 24 a 31 años, allí se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, negocio con el que comenzó vendiendo artículos para el hogar entre sus vecinos y amigos del sector, gradualmente en la medida en que fue  creciendo su clientela, así mismo fue agregándole otros artículos, como ropa, prendas de oro, y platería. El incremento de su clientela ha sido positivo para el mejoramiento de sus ingresos, pero no es suficiente el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta,  para responder oportunamente las solicitudes que estos le hacen. Su meta más adelante en convertir su negocio en un almacén, donde cada habitante de la población, pueda encontrar la mercancía que busca. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, con el cual comprará productos para el hogar, ropa interior suéteres y ropa exterior, manejada sobre los pedidos de sus clientes así que muy pronto rotarán sus inventarios.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 53 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her three children, who are between the ages of 24 and 31. This is where she sells a variety of merchandise. She started her business selling items for the home to her neighbors and friends in the area. Gradually, as she grew her customer base, she also added other items such as clothing and gold and silver pieces.

The growth of her clientele has helped to increase her earnings, but the working capital she has is not sufficient to respond opportunely to the requests her customers make. Her future goal is to convert her business into a store where everyone can find the merchandise they are looking for. This is why she went to Fundación Santo Domingo to apply for a "credikiva." This is the first financing she has had through the organization. She will use it to buy products for the home, undergarments, sweaters, and outerwear, according to the requests of her customers, so that she can quickly turn her inventory over.

loans.use: to buy home products, sweaters, and outerwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es: Mirna Guadalupe D. treinta y nueve años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una venta D. antojitos como enchiladas, empanadas, tamales, pastelitos, entre otros su venta tiene mucha demanda pues sus antojitos tienen un sabor exquisito y los venD. a un precio accesible, además, Mirna le da a sus clientes el mejor servicio siempre está a la disposición D. lo que necesiten; es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas D. salir adelante por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima por mayor como maíz, aceite, huevos, verduras, y gas propano.  Mirna Guadalupe tiene la esperanza D. que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Mirna Guadalupe is 39 years old living with her life companion and their children.  She sells fast food snacks like enchiladas, turnovers, tamales, cakes, among others.  Her snacks are delicious and she sells them for affordable prices so they are in very high demand.
