Mirna gives her customers the best possible service always and is always willing to proviD. what they wish.  She is an enterprising woman with a strong will to get ahead.  This is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy raw materials like corn, oil, eggs, vegetables and propane gas.  Mirna Guadalupe hopes that her efforts will lead to a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, eggs, vegetables and propane gas.

loans.name: Cecilia Ruth

texts.es: Cecilia Ruth de de treinta y dos años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un bazar y otros en un mercado cerca de la localidad donde reside, es muy reconocida en el lugar pues en su bazar las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan además tiene muy buenas referencias es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy amable siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro; Cecilia Ruth tiene muchas metas y quiere cumplirlos por eso trabaja con mucha dedicación el éxito y la felicidad es su mayor meta es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar artículos para surtir el bazar como shampo, ganchos, tazas, vasos, tintes entre otros así podrá mantener el negocio y lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Cecilia Ruth, thirty-two years old, lives with her partner and her children.  She has a stall in a market near the town where she lives.  She is very well-known locally because in her stall people always find what they want.  She also has good references as a hard-working, honest, and very nice woman.  She always greets her customers with a smile on her face.  Cecilia Ruth has many goals, and she wants to achieve them.  That is why she works with such dedication.  Success and happiness are her biggest goals, so she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy items to stock the stall such as shampoo, hairpins, cups, glasses, and dyes, among others.  In this way she will be able to maintain her business and will succeed in giving her family a full life.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hairpins, cups, glasses, dyes

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive con su esposa y una hija de 6 años de edad, vive con sus padres en vivienda familiar, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz, tiene 15 años de realizarlo y fue su padre quien le enseño el proceso, su horario es de 4:00am a 11:00am, todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y herbecidas para aplicarlos al cultivo, su objetivo es mejorar la producción del cultivo, teniendo una buena cosecha, su riesgo el clima, que puede afectar el exceso de lluvia.
Su aspiración es mejorar los cultivos, comercializar la producción y darle una vida digna y confortable a su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and a 6-year-old daughter.  He lives with his parents in the family house.  He grows corn, and has been doing this for 15 years.  His father taught him the process.  His schedule is from 4:00am until 11:00am every day of the week.

Currently he is asking for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and herbicides to apply to his crops.  His goal is to improve the crop yield and have a good harvest.  His main risk is the climate, since an excess of rain can affect the crops.

His aspiration is to improve his crops, to sell what he harvests, and to give his family a dignified and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides.

loans.name: Bruno De Jesus

texts.es: Bruno de Jesús de sesenta años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en zona rural del país. El posee una venta de leña y es muy reconocido en la zona por su constante actividad comercial, tiene mucha clientela pues vende leña de muy buena calidad y de todo tipo a un excelente precio; ofrece el mejor servicio del lugar siempre recibe a los clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro. Bruno de Jesús es muy carísmatico, lleno de sueños por cumplir, por eso su esfuerzo es constante y duradero. Ahora le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar mayor cantidad de leña y de diferentes tipos. Bruno de Jesús tiene la confianza de que con su trabajo le podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y llevara seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en: Bruno de Jesús, sixty years old, lives with his partner and his son in a rural area of the country.  He sells firewood and is very well-known in the area for his constant business activity.  He has many customers, since he sells very good quality wood of all kinds at an excellent price, and he offers the best service in the area.  He always greets his customers with a smile on his face.  Bruno de Jesús is very charismatic, full of dreams to achieve, so his effort is steady and lasting.  Now he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to purchase a larger quantity of firewood of different kinds.  Bruno de Jesús has confidence that with his work he will be able to give his family a better quality of life, and he will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to purchase firewood of all kinds

loans.name: Ana Cruz

texts.es: Ana Cruz de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda y panadería, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues ella vende un pan exquisito y su tienda siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita, el servicio que Ana ofrece es excelente y los precios son buenos. Ana siempre está adelante de la competencia,  le gusta mantenerse activa en su trabajo, el secreto de su éxito es aumentar cada día mas su entusiasmó y perseverancia es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, embutidos, productos instantáneos, harina, azúcar, levadura entre otros de esta forma vera crecer su negocio y lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Cruz is 58 years old and lives with her life partner in their own house. She has a store and a bakery. Lately she has had a large clientele as she sells delicious bread and her store always has whatever people need. The service Ana offers is excellent and her prices are good.

Ana is always ahead of the competition. She like to keep busy at work. The secret to her success is to increase her enthusiasm and perseverance every day. That is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy staple grains, sweets, drinks, sausages, instant products, flour, sugar and yeast, among other things. In this way she will see her business grow and be able to give her family economic security.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sweets, drinks, sausages, instant products, flour, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: María Paula

texts.es: María Paula de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con sus tres hijas en una zona semiurbana del país. Ella posee una tortillería y una pequeña tienda en el lugar de su residencia, sus negocios son muy visitados por las personas de la localidad pues María siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan, su tienda la mantiene muy surtida y las tortillas son calientitas y con un sabor delicioso todo a precios son realmente accesibles; María esta lista siempre para el trabajo para ella no hay imposibles siempre se encuentran los medios adecuados para sobresalir es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, golosinas, granos básicos, productos instantáneos, bebidas, entre otros así podrá ver crecer su negocio y María Paula le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Paula, fifty-five years old, lives with her three daughters in a semi-urban area of the country.  She has a tortilla stand and a small store in her home.  Her businesses are visited often by local people, since María always has what they need.  She keeps her store very well-stocked and the tortillas are hot and delicious, all at a truly accessible price.  María is always ready for the work; for her, nothing is impossible, and she always finds suitable ways to succeed.  This is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to purchase wholesale corn, sweets, staple grains, instant products, drinks, and other items so that she will be able to grow her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn, sweets, staple grains, instant products, drinks

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. Four of her children are currently in school. Christine has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Christine hopes to expand her business. Christine is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Amigos Unidos (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Amigos Unidos se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace dos ciclos decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar el nivel de vida y ayudarse a financiar sus negocios, la mayoría de las personas que integran este banco se dedican a realizar trabajos de artesanía y comercio en general.
 
La señora Rosa es una de los doce miembros que integran este banco, tiene  34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido  es comerciante. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, él se dedica a la venta de gafas, sombreros y artesanías propias del cantón, vende sus productos por toda la ciudad y aprovecha cuando llegan turistas ya que ahí vende mucho. El en Guayaquil se abastecerse de sus productos y lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para  comprar gafas, sombreros y otras artesanías. 

Su sueño es que nunca les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amigos Unidos” or “United Friends” meets every fifteen days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial history and artisan crafts, which are recognized both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous straw panama hat.

This group of people decided to unite two loan cycles ago and formed the communal bank that has helped them a lot.  With the loans, they have been able to improve their status in life and finance their businesses.  Most people in the group make and sell artisan crafts. 

Rosa is one of the twelve members of the group.  She is 34 years old, and is married with two children, ages 14 and 9, who study in school.  Her husband works in retail.  This is her second loan with the communal bank and she likes the help the institution offers.

She is a very good housewife who takes care of the loans for her husband.  He sells glasses, hats, and artisan crafts from the neighborhood.  He sells products all around the city and makes the most of when tourists visit because then he sells a lot of products.  He gets his products from Guayaquil and has been selling for over fifteen years.  

This loan is to buy sunglasses, hats, and artisan crafts.  Rosa’s dream is that her children never lack anything.

loans.use: To buy glasses, hats, and artisan crafts.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela D. cincuenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y su hija en casa propia localizada en zona urbana del país. Ella tiene una venta D. nutrientes por variedad, que le ayuda a solventar las necesidades del hogar, estos últimos meses ha subido la demanda  del producto pues las personas se han convencido que es D. muy buena calidad, muy efectivo para su salud y a un buen precio, Blanca se levanta desD. muy temprano a ofrecer su producto y siempre obtiene buenos resultados y ahora quiere ver crecer el negocio, pues piensa que todo proyecto debe tener continuidad para obtener verdaderos resultados y es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar vitaminas, analgésicos, multivitamina, suplementos nutricionales entre otros, así volver sostenible su índice D. ventas y generar ingreso fijo y que es D. mucha utilidad para ella. Blanca Estela tiene la esperanza que su trabajo le permitirá ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela, 53, lives with her life partner and their daughter in their own home in an urban part of the country. She sells a variety of nutritional products, which helps her to pay for their basic needs at home. The last few months the demand for her products have gone up since people have been convinced that they are of good quality, very effective for health, and a good price. 

Blanca gets up very early to sell her products and has always gotten good results and now she wants her business to grow. She thinks that every project should have continuity to get true results and that's why she asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy vitamins, painkillers, multivitamins, nutritional supplements and other things. This will make her sales index sustainable and generate a fixed income which is very useful for her. 

Blanca Estela hopes that her work will allow her to offer her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, painkillers, multivitamins and supplements.

loans.name: Amuziya

texts.en:
Amuziya is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. All of her children are currently in school. Amuziya has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.         
	
To help expand her business, Amuziya has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Amuziya hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Amuziya hopes to expand her business. Amuziya is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children. Two of his children are currently in school. Frank has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar, which he has had for 3 years.         
	
To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Frank hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Frank hopes to expand his business. Frank is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Orfi Maria

texts.es: Orfi de 42 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella tiene una miscelánea,  donde vende variedades de productos, artículos de papelería, detalles para el hogar, el cual inició con mucho sacrificio y la oportunidad de un pequeño crédito. Gradualmente fue creciendo y hoy en su negocio tiene de todo un poco; sus principales clientes son su vecinos y los habitantes de barrios de su alrededor, ella vende principalmente de contado, aunque maneja algunos créditos. Como orfi es una mujer progresista, desea aumentar sus ingresos especializando cada vez más el surtido de mercancías, sobre todo las que rotan constantemente, para manejar un stock, que disminuya los costos del transporte y genere un ahorro por la compra de contado y en volumen. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará papelería, detalles y accesorios femeninos.    Su meta es continuar inyectándole capital a su negocio, porque es el origen de su sustento y ella está decidida a cuidar esta gran alternativa empresarial.
texts.en: Orfi is 42 years old and lives in Cartagena with her husband and three children.  She has a general store where she sells a variety of products, including stationary and home accents.  She was able to start the business with a lot of sacrifice and the opportunity from a small loan.  Gradually the business grew and now she sells a little of everything.  Her main customers are her neighbors and the people in the surrounding area.  Her sales are done mostly in cash, although she handles a credit accounts.  Since Orfi is a progressive woman, she wants to increase her income by specializing the assortment of goods, especially those that rotate constantly, to handle stock, lesson transportation costs, and generate savings to make purchases with cash in large volume.  For this reason she requests this Kiva loan, her first funding with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy stationary, home accents, and accessories.  Her goal is to continue injecting capital in her business because it is her primary source of income and she is determined to care for this great business venture.

loans.use: to buy stationary, home accents, and accessories.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is single and has 1 child. Her child is currently in school. Sarah has a business of a beauty salon, which she has had for over 10 years. She sells produce, like maize, as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her child. In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Pasión Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASIÓN” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Graciela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de gorro y chalinas, venta de mantas de vicuña y alpaca, producción de mantas, venta de comida, venta de sombreros, costura de deportivos, costura de enaguas.

La señora Graciela  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chicharrones en los pueblos que viene trabajando hace treinta años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de carne y maíz) que comprará de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos la comercializará en los pueblos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y credito.
texts.en:
The "Pasión" communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata Center.  It is composed of ten members and is directed by a board headed by Graciela.  The communal bank's members run a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: sales of caps and scarves, sales of vicuña and alpaca blankets, blanket production, food sales, hat sales, sewing athletic clothing, and sewing slips.

Graciela indicates that this is her first cycle with Pro Mujer, having been admitted by invitation.  Currently, she has a business selling chicharrones (pork rinds) in the towns.  She has been doing this work for twenty years, learning it from her mother.

The loan that she will now receive is for increasing her capital (the purchase of meat and corn), which she will buy in La Ceja, and afterwards for making her products, which she will sell in the towns.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as she can, since she is married and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the office and the loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn and meat

loans.name: Gilma Alicia

texts.es: Gilma Alicia de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en zona urbana del país y a poca distancia de la capital. Ella tiene como negocio un molino de nixtamal, el cual le es muy rentable y es usado para moler maiz, arroz, frijoles, chocolate, harinas ,entre otros; también posee una tortillería que le ayuda a terminar de solventar las necesidades del hogar; Se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues siempre ofrece el mejor servicio en su molino y vende las tortillas más ricas del lugar a precios accesibles, resulta muy agitado, pero dice ella compensa el haber encontrado como resolver el sustento diario para sus hijos. Gilma es una mujer emprendedora siempre está dispuesta a trabajar, piensa que el verdadero heroísmo consiste en persistir más de un momento y ella quiere persistir siempre es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, dado que actualmente al comprarlo al detalle resulta bastante alto de precio, además desea darle a mantenimiento al molino, cambiar fajas, comprar nuevos discos, mandar al torno algunas piezas que han sufrido desgaste por el uso, para que así pueda mantener el negocio. Gilma Alicia tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gilma Alicia is thirty years old and lives with her life partner and her children in an urban zone of the country, a short distance from the capital. Her business is a nixtamal [hominy] mill, which is giving her good profits. It is used to grind corn, rice, beans, chocolate, and various flours, among other substances. She also has a tortilla business which helps her to completely cover the needs of her household. She has built up a large customer base, since she always offers the best service in her mill, and she sells the most delicious tortillas in the area at affordable prices. All of this keeps her very busy, but she says that she is compensated by having found a way to provide daily sustenance for her children. Gilma is an enterprising woman who is always ready to work. She thinks that real heroism consists in persevering more than just a moment, and she wants to persevere always. For this reason, she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy corn on a wholesale basis, since she currently buys it retail, resulting in a price which is quite high. In addition, she would like to do some maintenance on her mill: changing the belts, buying new disks, and renewing some parts which have been worn down by use, so that she can maintain her business. Gilma Alicia is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and carry out maintenance on her mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheets, jeans, women's accessories, and a perfume line.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi, in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Sarah has a business of selling produce, like maize flour and beans, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize and beans for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family. In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving in her capital.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi, in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is single and has 1 child. Her children is not currently in school.  Jackline has a business of a bar, which she has had for 7 years.         

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beer and sodas for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jackline hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family. In the future, Jackline hopes to expand her business. Jackline is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Gulu region of Uganda.  He is single and has no children. John has a small retail shop that sells electrical items, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase electrical items for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself.  In the future, John hopes to open up the same business in another area. John is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase electrical items for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Marleny

texts.es: Blanca Marleny de treinta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo: para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños; es muy conocida en la localidad pues vende de forma ambulante ropa de muy buena calidad y novedosa siempre a la vanguardia de la competencia, además tiene muy buen servicio y precios realmente accesibles. Blanca siempre está llena de energía con ganas de salir adelante con sus sueños para ella al pensar en grande  sus hechos crecerán es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa como faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, blusas entre otros para dar continuidad a su negocio y ahora que esta en espera de otro miembro de su familia sus ganas de luchar para salir adelante han incrementado. Blanca Marleny se encuentra muy bien referenciada como sujeto de crédito, por eso tiene confianza que así lograra darle a su familia una vida plena con seguridad económica.
texts.en: Blanca Marleny, who is 35 years old, lives with her life partner and their two children in their own house. She has a business selling all types of clothing: for women, men, boys and girls. She is well known in her area since she sells as a walking vendor and her clothing is of good quality and in the latest fashion, always at the vanguard of the competition. Furthermore, she has very good service and prices that are actually accessible. Blance is always full of energy, with the will to advance with her dreams. For her, to think big means that her accomplishments will increase. For this reason, she decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan that will permit her to buy clothing such as skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses, among other items, to give continuity to her business, and now that she is expecting another member of her family, her will to strive to advance has grown. Blanca Marleny has very good references to be given credit, thus she has confidence that she will succeed in giving her family a life full of economic security.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Gulu region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Pauline has had a restaurant business for five years.         

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for cooking for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Pauline hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Pauline hopes to expand her business. Pauline is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food to cook and sell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 41 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Gulu region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Harriet has had a bar business for three years. She sells clothes as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soda and beer for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Harriet hopes to open up a garment shop.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to meet her target.

loans.use: to purchase soda and beer to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kijura, in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children. Five of his children are currently in school. John has a business of a bar, which he has had for 6 years.         

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soda and beer for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for his children. In the future, John hopes to expand his business. John is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping improve in his capital that has paid his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase soda and beers for resale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 30 years old and lives in the town of Masidi, in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. One of her child is currently in school. Annet has a business of a small retail shop that sells spare parts, which she has had for over 10 years. She sells herbal medicine as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family. In the future, Annet hopes to expand her business. Annet is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria Isabel de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive con su sobrina y sus nietos. Ella posee una tienda en la zona costera del país, donde vende productos de consumo diario como leche, huevos, pan, embutidos, sazonadores y otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues ella siempre tiene lo que sus clientes necesitan además les ofrece un buen servicio y excelentes precios; Gloria es muy dedicada a su trabajo siempre esta adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que si siembra un deseo, cosechara un destino es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harinas, golosinas, aceite de cocina, productos instantáneos entre otros así podrá seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su clientela. Gloria Isabel tiene la esperanza que así lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria Isabel, 59 years old, lives with her niece and her grandchildren. She has a store in the coastal region of the country where she sells daily necessities like milk, eggs, bread, sausages, seasonings and other things. Recently she has brought in a lot of customers because she always has what her customers need and she also offers them good service and excellent prices. 

Gloria is very dedicated to her work and is always a step ahead of the competition. She thinks that if she plants a wish, she will harvest a destiny. For that reason she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy flour, snacks, cooking oil and instant products, among other things. This way she will keep satisfying her customers' needs. 

Gloria Isabel is hopeful that this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cooking oil, and instant products.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, con el anterior compró mercancias y variedades, sabanas, toallas y electrodomésticos menores y aumentó ligeramente su capital. En esta oportunidad invertirá su nuevo credikiva en calzado y variedades en mayor cuantia, porque tiene un ahorro que agregará a su compra y por eso ganará descuentos que trasladaría a sus clientes para ofrecer una mejor oferta. Su mensaje a los financiadores D. kiva es el siguiente: "Es una labor vital la que hacen ustedes, ya que ayudan al desarrollo D. las familias a través D. sus créditos. Siempre Dios los bendiga." Si uste quiere conocer la historia D. Andrea ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/211186
texts.en:
Andrea is applying for her second Kiva loan.  With her previous loan she bought assorted goods, sheets, towels, and small domestic appliances.  Her capital increased slightly.

This time she will use her new Kiva loan for shoes and assorted goods in greater quantity.  She has some savings that she will add to the purchase.  That way she will get discounts that she will pass on to her customers to give them a better deal.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following, “The work you do is vital because you help families make progress with the loans.  May God always bless you.”

If you would like to know Andrea’s history, go to the following link:  http://kiva.org/lend/211186

loans.use: to buy shoes and assorted goods in greater quantity.

loans.name: Andrea Jacqueline

texts.es:
La Señorita. Andrea vive por el sector de Yanuncay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, es la tercera ciudad de más importante del país, su gente es muy cálida y amable.
 
La Señorita Andrea tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su mamá es ama de casa y su papá es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo un taxi, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.

Nuestra socia es estudiante de una universidad de la Ciudad, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de sus estudios.

Su meta es llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Andrea lives in the Yanuncay sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and great natural, architectural, and cultural beauty.  It is the third most important city in the country.  Its people are very warm and friendly.

Andrea is 19 years old and single.  She lives with her parents.  Her mother is a housewife, and her father is a professional driver.  He works driving a taxi.  The house where they live is their own.

Andrea is a student at the city university.  This is her second loan with her communal bank.  She will use the loan to pay for her education.  Her goal is to become a great professional.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Rositas 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS 25 DE JULIO” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Irene. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, tejido de gorras, venta de calzados, decorado de autos, venta de pollos, confección de chamarras, tejido macrame

La señora Irene,  indica que hace ocho años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados que viene trabajando hace veinte y tres años aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de hojas de cuero) que adquirirá de la C. Max Paredes y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en la feria 16 de julio los jueves y domingos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The lending group "Rosas 24 de Julio" will begin their 3rd cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center Los Andes. The group is made up of 9 members and is directed by a board headed by Irene. The businesses that the association members have are varied; among them we have: knitting sweaters, knitting hats, selling shoes, car decoration, selling chickens, making jackets, knitting macrame. 

Irene started at the invitation of a friend and has worked with Pro Mujer for 8 years. She has a business selling shoes where she has worked for 23 years, having learned the trade from her family.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital by purchasing sheets of leather on Max Paredes street which she will later make into shoes and sell in the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays. This work has allowed her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Elena Filadelfia De La Cuz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Elena es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos pero dos fallecieron, los 4 restantes  ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario y con esto ayudar a su esposo se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños, luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa los mismos que los trasladan hasta los centros de faenamiento o a los distintos mercados de la ciudad a comercializar la carne. Su esposo le ayuda cuando puede en la alimentación y cuidado de los animales.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento y medicinas  para pollos y chanchos.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y  tener salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish.  The canton is known as the birthplace of the old warrior, Eloy Alfaro.  It is also known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued within and outside of the country.

Elena is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because the interest is lower than in other lending institutions.

She is 61 years old and married.  She had six children, but two of them died.  The other four are grown and independent.  He husband is a farmer.

In order to earn a daily living and to help her husband, Elena raises pigs and chickens.  She buys these animals while they are still small.  She then keeps them for three or four months until they have gained enough weight.  She later sells them to commercial dealers who come to her home. The dealers take them to slaughterhouses or to the various markets of the city and sell the meat in those places.  Her husband helps her when he can with the feeding and care of the animals. 

She will use this loan to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs. 

Her dreams are to get ahead and to have good health for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Norbertina

texts.es:
Norbertina está muy feliz y no es para menos un nuevo semestre en el cual su hijo le va  abonado a su meta y esto es gracias a los tres financiamientos con Kiva. Este es su cuarto financiamiento y nuevamente pagara ahora su octavo semestre universitario. “Le doy gracias a Dios ya que gracias a ello mi hijo está saliendo adelante, y pronto se convertirá en un profesional que aportará a su familia y a la sociedad.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Norbertina ingrese a los siguientes enlaces:

 http://kiva.org/lend/169823

 http://kiva.org/lend/218365

http://kiva.org/lend/268017
texts.en:
Norbertina is very happy because she is able to pay for a new semester for her son and move him towards his goal, thanks to the three loans with Kiva.  This is her fourth loan and she will use it to pay the eighth university semester.
“I thank God since because of  Him, my son is getting ahead and he will soon be a professional and contribute to his family and society”. 

 If you want to learn about Norbertina’s past loans, check out the following links:
 http://kiva.org/lend/169823

 http://kiva.org/lend/218365

http://kiva.org/lend/268017

loans.use: To pay the eighth semester at the university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school supplies.

loans.name: Ayda Merilin

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Ayda, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 1 hijo de  2 años y un bebé de 10 meses. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganarse algo propio y poder comprar cosas necesarias para sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  la mayor parte de sus ventas las  hace a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja tres  días a la semana más que todo en las noches cuando su esposo llega del trabajo y puede quedarse con los niños, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada sábado. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Portoviejo  cada vez  que necesite. También cría pollos en su casa los mismos que entrega a comerciantes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde del inicio y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The “María Inmaculada” (Mary Immaculate) communal bank meets every two weeks in La Sequita Parish in Montecristi, a canton that’s known as the birthplace of the “Viejo Luchador,” Eloy Alfaro, and for the famous straw hats that are admired both inside the country and abroad.

Ayda, 23, lives here.  She’s married and has a one-year-old son and a 10-month-old baby.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

She is a very good housewife who, in order to earn income of her own and be able to buy needed things for her children, sells all types of clothes and costume jewelry door to door.  Most of her sales are based on prior orders from her customers.  She works three days a week, mostly in the evening after her husband gets home so he can stay home and take care of the children.  She sells on credit and collects payment each Saturday.  She goes to Portoviejo to buy merchandise each time she needs to.  She also raises chickens at home that she sells to merchants.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because it was thanks to her first loan that she was able to start her business.

Her dream is to have a house of her own because she currently lives at is her mother's.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mayra Janeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 1 hijo de 2 años y un bebé de seis meses. Su esposo es albañil. Está en el Banco Comunal desde del inicio y le gusta porque ha recibido gran apoyo del grupo y de la institución.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Ella dice que a pesar de que no es mucho el tiempo que tiene su negocio este ha crecido mucho ya que no había otra tienda por su casa. Trabaja desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda cuando está desocupado. Tiene cerca de año y medio con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad que necesita para aumentar su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Credit Group meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish, a canton known as the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro, legendary for his struggles, and for its famous palmetto straw hats, admired in Ecuador and in other countries.

Mayra lives here; she is 21 years old, married, and from that relationship has a 2-year-old son and a 6-month-old baby.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  She has been with the Communal Bank from its founding, and likes it because she has received good support from the group and the institution.

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all manner of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and other essential items.  She says that, despite the fact that she has had her business for only a short time, it has grown a lot, since there was no other store near her house.  She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m., and sometimes until later.  Her husband helps her when he is not working.  Her business has been in existence about a year and a half, and things are going well.

She will use this loan to better stock her store, and will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other essential items needed to expand her business.  She has been with the Communal Bank from the start for 5 cycles, and likes it because she has made more friends in the group.  Her goals are to go forward and for her store to grow with every passing day.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents, sausages, and other essential items.

loans.name: Cariñositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CARIÑOSITAS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Basilia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de deportivos, tienda, venta de toallas, confección de edredones, venta de videos, confección de chamarras.

La señora Basilia, indica que es el segundo ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de confección de deportivos que viene trabajando hace dos años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de la calle Max Paredes y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en la feria 16 de julio los jueves y domingos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre.
texts.en:
The lending club "CARIÑOSITAS” will begin their 4th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center Los Andes. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board headed by Basilia. The association members' businesses are varied and include: making sportswear, a store, selling towels, making quilts, selling videos, and making jackets.

Basilia says that she joined the group by invitation and is in her 2nd cycle with Pro Mujer. She has a store making and selling athletic jerseys where she has worked for 2 years.

The loan will be used to increase her capital through the purchase of fabric which she will get on Max Paredes street. Later she will make the clothes and sell them in the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays. This work has allowed her to generate income to support her family. She lives in a common-law marriage.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Herlinda Mariuxi

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Herlinda, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hermoso bebé de un mes de nacido. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende pollos por libras y en pie, dice nuestra amiga que ella compra estos animalitos a vecinos de la zona y los cría ya que así le queda más ganancias pero por la cantidad que vende se ve en la obligación de comprar también pollos pelados listos para la venta. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas aunque si algún cliente necesita algo ella sin ningún problema le vende a cualquier hora, lleva cinco años en su negocio y está muy contenta ya que se gana algo y no tiene que descuidar ni el hogar ni a su pequeño bebé, ya que su negocio está en casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pollos pelados listos para la venta y alimentos para los que esta criando ya que aun están pequeños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido comprando cosas necesarias en su negocio. 

Sus sueños son mantenerse en su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "María Inmaculada" ["Immaculate Mary"] communal bank meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, a canton known for being the birthplace of the famous revolutionary Eloy Alfaro and and for its famous palmetto straw hats, admired in Ecuador and abroad.

This is where you would find Ms. Herlinda. She is 21 years old and married, and has a beautiful one-month old baby from this relationship. Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

She has a small spot in her house from which she sells chickens by the pound, and she also sells them on foot. Our friend tells us that she sells to her neighbors and others in her area. She raises chickens herself because it is most profitable, but because of the quantity she sells, she is also obliged to purchase some plucked chickens that are ready for sale. She works every day in the mornings, although if a customer needs something she will sell to them at any hour without a problem. She has been running her business for five years and is very happy because she is able to earn money without neglecting either her house or her small baby, since the business is in her home.

This loan is for buying plucked chickens ready for sale, as well as feed for those that she is raising, which are still small. Herlinda has been in the communal bank since three cycles ago and she likes it because she has been buying necessities for her business with the loans.

Her dreams are to maintain her business and to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy plucked chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Elena Doraliza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Elena es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos  gemelos que tienen 1 año y seis meses  de edad. Su esposo es maestro en una escuela de la localidad.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes ya que son muy buenos agrega. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos y gallinas pero esto es más para su consumo aunque a veces vende algunos de sus animalitos a sus vecinos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 5 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante tanto en el Banco como en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Inmaculada meets every two weeks in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, known as the birthplace of the old fighter Eloy Alfaro and for its famous straw hats that are popular in and outside of the country.

Mrs. Elena is the founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because of its easy credit terms.  She is 38, married and has twin boys who are 18 months old.  Her husband is a school teacher in the town where they live.

She is a homemaker who earns an income selling Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week and sells on a credit basis, collecting payment on a weekly basis.  For over a year she has had this business, which is doing well.  Her best selling products are perfumes, which she claims are very good.  She also raises pigs and chickens for family consumption although sometimes she sells to neighbors.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and fashion jewelry.  She has been a member of the communal bank for five terms and likes the fact that loans are granted quickly.

Her goals are to be successful in both the communal bank and her own business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and fashion jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Martín  es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable el  cual   día  con día  lucha  para  sacar adelante  a  su  familia  ya que  es lo mas importante  en su  vida, con  esfuerzo  y  dedicación  a  ido  pagando  su   casa   y  su  mayor   sueño  es   acondicionarla   para   así  brindar a   su  familia  una excelente  calidad  de  vida,   en este  momento  el requiere  realizar  la construcción de  un cuarto en su   domicilio para   que su   familia  tenga  mayor  comodidad,  ve  en  el  crédito   la posibilidad  de  realizar  su proyecto.
texts.en: Mr. Martín is a hard-working, responsible person who struggles daily so his family can get ahead.  With much effort and dedication he has paid for his house, and his greatest goal is to improve it for the family to have an excellent quality of life.  Currently he wants to add another room to the house so his family can be more comfortable.  The loan will allow him to carry out his project.

loans.use: To carry out home improvement.

loans.name: Amarzaya

texts.en: Amarzaya is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in Yaarmag, Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband works in a private company. She manages a shoes and children's toy trading and computer-service business at a rented stall at Sutai trading center. Her monthly rent is 130,000 MNT. She started her business 2 years ago. At first she used to conduct only a computer services business. Then, with years of business success, she managed to open a shoes and children's toy trading business. She is a polite and kind woman who says, "I like to work hard in order to be my own boss." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT to purchase stationery supplies to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase stationery supplies.

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en: Odonchimeg is 40 years old. She lives with her son in a house in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her older daughter, who is a student, lives by herself. Odonchimeg manages a grocery trading business near to her home. She started her business in 2000 in a rented stall, at a local market. In 2003 she was able to expand her house in order to operate her business there. Now she sells all kinds of grocery items and some clothing. She purchases her grocery items once in a week from Ulaanbaatar city. She purchases her clothing once every two weeks from Ereen, border city of China. Her business has been quite successful, which has allowed her to employ two salespersons and one cleaner. She is planning to expand her business and to employ two more workers. She is a kind woman who says, "Because of good location, my business is flourishing fast. My store is located near to a secondary school and a train station, so I have many regular customers." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more products for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more products.

loans.name: Norbasa

texts.en:
Norbasa is from Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is a 42 year old married man with four living children. Rain or shine, Norbasa is always on the go transporting community members to each destination. He has been serving his fellow countrymen for four years already. This gives him a monthly income of PHP 1,000.00.

Norbasa is applying a loan of PHP 2,000.00 from GDMPC to purchase motor tires to replace the damaged ones. This is the 3rd time that he has borrowed from the organization since his commencement in 2010. Norbasa hopes to own one more motorcycle for hire to increase his meager monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase motor tires to replace deformed ones.

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita  is 21 years-old. She is married. In 2007, she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 previous loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Ramita plans to uplift the economic conditons of her family. She thanks you for your support. As a borrower, to improve living standards, extra training is needed. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her products in her restaurant business.

Maria has been in this business for 36 years. Maria earns additional income from another business, a sari-sari  (general) store.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 29 years old and married with 2 children. With both children in school, Mylene works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell.  She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is 63 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Noli has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Noli requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials needed for tailoring like textiles and thread.

Noli has been in this business for 45 years. In the future, Noli would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 42 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Rachel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from tailoring and a rice mill.

Rachel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Apsa

texts.en:
Apsa is 32 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Apsa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers & other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 5 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers & other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 70 years old and married. She has three children.

Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Cecilia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from coconut farming.

Cecilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 50 year old widow with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Norma has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like blouses and pants and also personal items like body lotion to sell.

Norma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like blouses, pants, body lotion etc., to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina works hard to support her family. Adelina is married and has a ready-to-wear (rtw) business in the Philippines.

Adelina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like blouses, t-shirts and body lotion to sell to her customers.

Adelina has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like blouses, t-shirts and body lotion to sell to customers

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie, 33, is married and has two children. One is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emie has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Emie requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Emie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.
Arlene works hard to support her family.

Arlene requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is 33 years old and married with five children. All of her children are in school. For the past three years, Benjie has run a vehicle repair business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Benjie is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her mechanics. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her mechanics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to improve her farming production.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 45 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Anselma has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling food and clothing. Anselma has repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF.

Anselma is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as soft drinks, detergent, and other products. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items, such as soft drinks and detergent, to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a printing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. Amy earns additional income from buying and selling purified drinking water. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and the support of loans through NWTF.

Amy is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her printing business. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her printing business

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 54 years old and married with four children. She lives in the Philippines ad works hard to provide for her family. For the past 30 years, Crispina has been running a business buying and selling bananas. She also earns additional income from running a general store and selling vegetables. Crispina has repaid 25 previous loans through NWTF.

Crispina is requesting a 24,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bananas to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is married and runs a fish-selling and fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has been in business for 10 years.

Delfina is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert aims to uplift the living conditions of his family. Unluckily, others said, "he was just a small farmer". However, Gilbert did not look at the negative side of this criticism, he is doing his best to correct them in their assumptions of his abilities. His faith in God remains.

Gilbert has three children already attending school. They are his inspiration to pursue his dream in life. He wants his children to finish their studies up to the college level. He wants to ensure their bright future, for he does not want them to experience life like he had been through, in his own childhood. 

Gilbert is requesting a loan amount of PHP10,000 to purchase manure as fertilizer sustenance for his rice farming business, to improve his production. He wantes to earn a higher revenue for the comfort of his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure as fertilizer sustenance for his rice farming.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is a married woman with 4 children. She lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur, with her family.

Rosana is a farmer. She has been growing and selling rice for 18 years. With her earning from farming, Rosana is able to feed her family and to send her children to school.

Rosana is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that, through her business, she will be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay for the labor fees she needs in the planting and maintenance of her farm.

loans.name: Jarkyn's Group

texts.en:
Jarkyn, 35, is the leader of this group. She is divorced and bringing up two teenage children by herself.

In 2007 Jarkyn decided to change her way of life. She used to work as a farmer, but never really enjoyed it. So she gathered all her savings—10,000 KGS—and took a risk by investing it a new business: selling retail kitchenware. Her oldest daughter assists her in her free time.

These four years have brought Jarkyn 3,000 KGS monthly and help the family meet its basic needs. Her loan will be used to buy more kitchenware to sell.

Jarkyn’s dream is to open her own small retail store to sell all kinds of household supplies.

loans.use: to buy more kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire fertilizer, insecticides and to pay for labor and the preparation of his land.

loans.name: Jyparkul's Group

texts.en:
Jyparkul, 53, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in the northern town of Kochkor with a population of more than 40,000 people.

Jyparkul is one of oldest and wisest women in the neighborhood and is well experienced in the local mode of life including cattle breeding. Through the past thirty years she has built a big household of her own and shared her successful techniques with the younger generation.

With the help of her five grown children, she manages her livestock and sends it to the highland pastures for the summer in order for them to grow and breed. Thankfully, the reselling of cattle generates a rather steady income.

Now that the summer is halfway through, Jyparkul would like to be able to send more cattle to pasture. She hopes to get a loan from Mol Bulak Finance in order to purchase more calves.

loans.use: to purchase more calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 65-year-old married woman who lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has a 24-year-old child.

Teresita is a farmer who primarily grows rice to sell. Teresita also runs a sari sari store. She sells items like noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

Teresita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm and more items to sell in her store such as canned goods and soft drinks. She hopes for her family always to be in good health.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm and more items to sell in her store such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara, 24, is the leader of this group. She grew up in a family of farmers and has been in this environment for her whole lifetime. She is comparatively younger than most of her colleagues in farming and cattle breeding, but her age doesn’t indicate her experience.

Even though Gulnara has two young children, she manages to devote a fair amount of time to developing her herd. The purpose of her loan is to buy additional livestock. Furthermore, she plans to discover new ways and techniques to produce quality farm goods and ensure a steady income for her family. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en: Ainagul, 57, is the leader of this group. Being born and spending her whole lifetime in the town of Kochkor, she has the spirit of a true Kyrgyz farmer in her. Her husband is a member of a farming committee and helps her in the fattening and selling of cattle. The couple started this business with the purpose of having an additional source of income four years ago. Since then, most of their profit has been put into purchasing more young calves for further fattening and selling. The initial investment for founding the business was 10,000 soms. The period of return was quite fast, because the monthly revenue sums up to 5,000 soms. The purpose of this loan is to purchase additional livestock for further fattening and selling. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Aijamal's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal, 43, is the treasurer of this group. She is married and bringing up four children. Her main lifetime goal is to provide good living conditions, opportunities for success and well-being for her children. Aijamal is a well-experienced seamstress. In addition, she is involved in cattle breeding. She considers giving her children a good college education to be her main accomplishment. They’re looking forward to being employed and making a contribution to the family budget. Aijamal sells the clothing and souvenirs she makes to her acquaintances and friends. Her purpose of applying for a loan is to increase the number of cattle she owns. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been operating a general store for three years to help her husband earn income for their family. Her three children are all now married and living separately from them. She is now 48 years old and enjoying her activity in retailing. She sells different kinds of groceries where her family gets their source of income for a daily living. 

Elizabeth is asking for a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of groceries such as soft drinks and food snacks to maintain her retail shop business. For the three years she has been managing her store, she has had a net income estimate of PHP 1,000 each month. Using this, Elizabeth was able to provide most of their daily basic needs while saving a little amount for future use.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks and food snacks

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Many Cambodian people hold multiple jobs to support themselves in the community.   Mrs. Srey and her husband always think about how to earn more income for their family. Presently, she is a powder seller in a market near her community.  Her husband is an excellent husband who always worries about earning income for his family.  He works as a trader of used cars.   They earn about $10 per day.   They have six children, three of whom are married and live in their own separate houses.  Mrs.Srey wishes to borrow a loan in the amount of $1200 to buy more used cars to sell.

loans.use: buy used cars to resell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, who is 49 years old, is from the province of Isabela. Imagine Isabela as a place of several hills, streams and lakes, which are still present as the remains of a broken ecology.
