Aida is married and owns a sari-sari store (community-based store) as it is commonly called in their bario (village). .

Aida started working with one of her sister's stores. She closed her business and so Aida decided to set herself to pursuing the business. She happily enjoyed doing the business and now is making gradual progress. She works alone in her store from 8 in the morning until 10 in the evening retailing food products. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy products like spices and soft drinks to sell in her store. With the help of this loan, she will do her best to improve her income. In the future, she would like to finish building her stall for more convenience to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products like spices and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: open an electrician business

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a resident, businessman and a farmer in Eldoret town, North Rift, Kenya. His farm produces milk, maize and vegetables. He also trades in poultry in the local market. He is married and has four children between 16 and 5 years old.

Samwel has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a transport venture. He says the venture will increase his income and enable him educate his children as well as offer security for his farming business. He aspires to have a fleet of motorcycles for the business.

Samwel says that the farming business is challenging because of the fluctuations in market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita, 39, is married and has nine children. Three are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Florita has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her business.

Florita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Florita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.

Helen is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita is 45 years old, married and has three children attending school. Leonita's spouse works as a local farmer. With her determination to succeed and increase her family's income, she runs a sari-sari store (variety store) and this drives her daily schedule. Leonita usually earns about 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. Income generated from the business goes to meeting daily needs at home and paying school fees and allowances of the children. Leonita wants to increase her sales capacity and that is why Leonita is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, bread and eggs to sell in her store. She hopes this loan will grow her operations. In the future, Leonita would like to keep making better sales and earn consistent profits. She also would like to educate all her children to have a degree someday and assure them a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, bread and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ambulant business of vending spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell for her ambulant vending business.

Marites has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.
 
Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Delia has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the repair of her motorcycle.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the repair of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda, a 49-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is a student, has been farming vegetables in the Philippines for 26 years now. Having borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, Melinda is now requesting a PHP 10000 loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to expand in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza is 27 years old and married. She has three children, ages 9, 7 and 2. She is a farmer who tills her land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She grows rice crops then sells her harvest to rice traders. She earns about 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. Aiza is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to be stable.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada, a 48-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for her family. Ada has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for eight years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, milk, canned goods, spices, etc. She is requesting a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Ada would like to save enough to money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old and a widow with five children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elena has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Elena aspires to save enough to build a house for her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 52 years old and a widow with five children.

Sonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Sonia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (restaurant) and charcoal sales.

Sonia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en: Julie Ann is 24 years old and married with two young children. She and her husband are farmers. They own and till land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. They grow rice crops to sell. Julie Ann says that with their earnings from farming, they are able to provide for their needs. Julie Ann has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes to earn more and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Phnom Penh is the city of Cambodia which has many kinds of jobs for people looking for work.  Mrs. Heng often thinks about how to make a profit for her family to feed and send her children to school and live a suitable lifestyle.  She works as a vermicelli noodle seller at the market and around her community.  She earns about $4 per day. To make more money, Mrs. Heng wishes to borrow loan in the amount of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike to  transport vermicelli in time to her customers.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to deliver vermicelli to customers

loans.name: Sernalyn

texts.en:
Sernalyn, 47, is widow with two children. One is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sernalyn has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like blouses, pants, etc., to sell. 

In the future, Sernalyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like blouses, pants, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has a machine shop business in the Philippines. Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and equipment for her business.


In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 37, is married and has three children. Two are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juliet has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Juliet requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials and equipment for her tailoring business. 

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn is a 34 year-old married who currently lives in the Reussey commune of Phnom Penh City.  She blessed with only child and still studying in the public school. She has no a life partner because she divorced from her husband she her kid was young.

To make a living, Mrs. Sorn always sells different kinds of product in the local market. Her goods are plastic products, fast foods, cooking ingredients, and soft drinks. From her business, she could be earned about $5 per day. Mrs. Sorn wishes to borrow in amount of $800 in the purpose to buy more necessary goods in order to expand her selling business. 

In the future, she will send a lovely kid to study at higher degree and repairing her old house.

loans.use: to buy more necessary goods in order to expand her selling business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, who is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family.  In business for 10 years now, she is requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her enterprise. In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her operation.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet, aged 30, is married to Peter and blessed with three children aged 10, 6 and 4 years old. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for seven years. She earns a monthly income of KES. 60,000.

This is her first loan with KADET LT. She will use the funds to buy five bales of wheat flour and maize flour, 90kgs of sugar and 90kgs of rice.

She hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung, the leader of this 5-member group loan, was born in 1966 and lives in Khu 5 village, where she has two children who are going to school. Her husband is a carpenter, and her family has a workshop where she and her husband work, earning a monthly income of about 7.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). This will be her first loan from SEDA as she seeks to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy wood.

The other members of the group are:

Gai, a 49-year-old mother of two children, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy chicken feed;

Oanh, a 33-year-old mother of three, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy wood;

Dan, a 42-year-old mother of two, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry;

Dinh, a 33-year-old mother of two, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 31 years old and married with five children. The oldest child is nine years old and the youngest is one.

Leah is a farmer who tills land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice crops to sell. Leah works hard to improve her business and support her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase quality rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is hoping that through her business, she will be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase quality rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to dig a pond for raising fish

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, aged 26, is married to Recklin and blessed with one child aged four. He supplies eggs to customers and has been doing that for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES. 47,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy 10 crates of eggs for resale.

Richard hopes to open an egg depot in the future.

loans.use: To buy 10 crates of eggs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and is married with two children. She wants her youngest child to finish college through the income from her clothing and dressmaking materials business. Generally, she earns an average net income of P2,500 each month.  

Part of the income she earns is used to meet their daily needs, pay her child's school allowances and pay bills such as electricity. She is determined to increase her income to meet all the needs of her family. 

Josephine is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy new clothing materials such as pins, fabrics, threads and needles to sell in her stall. She will also buy feed for her duck raising business. She says that this loan, when approved, will be very helpful in developing her business more.

loans.use: to buy new stock of pins, fabrics, threads and needles to sell

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 42 years old and is married. She has a 3-year-old child.

Ma. Cecelia and her husband are both farmers. They own and till land in Sta Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Rice is the main crop that they grow.

Ma. Cecelia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena is 57 years old and married. She has six children.

Buena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Buena has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Buena has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan.
 
Buena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years old and married. She has four children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines. She has been running the business for 21 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and rice farming. 

Susan has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Susan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale in market

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a forty-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a drug store for twenty-five years. Her hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the growing client base. Her vision is to own a pharmacy, to grow her assets and to educate her children. Rebecca needs the loan to buy medicines to sell.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 53-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 28 years old while the youngest is 12.

Mila is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She tills land where she plants and harvests rice. Mila is able to provide for her family's needs through her farm. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni, 48, is married and has four children. Three are in school. 

Laarni has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Laarni has been in this business for five years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Laarni requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like pin cushions, threads, tailor's chalk, etc.

In the future, Laarni would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials like pin cushions, threads, tailor's chalk etc.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina, 41, is married and has four children. One is in school. 

Melodina has a food-production business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Melodina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

In the future, Melodina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, aged 30, is married to Samuel, and they are blessed with one child.

She runs a beauty salon that has been in operation for one year. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 80,000.

This is her second loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the funds to buy hair chemicals and beauty products for sale.

She hopes to operate a beauty and fashion institute in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and hair products.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: We know that the field of farming is the one business in which it is very hard to earn more income to support a family to be as rich as others. But Mr. Huon and his wife try against the odds to make an effort every day to feed all the children so that none die and they have a good living standard. Both of them do this as farmers. They can earn about $5 per day. They had four children in burden, but now one of them is married and stays in a separate house. To create a big family in prosperity and as modern as others, Mr. Huon and his wife would like a loan in the amount of $300 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other materials.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, a 26-year-old single lady who runs a wholesale business that has been in operation for two years, earns a monthly income of KES.200,000. With a good credit history, this will be her second loan from KADET LTD with which she will purchase bundles of plastic bags, diapers and cartons of baby jelly for resale. Caroline hopes to open a supermarket in future.

loans.use: to buy diapers, bed sheets, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 33 years old and married with three children aged 15, 13, and 8. She is a farmer who works in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. Evangeline has been growing and selling rice for three years. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Evangeline is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to have a stable business that will enable her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy various vegetables in the market such as cabbages, eggplant and string beans to sell in her business stall at home. She works hard to improve her business for income needed by her family to be elevated from poverty. 

Susan is 32 years old, married to Roger and blessed with four children. Among them, three are still studying. Her husband's occupation is farming. She has been engaged in vending vegetables for one year now.  She earns PHP 1,500 per month doing this kind of activity. 

As her children grow, their expenditures also grow.  Thus, Susan and her husband look forward to supporting their daily needs sufficiently.

loans.use: to buy various vegetables such as cabbages, eggplant and string beans

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:
Okari, aged 30, is married to Hellen. He sells curios and has been doing this for eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES. 50,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy more curios for sale.

He hopes to join international exporters in the future.

loans.use: To buy curios

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food for his cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand and building blocks for sale

loans.name: Ma. Liz

texts.en:
Ma. Liz is 34 years old, married, and has five children. 

Ma. Liz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items to sell in her store. 

Ma. Liz has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income from meat and fish vending. 

Ma. Liz aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and snack foods to sell in her store

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en:
Mutinda, aged 40, is married to Kanini; they are blessed with four children between the ages of six and fifteen. He has a farm producing mainly maize, beans, and millet, and has been doing this for ten years. The business earns him a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

This is his second loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan funds to buy fertilizer for planting and to pay for labor. 

He intends to use the expected profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for planting and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is married and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 37 years old. 

Emelie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. 

Emelie has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old, married, and has two children. With both children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them. 

Josephine runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy inventory like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, eggs, spices, noodles, etc. 

In the future Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 41 years old and married to Stephen; they are blessed with three children. 

Ann sells fruits and vegetables, She has been in this business for the last six years and has an income of 6,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month. She is applying for her third loan of 15,000 KES from KADET Ltd. 

She plans to purchase vegetables, onions, tomatoes and bananas. She will use the extra profit to buy a water pump for farming. 

She hopes to own a dairy farm. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, onions, tomatoes, and bananas

loans.name: Marry

texts.en: Marry is 52 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family, buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. Marry has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been buying and selling of rice for five years and also earns an income from the rice mill operator. Marry aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон проживает в районе Яван. Ему 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Рахмон имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом у него имеется продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Rakhmon lives in Yavan. He is 48 years old, married, and has six children. His wife is a homemaker. Rakhmonov has a secondary education. He earns a living by breeding cattle. He has been doing this for over ten years.  In addition, he works in trade. Near his house he has a grocery store. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle and small livestock (like sheep or goats).

loans.use: to buy cattle and other livestock

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
43-year-old Virgie earns a living through farming. She is married and has six children. The oldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is eight. Virgie has been engaged in farming for 20 years. She grows rice and corn crops at her farm. Virgie said she sells her harvest to rice traders. She earns about 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Virgie has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Virgie hopes to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sman

texts.en: Mr. Sman works hard to support his family. This father of five children, all of whom are married and living separately, is a junk collector around the village and commune, earning about $3 per day. Sman is now requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to help purchase a new motorbike to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to support his business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is married and they have three children between 10 years old and three years old. She bakes and sells chips, eggs and others to the local people in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years now.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to put up a business premise for her business. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, open a big restaurant. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To put up a business premise

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: A married parent of two children, Editha works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling meat. Editha  is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional food ingredients for her restaurant business. She has been sustaining her business activities with her past 20 loans from NWTF. Editha hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en: Emerenciana is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for the restaurant she has run for eight years. She earns additiional income from motorcycle transport. Emerenciana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Lyrece

texts.en: Lyrece is 40 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family running a sari-sari(variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like milk and groceries in her store. Lyrece has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the sari-sari store for 17 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Lyrece aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Both Mrs. Hieng and her husband support their family by fishing in the Basaac River.  They earn around $6 a day.  They have two children.  In order to better support their family, they would like to request a loan of $400 to purchase a net and a machine to haul it.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and net hauling machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman who lives in Getafe, Bohol. She is 59 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for 10 years.

Virginia sells items like shampoo, coffee and canned goods. She also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community.

Virginia is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, rice and more items to sell such as canned goods and shampoo. In the future, she hopes for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, rice, canned goods and shampoo

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Two of his children are currently in school. David has a barber salon business, which he has had for three years.   

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a sterilizer machine for the hair.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, David hopes to expand his business. David is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase a sterilizer machine for hair.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is 63 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Cipriana is a rice retailer. She buys directly from farmers and sells rice to the people in her community. Cipriana is also a seaweed farmer. She is able to provide for her family through her earnings.

Cipriana is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell. She hopes for her business to grow. She also desires for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man is a widow who has two children, both of whom are married.  Mrs. Man is now old and cannot earn as much as before.  Her son-in-law supports his wife (her daughter) and Mrs. Man with his work as a pot seller in the market.  He earns about $3 per day.  She would like to borrow in amount of $500 in order to support her son-in-law's business.

loans.use: to support her son-in-law's business as a cookware seller in the market

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 29 years old and married with three children aged between two and 10 years old. She also takes care of five relatives. She sells charcoal and has six years experience in this business. She works from 6 am until 6 pm every day except Saturday.

Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the profits, she will invest in her business, pay school fees for her children, save for her future, and be able to buy a motorcycle to help her in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is 42 years old and is married with seven children. Additionally, she takes care of three relatives. Sauda sells food and drinks in her restaurant such as tea, bread, and so on. Her business is well-organized and she has one year of experience. Sauda works from five in the morning through nine at night and currently employs one person to help her.

Sauda is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via the Vision Finance Company to purchase more food and drink to sell in her restaurant. With her profits, Sauda will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase food and drink to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Druscillah

texts.en:
Druscillah is 27 years old and married with one child whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. She operates a general store in which she sells such things as electronics, clothes, household items, shoes and other items to the local people in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years now and has one employee.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy heaters, sockets, bulb holders and shoes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and in the future open another shop in the city centre. She describes herself as hardworking, dedicated and honest.

loans.use: to purchase heaters, sockets, bulb holders and shoes

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and married. She and her husband run a fishing business. Her husband operates their fishing boat and Gina sells his catch at the market. 

Gina has two children aged nine and three. She does her best to help provide their needs.

Gina has requested this loan to buy paint, plywood and other materials needed to repair their fishing boat. In the future, Gina hopes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy paint, plywood and other materials needed to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Margaret Auma

texts.en:
Margaret is a married lady with four children between 19 and five years old. She runs a tailoring services business in Nairobi. She has been in this business for six years and she says that her major challenge is financial constraints.

She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy fabric to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand her business and in the future, employ many tailors to meet customer demands. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to sew

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old and married. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Her husband operates their fishing boat and she helps him sell his catch at the market. Catalina also buys and resells seashells. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs.

Catalina has three children aged 17, 14 and 10. She hopes to send them to college in the future.

Catalina is requesting a loan to buy paint, plywood and other materials needed to repair her fishing boat. This will help Catalina and her husband continue their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy paint, plywood and other materials needed to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette runs a fishing business. She hires fishermen to operate her fishing boat and she sells their catch at the market. Bernadette is only 21 years old and has one child. She also buys seafood from other fishermen so she has more to sell.

Bernadette has requested a loan to repair her fishing boat. In the future, Bernadette hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Vestline Group

texts.en:
Furaha, who is in her mid-30s, is married with three children who all go to school. Since 1990, she has been a food vendor and has also sold powdered soap for the past four years. Furaha works from five in the morning through four in the evening every day and is able to make a small monthly profit.

Furaha is requesting her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy food items and wholesale powdered soap. She used some of her previous loans to start selling powdered soap: she buys the soap wholesale and then packs it into small packets that she sells door-to-door in the evenings. Furaha has also used her loans to expand her food business and pay school fees and household expenses. She has successfully repaid all of her previous loans. 

Furaha will share this loan with her loan group "Vestline" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a Bajaji (motorcycle) to help with transport for her business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and wholesale powdered soap

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim works hard to support her children in their educational attainment.  Presently she is a coffee seller near a market in her commune. She earns about $4 per day. Her husband purchases and resells cement, earning $7 per day.  To better support her family, Mrs.Kim requests a loan of $600 in order to purchase cement materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase cement materials for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 28 years old and married. For the past five years, she has successfully earned a living by selling child and adult clothing. Her business is well-organized. Joyce operates her business daily from seven in the morning through eight at night and she employs one person to help her. 

Joyce is requesting a Kiva loan via the Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying various types of clothing for children and adults. By expanding her clothing choices, she hopes to earn more profit. Joyce will save her profits for her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to expand her clothing selection

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years and she also earns an income from rice farming. Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

Rosalinda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bamboo. In the future, she dreams of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo to weave

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mr. and Mrs. Yu would like to support their two children in business.  Mrs. Yun is a vegetable seller in the market.  Her husband works as a construction worker in Phnom Penh.  To support her family, she requests a loan of $500 as a working capital loan for her vegetable business.  She will purchase more vegetables for sale in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Patriciah Nerima

texts.en:
Patriciah is a young married lady. She runs a beauty salon business offering beauty services to ladies in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years now and says her major challenge is financial constraints.
Patriciah is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair weaves to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She also hopes to have children and establish a good family in the future. She describes herself as a hardworking, dedicated, caring and loving lady.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 54-year-old widow with five children. For the past eight years, she has been raising livestock in the Philippines. She has sustained her business with 12 previous loans through NWTF.

Herminia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and additional livestock. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 35 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Dina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dina has been farming vegetables for nine years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Erlita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from farming coconuts.

Erlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jane Kerubo

texts.en: Jane is a widowed lady with four children aged between 3 and 16. She sells cereals at Nyalenda market in Kisumu. She has been running this business for five years now. She says that the business is profitable and the major challenge she faces is lack of sufficient capital to increase stock. Jane is using the loan to purchase cereals to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to wholesale and become a supplier of cereals, as well as diversify into a supermarket. Jane describes herself as sociable and humble.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ingredients for her food vending business.

Fely has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 36 years old. She is married and has three children aged between 11 and 18. 
Everlyne runs a grocery shop at Makongeni in Nairobi. She has been in this business for two years now and says her major challenge is financial constraints. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to add stock of onions, eggs and potatoes to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to wholesale in future. She describes herself as social, ambitious and God-fearing.

loans.use: to purchase onions, eggs and potatoes.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 35-year-old mother who has two school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been in this business for almost 15 years. 
Luzviminda is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides needed for good rice production. Luzviminda hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income. Currently, she earns 8,000 PHP each month in this field of work. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offer financial assistance to sustain crop production.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Joannes

texts.en:
Joannes is a farmer and a tailor in his hometown of Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with two children aged five and one and has been in farming for the last four years.

Joannes has requested a loan of 47,100 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him improve his family's living standards and educate the children. He plans to buy two more acres of land to expand his farming business.

Joannes says dry spells and pests are the common threats to farming output.  He is happy with Juhudi loan services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kilimanjaro Group

texts.en:
Edwin, who is in his late 20s, is single with one daughter of nine months.  He has been running a business selling chips with "mishikaki" (charcoal-broiled kebabs), eggs, sausages, juice, water and sodas for two years now. He works from 8 am to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase the business stock, started selling juice, water and sodas and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to buy a sack of Irish potatoes, one sack of charcoal and a small bucket of cooking oil. His dream is to one day be able to own a restaurant in a building.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kilimanjaro" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy a sack of Irish potatoes, one sack of charcoal, and a small bucket of cooking oil.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old and married with 7 children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store. Julieta has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Julieta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving and "nipa" business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional bamboo and stocks of "nipa" to sell for bamboo weaving and "nipa" business.

Violeta has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from selling bananas & vegetables.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional bamboo and stocks of "nipa" (palm fronds used in making mats for constructing huts) to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 44-year-old married lady and has one child aged 18. She runs a tailoring business where she makes and sells clothes to local people in Thika. She has been in this business for 15 years now and hires two employees. She says that the business is profitable and her major challenge is the low purchasing power of the local people.
Veronica is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy materials to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and diversify by building rental houses. She describes herself as hardworking, focused and patient.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a parent of six children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant ("carenderia") business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food production business for her restaurant.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family and to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food production business.
